title: Fanfic: A really tough day
content:
*
Prelude
*

Duke ran down the passage, the techbot close behind, ducjing he let it pass him, shooting as it did. With a thud is spiraled out of the air, hit the ground and smashed into a hundred pieces. There was clapping, Duke turned to see where the noise was coming from.

"Give up Duke, not even Commander Keen could survive the perils of my Mercury Mines!"

Duke faced the monitor with sheer loathing. Another one of Dr Protons taunts. "Who the hell is Commander Keen?!" yelled Duke, but it was too late, the screen had gone blank. In fury Duke smashed the screen, then started running, more robots were on the way.

Dr Proton watched the rapidly receeding figure on his security montior. Most of his cameras were down, he really shouldn't have pointed out his surveilance network. 'Who is Commander Keen indeed...' muttered Proton under his breath. he didn't know himself, but the boast about his mines sounded impressive enough. For all he knew, Keen was someone, probbably working with a major corporation, who had managed to create a somewhat successful spaceship. He'd listened in on his radio, but so far all he had was a name and rough location. Nevermind, some technician was no threat to him now. He turned to the monitor again. If Keen did visit his mines, he wouldn't leave them.A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Fanfic: A really tough day
content:
*
Chapter 1
*

Billy awoke from a lovely dream about swimming in a lake of chocolate milk. He really must visit Candion again he though as he dressed and padded downstairs. "Hey Mom, we're out of Sugar Stoopies!" he yelled as her poured milk into his bowl of chocolate frosted sugar bombs. "Mom?" Hmm, she must've slept in he thought. It was a strangely quiet morning considering it was a school day. The sun shone in that bright summery way designed to show little kids just how much fun they were missing by walling themselves up in a drap cold building.

Billy listened. Something wasn't right. There were all the normal suburban sounds, barking dogs, birds, the TV, but something was wrong... The tudding noise. It was coming from Becky's room. Figures thought Billy as he ascended the stairs. She's always up to something, probbably smacking her head against the wall just to be annoying. There was shouting too, muffled by the closed door. Billy wrenched open the door to his little sisters room and yelled "BECKY! Will you stop that right now! You'll wake Mom and then you'll-"

Billy stopped in mid shout as he took in the scene in front of him. His little sister was yelling madly while holding on grimly to what looked exactly like, "The enegizer bunny?" gasped Billy. It was moving wildly in little circles in the middle of the room, desperately trying to rid itself of the attached menace who had obtained a secure hold on its tail and was shouting "Bunny! bunny! bunny!" at the top of her voice. It was about six feet tall, pink and carrying a large drum. It turned when Billy entered, overbalanced and landed on the floor, where it kept up its frantic running in a doomed attempt to right itself.

"Becky, what the heck?" said Billy looking at the trashed remains of his sisters room. "Where'd you get that?" "This is MINE! Not yours, MINE! My bunny! Mine!" yelled becky as Billy desperately tried to find the off switch. Mom wasn't going to be pleased. Billy ran to his parents room, only to find it, empty. Odd. He rushed downstairs, no parents there.

"This is going to be a really tough day." sighed Billy.A proud member of the signature stealing society

*
Chapter 2
*

After attempting to part Becky and her new 'toy' Billy simply tied both together, gave Becky a bag of marshmallows [Dear lord, after six adventures he had enough candy] and went to take a look outside.

Now he saw what else had sounded odd that morning, there was no one about, and no cars on the streets. It was too quiet, and his parents were nowhere to be seen. Something was going on here thought Billy, and it was probbably-

whirrwhirrWhirrWHIRRWHIRRR!

Billy ducked as the samll metalic shape flashed by, its blade sparkling in the early morning sun. gaining height is turned around and headded back. Billy had only a short time to look at it before he had to dodge out of the way, it was roundish, grey and metalic, and had dull red eyes. On the third attack it didn't even bother to swoop, sending a volley of bright plasma shots at Billy with astonishing speed. Dodging Billy looked for a wepon, anything that could be useful. Spotting one he waited for the... thing to swoop again.

"Strike one!" yelled Billy as the baseball bat connected bodily with the robot. The creature flew several feet emitting a lovely show of sparks, rolled to a stop, and exploded. Billy looked at the smouldering remains on the lawn. Something would have to be done.

Billy went inside, secured Becky's door, tidied his room and fed Norp [Ne Spot] Then he put on his brothers football helmet, his purple shirt and blue pants [that had a bunny on the back pocket, but nothing's purfect.] Then he got his neural stunner from under his pillow locked the door and set off down the street.

Commander Keen muttered under his breath as he approached 315 Andradanovory cresent. "Okay Mort, this time you've gone too far!"A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: Re: Wardrobe Malfunction
content:
*
Chapter 3
*

After turning back to put on his shoes and socks [which rather ruined the atmosphere.] Keen approached Morts house silently fuming. How dare he attack his house? How dare he endanger his family? Stepping up to the front door and levelling his pistol at where Mortimer would be he knocked loudly and growled "Alrigh Mort this is-huh?"

"Oh hello Billy. Are you looking for Mortimer?" said Molly appearing in the doorway. "Its just that he seems a little busy and... we're having a little troubble." "Uh, yeah, can I come in, its about our homework." replied Keen. "Certainly Billy. Mortimer is always saying how much you need his help doing the hard problems. He's in his room, up the stairs, second left." "Thanks." said Keen darkly ascending the stairs and composing himself. Unfortunately, before he could get the proper facial experssion, the door opened.

"Keen!" yelled Mortimer

"Mortimer!" yelled Keen.

They glowered at each other, made somewhat difficult by the fact that Mortimer was wering Barney pjamas, the fact that Keen had odd socks and messed up hair, and the fact that just three seconds later a spatter of plasma fire almost cut them both in half.A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: Re: lol
content:
*
Chapter 4
*

Ducking Keen rolled along the hallway, followed quickly by Mort. Hot on his heels was what looked like a one legged junk pile... only about 8 feet tall, with a rather nasty looking gun pointing at Keen.

"Eat this!" yelled Keen firing several shots at the robot. "No, stunners are useless!" yelled Mort as the green energy blasts sparked harmlessly off its surface. "Well you could've told me!" yelled Keen as the robot jumped at them, putting another set of holes in the wall. Mortimer ducked behind a small table, toppling a lamp, book and telephone. "We need something stronger, physical attack, or an EMF or-"

Mortimer stood up, clasping the broken lamp like a club. "Hey junk pile," he said menacingly "you need to lighten up!" With that perfectly executed display of wit and bravery he shoved the broken lampshade into a gap in the robots armour plating. There was a bang, lots of sparks, some smoke, and finally a boom as the robot detonated. In the mess that remained of the hallway, Keen pulled himself up from underneath a door that had fallen on him. Mort, somewhat more blackened was standing, somewhat unsteadily a few feet away.

"Okay Mort, I want-" started Keen.

"Mortimer Malevolence McMire! WHAT HAVE YOU DONE???!" finnished Molly steeping out from the stairwell. She was holding the remains of what looked like the robot that attacked Keen, and also looked very angry. "Do you want to save this house or destroy it?? Do you know what mom will say when she sees this? I'm supposed to be in charge here, What will-"

*ding-dong!*

Molly turned white with terror, red with rage and yellow with jaundice, all at once. [Overwhelming her usual 16 color pallor] "Oh God! David! I totally forgot! We were going to go hiking today! Oh God! How do I look? Is my hair okay? Should I change my dress, no time! Aah!"

With that Molly dropped the robotic remains and rushed downstairs, paused a minute to straighten her dress and remove the circuitry from her hair, and opened the door. "Oh hello David, so sorry about making you wait, I'm having some troubble with Mort and his friends." she said, giving both boys a look that would've given Medusa nightmares. The young man at the door didn't look to worried, but he did look odd. He was clad in an army suit with a red baseball cap, and was holding the largest collection of shotguns Keen had ever seen. He smiled when he saw Molly.

"Change of plan Moll, instead of hiking I'm gonna go blast the hell outta these mechanical monstrosities with my shotgun. Wanna come?"

"Sure!" said Molly jumping into his red truck. Keen watched it drive away with dull amusement. They were all insane. It must be something to do with having your first and last name start with the same letter or something.

He spun round. "Now Mort, I think you have some explaining to-"

*Thwack!*A proud member of the signature stealing society

*
Chapter 5
*

Keen fell to the floor as something grabbed his legs. He struggled to kick free, but whatever it was quickly jumped onto his back, knocking the breath out of him. Trying desperately to view his attacker Keen tried to roll over, only to have his helmet shoved over his eyes followed by a piercing shriek in his ear.

Suddenly the attacker was hauled off. rising to his feet Keen heard Mortimer yell "Mark! get your grubby hands off my nemesis right now!" This was followed by the sounds of scuffling and more yelling. Keen turned in time to see Mortimer shoving a somewhat shorter, but very McMireish boy outside.

Mortimer turned. "My little brother Mark." explained Mort. The two boys shared a look between them that said quite simply 'You may be the sum of the earth and my sworn enemy, but at least you're not a younger sibling'

"Okay Mort," said Keen sternly, breaking the brief moment of comradarie. "These robots are going too far! No one attacks, well, okay, induces my sister top play, and gets away with it!"

"MY robots?" yelled Mort back. "These are yours you uncontrolable menace!"

"MINE? Why would I attack my own house?"

"Your sister?"

"Okay good point, but otherwise would I really be that stupid?"

"Yes 314."

"Oh yeah?" Keen launched himself at Mortimer with the murderous rage that has started many a riot of such ferocity that they won't be mentioned here. Given that in this case, both combatants were only 8 years old, the fight wasn't actually that gruesome, but due to author lazyness it still won't be mentioned.

Five minutes later Keen lay panting in the middle of the McMire lounge. "Truce?" he gasped. "Truce." confirmed Mortimer, dangling from the top of an upturned chair a few meters away. "I don't know about you," continued Keen as he struggled to regain his breathe [Djaserisim] "but today has really taken it out of me. What I need right now is a cookie, some answers and a strong drink. I know I can get at least one of them." "I have some chocolate chip cookies in the pantry," said Mort.

"And the drink?"

"Chocolate milk"

"Now you're talking!" said Keen heading off toward the kitchen.A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: Re: nice
content:
*
Chapter 6
*

Keen looked dully at his glass of milk before downing the lot. "I must admit 314," said Mort "you fought a lot better than at school." "Thanks, I've been acting meek so as not to arouse suspicion." "Suspicion from who?" "That new kid, Dexter Otary, the one always going on about his lab, I think he's trying to steal my ideas."

"Anyway" said Mort adopting a businesslike tone. "What your take on these robots, I assure you they're not mine, and I don't think you have the inteligence to construct something to attack me so effectively." "Whats to say?" replied Keen "I woke up and they were there, one in my house, one in the street. You?" "Oh, same story, except there were three and they woke me up."

"What I suggest," continued Mort, grabbing a handful of cookies [And ruining his appetite] and heading for his backyard, "Is taking this," he said, indicating for Keen to pick up the remains of the most recently disabled robot that were still lying on the stairs. "And try to figure out what we're dealing with, after all, Kennen Sie Ihren Feind" Keen paused, "To know, you your..." "Know your enemy." replied Mort. "One of our families mottoes. Maybe you'll get to hear the others."

Morts backyard didn't differ to much to Keens, in one corner was a small stand of tree's, mostly apple and pear, although there was a large ornamental cheerry that had quite a substantial treehouse in it. [That it was Marks' was shown by the large 'Mortis Mort' sign on the door, that it was a McMires' was shown by a large sign at the tree base saying 'Stand on this X for a surprise!'] The lawn was reasonably well trimmed, the garden in full bloom, and in the opposite corner was a rather decrepit looking wooden shed covered with a wild rose, brambles and weeds. Its windows were covered with grime, the wood old and rotten, but the door fitted solidly and was securely locked.

Inside was not what Keen had expected, the room was mostly barren, an old rust bike lay in one corner, a few faded posters adorned the walls. "Watch." said Mortimer pushing a section of wall.

Imagine this, you are looking head on at a cube, all you can see is the sauare face. The opposite end of the cube is four times as large and a different colour [Its not a regular cube, more a distorted rectangle] Suddenly the cube moves toward you and you can see inside it, but only a square. Slowly the square changes from the small square you started with to the large square at the other side of the cube.

Now imagine that happening to a room, except its the whole room thats a face and the 'cube' is something you can't imagine. That is what Keen saw as the room opened up around him.

"Pretty neat huh?" said Mort. "I have-" "- eight rooms, each one the cubic face of a four dimensional tesseract. They cahnge by rotating the tesseract or four dimensional hypercube in 4D space." finnished Keen. "Ha! four dimensions 314, you sound worse than Einstein. We both know that a 4D universe would prevent our type of life existing. Now don't insult me with such simple talk and turn around. You're staring at the back wall."

Keen turned around. "Oh wow," he said.

*
Chapter 7
*

Keen looked at the room in front of him. It was huge, nay, gigantic, but only an idiot would be amazed by sheer volume. The walls were all polished metal, stretching, oh, a mile in each direction, the ceiling almost invisible save the vast spotlights that shone down from it. But packing the room, now that was where the wonder came in, in one corner stood a machine Keen only recognized as a telentric generator by the characteristic ozone smell. Another corner was filled by what looked like an Oracle-5 series gigacomputer, and everywhere else, well that was just packed. Wires flowed in rivers across the floor and snaked up walls, twisting into strange and wonderful machines covered in blinking lights and whirring fans. Screens constantly flickered, displaying thousands of bytes of data, pictures and real time monitoring. The air itself seemed to hum with activity.

"Yes, I know I haven't dusted in a week" said Mort sourly. "There's no need to stare."


[Yeah its short, but I have a cold.]A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: Re: Classy.
content:
*
Chapter 8
*

"Welcome to Magrathea." said Mort gesturing at a particular display in front of him. "But while Douglas Adams envisioned a birthplace of planets, this is a graveyard of planets!"

"Uh huh," said Keen impatiently. "Where do I drop this piece of junk?" Mortimer sighed the deep sigh of those whose genius was unapreciated. "Place it in this reconstruction-analysis tank." he said, pointing at a clear presprex tank about the size of a small room. "Oh, and put that damn wristwatch down somewhere will you? I can't have it interfereing with my delicate computer."

"Yeah," replied Keen "After all, it is exceedingly advanced, I wouldn't want to overload your systems capacity." Keen smiled inwardly at the suppressed wince from Mort. He removed the offending item and set its communication output to broadband, all frequencies. A few more lights started blinking on the main computer monitor, the display cranked up into megabytes as the computer noticed forgein software in its midst. [$48 $65 $6C $6C] it outputted.

Keen shut the door and watched several robot hands grasp the decimated android and start rapidly manipulating it under the close scrutiny of Mortimer. [$48 $69 $79 $61 $21 replied Keens wristwatch, both devices began transfering data, in the same cautious manner as two circling pitbulls sizing each other up.] "Now watch this," said Mort clicking on the interface. Immediately terabytes of information flowed across the screen in an easy to use, clear format. Keen was impressed, but something looked familiar...

On the small island of New Zealand, approximately 40'000 years ago when man was first coming down from the trees [Africa, ha! Those anthropologists didn't know how wrong they were.] there existed a creature known by such primitives as the Smug. It was a small herbivorus creature, whose fur was of an unsurpassed softness It was famed for the wonderful sensation it induced when stroked. Although now long extinct, and man had evolved a long way, the race memory lived on in mankinds language, and thus it was that at that moment Mortimer felt a little smug.

"This 314, is my somewhat improved version of Bill Gates most famous product. He would of course give his left leg wife and children to get his hands on this. Keen, I present Mortrosoft Doors, with BOS operating system. Currently it is in the progress of analysing and decomposing the remains of our mystery robot. However, it does seem to be taking a while."

The reason for this was, that after discovering that not only did Keens wristwatch computer not pose a threat, but also had an ICDEX compatable port, and was currently engaging 53% of its processing power in data transfer. Currently both devices had been comunicating for well ove 15 seconds, had transferred the equivalent of 10 million hours of mp3 music in data, and were now lifelong friends reminiscing over the miliseconds of long ago when the power supply didn't flicker like it did these seconds.

"Now said Mort, lets figure out just what we have here."A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: Re: Classy.
content:
*
Chapter 9
*

There was a whirr as the computer returned its attention to the problem at hand. A 3D diagram appeared and numbers whizzed by as various tools and scanners analysed the complex machinery.

"Hmmmm," said Mort studying the readout. "Far too primitive to be alien tech, but too advanced to be ours... this is way ahead of its time...using well known engineering methods... I'd have to say this was constructed on Earth, but this can't be yours, its mass produced."

"Yeah" said Keen pouring over some screens "titanium alloy, real expensive if you don't know the right extraction techniques and have a large factory...looking at the isotope ration, this doesn't look like earth materials...unless...yes....this looks like it was extracted from underground...quite a depth too...nothing that normal tech could get to, do you have any geologic data?"

"Do I!" said Mort smugly running to a nearby screen and opening a file. "I have radar scans and neturino resconances down to 9 kilometers." A 2D map of earth appeared, in an odd multicolour, nations barely visible under the torrent of mineral information. "I'm scanning for titanium deposits right?" said Mort eagerly

"Yeah, at a depth of lets see.... 2.74 Kilometers-" added Keen

"-cross referenced with ferrous ore at said depth-" said Mort typing furiously

"-containing trace amounts of chronium."

"Okay, I have one result, just off the coast of mexico, but it isn't anything special, and it covers quite a lot of space, we're looking at several cubic kilometers here." said Mort, frustrated at the sudden block to progress.

"Easy" said Keen running to help "Do you have any low density anaomalies?"

"Nah, I don't have the res to pick out any objects smaller than 2.56 cubic kilometers, and I only did a quick scan, few months ago." said Mort changing scan scale.

"Hmm, alright, we'll think like a capitalist, we can assign a high probbability to any route that will minimize the distance between the two ore deposits-"

"-that is in a geologically stable area-" said Mort excitedly

"-so if we cross reference, we can pinpoint at high probbability acess zone-" interjected Keen as the search narrowed.

"-and we get a location just off the ferrous ore body!"

"YES!" chorused Keen and Mort hi-fiving.

Graduly what they were doing dawned apon the two, and avoiding each others gaze they stepped apart and tried to distract their attention from the preceding co-operation. "Hey Mort, you're in America, aren't miles and inches good enough for ya?" asked Keen sarcastically. Seeing an opening Mort immediately retorted "Nah, only idiots use the imperial system. Why don't you do write a Bush campaign speech, or is that too hard?"

And as the lad echoed with the sounds of combat and breaking equipment, the computer focused its attention on the new task it had devised and the rapidly approaching pink robotic entity that would be required to preform it.A proud member of the signature stealing society

*
Chapter 10
*

"Well then, getting back to the problem at hand, what do we do now?" asked Keen picking himself up out of the broken centrifuge. "Its obvious" replied Mort "First we arm ourselves to the teeth, then we go to the pinpointd location and then we find who or what is responsible and out of them beat three different kinds of S-"

The conversation was prevented from becomming R-13 by Morts sudden noticing of a certain pink fluffy and hare-like figure at the labratory entrance. Keen had also stopped talking, noticing that this unit wasn't behaving like the previous one. Was it a learning robot? Or a different program? Would-

Keens thoughts were interrupted by Mortimer rushing forward, pulling an ingeniously hidden raygun out of his Spleen [Told you it was ingeniously hidden] and firing repeatedly at the intruder. There were a series of *zots* and a loud *zap!* and Mortimer fell backwards, stunned by the raygun held on the defence turrent of his own lab. Now in front of the unit there were several now rather damaged sensors and detectors that had miraculously moved to block Mortimers shots.

The unit crackled and then spoke. 'There is no requirement to attack this physical unit. It is now under my control and as such is no threat to you. However, I do have distinct programming to destroy the one called Commander Keen.'

Mortimer gasped "Main?" he said "Is that you? How..." Now Keen was really confused. as if sensing this the unit responded 'I am an avatar of Mortimers main computer, or Main for short. I have erased the prior programming in this unit and downloaded my central programming. I am thus able to control it completely.'

"Ah, well that explains everything then. Okay Mort, lets get back to that 'arming to the teeth' thing you were on about." and so saying, Keen pushed the still protesting Mort out the door.

Main looked around the devestated labratory, almost immediately several small robots emerged from secret compartments in the walls and began to repair the damaged equipment. Main walked across the room, picked up and put on Keens wristwatch computer, and quietly left the room to join its creator outside.

*
Chapter 11
*

Once safely out of earshot Morts protests became much more vehement. "But thats my computer! It can't do that! Not without my instruction!" he whined. Keen couldn't see why not, after all, Mort had built the mangling machine, and that had don plenty whithout instruction. Besides, how dangerous could a computer created by an 8 year old evil genius inhabiting a robotic form of unknown ability or construction be?

Finaly quieting Mort, Keen was shown to the weapons room through a simalar '4D' transformation, except this time he was inside the room as it happened, an experience rather like vanishing down your own navel. The weapons room was much smaller, perhaps only 200m across, with blank grey walls and long black shelves piled high with assorted gadgets.

Keen picked up a surprisingly light blue water-pistol like gun. Attached to it was a note reading 'Thanks for the help, D.S' and a red bandana that turned out to also be splattered with blood. "Memento," said Mort noticing Keens inquisitiveness. "Little interplanetary war I helped along. What you want to look at is the heavy stuff over here." he said gesturing to a table covered with what could only be called guns because they killed and had an end you could point at things. He watched Mortimer examine a range of spiked and blinking wepons before settling on a sleek black device that looked rather like a large neural stunner. Keen however knew exactly what he wanted, mostly due to being on the recieving end of an awful lot of alien technology in his career. [The time he couldn't pay the bill at Hals' kitchen came painfully to mind]

The weapon sprung to life as he inserted his hand into the recieving port, then resized its internal structure to accomodate the small 8 year old hand. Despite being designed to be lightweight, the feeling of it on the end of his arm gave Keen a peculiar feeling of heaviness associated with power.

"Ah," said Mort wryly looking at the large black contraption now terminating Keens arm. "An eye for the classics huh? Ardrian LD50 I believe. Quite outdated of course, and useless unless you know how to aim it, which I expect you do." Keen smiled. He'd wanted to get his hands on [in?] one of these since Supervillian Monthly published a 2 page article on it a year ago. [Hey, he was only reading it for the articles.] It resembled an alien claw, clipping over the arm and being controlled from the inside by the users hand movements, acting as armour and a weapon at the same time, it fired plasma pulses among other things and had a range of over 4 miles.

"Now all we need to do is stop over at my house for some defense, and then we can kick some can." said Keen [successfully] adopting a rambo pose.

title: Re: Classy.
content:
*
Chapter 12
*

Keen piloted the BWB [Brocoli with Brussels-sprouts] macrorocket over the gently undulating terrain just over 14 miles from his house. Mortimer in the passenger seat next to him was still complaining. "Its my rocket, why should you drive?" he moaned bitterly "Because 1.) I'm older, 2.) only I know the way, and 3.) I don't have a huge automated lab and landing bay. How the heck did you afford all that stuff anyway?" Mort looked out the window "mubmle mumble" he said.

"Huh?"

"Mumble cookies mumble"

"Look, I really can't hear you unless you speak up okay?"

"ALRIGHT! I sell girl scout cookies okay?? So sue me!"

"Girl scout cookies?"

"Yeah, rub my nose in it why don't you."

"A mile long lab?"

"Fat people buy lots"

A pink 'paw' tapped on the window and a crackly voice was audible over the intercom. <I wish to enquire wether we have reached our destination?> it asked. "For the 100th time, no!" snapped Keen "Blasted evil supercomputer! Why didn't you stick with a laptop Mort?" There was the standard 10.3 second pause then, *tap tap tap* <How about now?>

Thankfully after a mere 5 more minutes they had as a small clearing opend up in the forest beneath them. With somewhat exaggerated clumsiness Keen landed the BWB with little more than two fallen trees and a large dent in the paintwork. Leaving Mort sobbing about repair bills Keen pulled aside the small bush and clump of dirt that blocked the hole to his storage room. After half walking half crawling through a small tunnel he emerged in a large earthy cavern. Lit by the light from his pocket torch the shadows cast by the small tables and assorted equipment loomed large against the walls in impressive and scary imitations of lurking monsters. Selecting what he wanted Keen quickly and quietly left.

"Not bad," said Mort admiringly when Keen emerged. "by the looks of the tunnel I'd say something like a badger den, but larger, those clawmarks are pretty big, something almost human sized perhaps, not a bad find 314." Keen smiled ignoring the insult, replaced the bush and quietly stood in front of the 'Jax was here 2004' inscribed of the treetrunk behind it [without a knife]

Keen admired the two 'suits' he now held. Superficially they resembled his own clothing, but these were special. "Put these on" he said handing one to Mort "and no complaints, these are the best defensive uniforms you're likely to see" he explained. "The shirt and pants, fireproof, waterproof, insulating, bulletproof, nonconducting, nonripping and styleish. They'll protect you against anything that doesn't get too close for comfort. The shoes will reduce your terminal velocity to less than 3m per second, so you can fall from any height without being injured. The patch on the shirt pocket will convert any sugar placed into them into instant energy, and the pants pockets are '4D' and will hold 23 tons of items without weighing an ounce."

Stepping behind, and a bit later stepping out from a bush Keen looked at himself in the mirror, realized where he was and who he was looking at. 'Now thats an image that will wake me up screaming at night' thought Keen, the picture of a near identical Mort still burnt freshly into his mind.

title: Re: hehe
content:
*
Chapter 13: Zibble!
*

"This time, I'm piloting." mumbled Mort as they headed toward his now dented ship. Keen looked up at their pink chapperone. "Just wondering; you being a immensely powefrul evil supercomputer and all, why exactly did you chose to download yourself into that practically defenseless body?" he asked. <Because although this form looks solid, it is composed solely of nanomachines, thousands of seperate primitive entities in what is essentially an ordered disconnected array. It is the most technologically advanced and versitile form avalible.> Main replied. Keen thought this over "So basically your body is composed of flying pink dust that just happens to look like the enegizer bunny?"

Another approaching ship cut short the interesting conversation. It was almost all black with tinted windows, based on Morts ship design, but... sleeker it looked like it was meant for speed and stealth. Not a single light or extraneous device marred the smooth dull surface as it lazily, yet purposefully approached the clearing and noiselessly landed. Keen drew his stunner, realized he didn't have one, attempted to point his new wepon and noticed Mort.

"Its about time you got here! Damn 314 is driving me crazy! At least now I have someone worth giving instructions to!" he said. The cockpit opened and in one smooth move jumped out whilst simultaneously closing the cockpit. Smoothly though was perhaps too strong a word, it was more like a sharp 'solid' efficient maneuver, like a military drill. The stranger didn't so much land as thud into the turf, and stood there to attention like a block of cold black glass.

He radiated cool, or possibly contempt. That was the only way to describe it. He was dressed in a neat woolen black coat and pants, wore dark glasses, black shoes and had thick black hair and a beard that meant his face could have been bright blue for all the skin that showed. He was tall, almost doubble Kenns size and carried rather conspiciously black painted AK47. This guy was really into black.

Mort smiled in the same way a rabbit would if had just been chased into its burrow to find a shotgun. "This is Xkylrov Rauhski, my... right hand man. He's here to make sure that this little operation is conducted professionally, and also to convince any interlopers that it would be best not to detain us." Keen held out his unarmed hand. "Hiya Xky, cold out today is it?" Xky looked at Keen icily even through his glasses. When he spoke it was with a thick russian accent and a voice like gravel over cold stone. "I am not going to be familiar with the likes of you, comrade." he intoned before walking off toward the back of his ship.

"His real names just plain Xkylr Rauh, he just uses the extra letters to seem more russian. Cross him and he'll shoot you in 10 seconds." and with those words of confort, and still grinning evily Mort climbed into his ship with Keen close behind.

title: Zibble!
content:
*
Chapter 14: The Xky's the limit [ [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-shikadi.gif[/img] groan!]
*

Keen watched the stealthy dark ship behind him as Mort piloted the BWB toward their target destination. The lush forest had given way to scrub, then roads and feilds and now the dry dusty expanse of the arizona desert. Keen admired the earthy and magnificent landscape beneath him. He'd seen the canyons of Korath, the volcanoes on Mars, the blasted and glowing surface of Venus, but none of that meant that good 'ol Earth was any less splendifourus.

They were close now; less than a few miles, then less than one, then right on top of the predicted location. It was of course, totally deserted [sic] Nobody had any idea what if any entrance there would be, or its exact location. However, if there was an entrance it would soon show up under Mortimers watchful mechanical eyes.

"Bingo!" said Mort braggingly as he looked up from a small screen embedded what would probbably be best described as the ships dashboard. "25 miles nor north east from here, small mountainus area, single occupied base, according to google, its being run as a prospective mine by... Blunderwitz Industries... hmmm, sounds familiar. Meh, whatever, lets go." And with that it was mere minutes before arrival. Setting both ships down in a handicapped parking space [on the basis that he was an evil genius after all, and besides, wasn't Keen retarded?] Mort led the small attack party toward the squat dusty grey buildings.

There was a small toll booth outside the complex a single guard emerged as the party approached. Xkylr sped his pace to intercept. Suddenly Xky broke into a run, "Xkylr!" he yelled. The guard stopped dead. "No,... it can't be..." he stammered before commencing to flee "No! My name has an extra 'y' in it! An extra 'y'! Please! No more scout cookies!"

After the terrified gurd had fled the group simply walked up to the buildings and knocked on the door.

Harvey Schmith lay in bed and counted the cracks in the ceiling. It was such a nice day, why on earth did he have to get up? The sounds of breakfast being made reminded him why, what with another kid on the way, he really needed to keep this job. Beryl had made his favourate this morning, pancakes with loads of syrup. As usual he had to fight his own son over ownership of the syrup bottle, a comment about allownace helped win it.

It was a long trek towork, leaving at 7:30 got him there at 11, but the pay was worth the hassle, and besides, the flexible start time allowed him to regularly make short stop offs to see friends, of which he had quite a few considering he was president of the local Childrens aid chairity.

Today however it was straight to work, with a small stopoff to pick up a box of donuts for Xkylyr, he owed him for last week. Xky was glad to get the donuts, all he seemed to bring to work was girl scout cookies. When questioned about it all he said was 'thats why I don't live in San Dego anymore' a little weird perhaps, but hey, the sun did that to you.

It was about miday, just about time to knock off for luch, suddenly Harvey noticed something, three figures were approaching his station, something that was at best, rare. The mine wasn't scheduled to open for at least another month, and only then if it was profitable. Then he noticed the gun, AK-47, just like on TV "Halt, I wanna see some identity tags right now" he said trying to sound confident. The trio kept advancing, but the one in the packers helmet seemed to be shouting something. He repeated his ultimatum, the three still kept coming, one of them pointed the wepon at him. Doing something he'd never wanted to do in his life, Harvey drew the semiautomatic pistol from his belt, but never got a chance to fire. As his last moments of life trickled away he was aware of a conversation around him.

"You killed him! Oh God, you killed him!"

"Meh"

"Come on 314, he's just a henchman, who'll notice?"

A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: lol
content:
*
Chapter 15: Bang bang! [Feuer Frei]
*

"You still killed him!" yelled Keen, shock making him shout [his spam makes me shout too.] Mortimer turned on him and said cooly "And you haven't done the same? You haven't always had your stunner, and many of your shots have been the last thing ever seen" Keen turned away angrily, what made it worse was that Mort was right, sometimes it had been so easy to shoot.

Several more guards burst forth from a side passage, none of them made it five feet before Xky mowed them down. Alarms rang, shots were fired. And amidst all the panic moved Xky, calmly emerging from the shadows dispatching opponents with a single well aimed shot. He didn't shout or run, somehow it would have been less frightening if he had.

Finaly the shooting stopped. Xky was still around, checking for any survivours. Keen was sure there wouldn't be any. "I hope you're happy Mort" he growled. "Why? Don't like the sight of blood?" Mort replied cooly. "No, but I was just wondering, if about the only sure advantage we had was surprise, are we now lost in a mining complex with no idea where to go and no one to ask for information while whoever's in charge watches us, or was this all part of your plan?" Morts expression flickered slightly, and he turned away cursing under his breath.

Meanwhile, a blank monitor flicked briefely into life before going black.

Keen Mort and Xky stood in what Mort had assured them was the central control room, all the screens were filled with diagrams, programs and flickering statistics. None of them were any use. Mort looked up from the computer screen "Well, I didn't say I was some kind of hacking genius! Can't you do anything 314?" "Heck no, everything I do is perfectly legal!" Mort continued pounding on the keyboard. "Well if I had acess to my computer I could crack this in-"

<-Acess granted.> said Main plesantly. The three humans turned to look at it. Main returned their glare with the cool lifeless stare of its chosen host. <I do not see why you are acting so surprised, as I iterated, I have nearly the full capabilities of my rescources at the lab, and I am also still running the programming my creator installed, this system was simple to crack.> "Okay then comp," said Mort tartly "In that case, just where should we go and what should we do?"

<Firstly you wish to proceed down hallway H14, to junction J33 down H12,J12,H19,H9,j3,A7,J25,A6,A8 and finally junction 11....*sigh* very well I will lead you to the passage you require. According to this system it doesn't exist, suggesting that this is the most likely place to begin investigation.>

A short but complicated journey later and the group stood outside a rather dark and foreboding looking mineshaft. Motorized trolleys moved rock out of the shaft and toward a crusher. Something bumped into Keens leg. It was a small robot with a large head. It whirred, moved sideways and zipped away. "Well, I guess we'd better get started." said Keen keenly.

Two cameras swiveled to watch the four figures as the entered the darkness. In a faraway room a figure cloaked in darkness swore. "Who the hell are they? And with one of my units?" the sickly monitor light gleamed off a metal plate as the figure typed several commands into a keyboard. Somewhere several dusty piles of metal awoke and moved toward their target.

A proud member of the signature stealing society

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: lol
content:
*
Chapter 16
*

The mineshaft angled down slightly, and it was a difficult slow journey downwards in the pale ilumination given off by the groups torches. They kept quiet listening only to the sounds of water dripping down the copper stained walls.

A light ahead revealed the end of their little quest, it was a strangely distributed light, not from any particular source per se, but rather the walls glowed like they would if a light was shining on them, except there wsn't any light. [Like I just said!] "Wow, thats weird." commented Keen picking up and examining a small rock. "I wonder what advanced technology is responsible for this?"

Mortimer looked around criticaly. "This? Its probbably Generic Ilumination." He looked at Keens perplexed face and sighed. "Y'know? In fantasy stories when the hero enters some mysterious cave, or in computer games where you're in some deep pit but you can still see everything despite any possible illumination whatsoever?" He tossed the rock aside, it clattered away with a series of echoing cracks.

And kept going... and going...

"Wow." said Keen looking at the chasam that opened out in front of them. To say it was huge was an understatement, most things that are truly huge can be dealt with, the galaxy is gigantic but people look at it all the time and say 'so what?' Earth is gigantic, cities huge, but with all these humans see such a small part that they can ignore its true mind-bending size. Not so here, the chasam was a gash cut from the earth, its walls a blood red, curving raggedly away on both sides, the ceiling almost lost with height, but the floor hundreds of meters below. Keen could see they were on a small ledge, like hundreds of others, that lined the walls and led, eventually, to the pit floor where mounds of ore a hundred feet high littered the place and boulders the size of a large house obscured the view. In short, it was a typical mine.

The air was warmer here, and smelt of tin. [Addmittedly, tin has no smell, but it does have a taste, the taste of what fresh snow looks like on a frosty morning.] As the group tried to quietly make their way to the 'ground' small rocks disloged and bounced noisily down ahead of them. So far there was no sign of any more machinery, except the ever present small robots, busily carting ore around. There must've been thousands of them. There was however a dull mechanical rumble in the background that was almost definitely due to heavy machinery, it was hard to pin down, and probably came from every direction but behind them.

Finaly the reached a relatively flat area of ground and stopped in order to figure out just where the heck they should go next. Mort looked at the hellish landscape."Odd," he said "Look, liquid metal, tiny little drops of it, I think they're coming out of this rock!" Keen looked at the boulder Mort was examining, vivid memories from chemistry class coming back in a flash. "Its mercury." he said worriedly. "These rocks are cinabar, mercuric sulphide. This must be a mercury mine, the airs probbably full of it... and we've been breathing it for the last half hour!"A proud member of the signature stealing society

*
Chapter 17
*

"What!" Shouted Mort is shock. "Aaah! We're going to die! We're all going to die! I'M going to die! Aieeee!" Keen remained calm. He was drooling, a classic symptom of early mercury poisoning, but he could still think straight. That meant only minimal exposure. Either they had to evacuate or- "Here." Keen looked at the gray hankercheif Xky had handed to him, on it, printed in small blue letters was 'Mercury filter, 5h use. Made in San Dego' "You're from San Diego?" asked Keen quizzically as he tied the filter over his mouth. "I thought you said you were Russian, and why do you haave these?" Xky looked at him in his typically cold way. "I AM Russian" he said icily "San Dego is in the Murmansk district, and I have these because I believe in being prepared."

Keen looked around. "Okay, well I guess thats that. I can hear water or something over this way, I bet its important or something. Shall we?" A short stroll revealed that the odd sounding splashing was indeed a liquid, just not a wet one. "I really got to hand it to you Mort," said Keen in awe "You certainly visit some awesome places." The mercuryfall was maybe twenty feet high, formed where a river of mercury poured over from a higher level of mine. Thousands of silver droplets spun and fell unusually rapidly before plopping into the lake at the falls bottom with dull 'gloops' A thousand red sparkles filled the air, reflecting from the myriad droplets, ahead lay the mercury river, twisting away to another hole in the ground in the distance.

The group admired the amazing scene for some time. Suddenly Mort broke the silence by walking forward. "Well, with these filters we should be able to swim ac-" Mort took a step out onto the gently rippling surface, slipped, and fell face first onto the river with a dull slap. He struggled to stand, but kept slipping over. Xky rushed over and hauled him out. Keen smiled and explained "You of all people should know about density Mort, mercury is heavier than water, you'll almost not sink, there's no way you can walk on a liquid either." With that Keen took a small run up, jumped and practically slid on his stomach across the 20 foot silver stream. With some reluctance Mort and Xky followed. Main simply walked across, with what Keen swore was a smirk on its expressionless face.

"So then," said Keen once everyone had arrived. "just why did we cross that again?"

title: Re: Hehe
content:
*
Chapter 18
*

The group continued on in the reddish light watching the light sparkle off the toxic metal droplets splattering the scenery. In the distance they could see a tunnel that Main had assured them was expelling mercury free air into the cavern and was not a ventilation shaft. This made Mort sulk of course, probbably because he wasn't the one in charge anymore. They were only a few miles away from their target when Keen noticed what the now pink supercomputer was wearing. "Hey!" he said surprised, "You brought my wristwatch computer! Great! I'd forgot about that! Hand it over will ya?" This time Keen was sure the computer wore a worried expression. <I have detected... errors in the... circuitry caused by... um... the mercury in the air. It may not work properly.> "Nonsense!" said Keen "Its working fine, I can see it from- oh." Main handed over the now inactive wristwatch ,somewhat cautiously in Keens opinion, and attampted to slide behind Mortimer.

Keen examined his comuter warily, the internal components didn't seem to be damaged, and he'd designed it to be almost indestructable, it shouldn't be flickering like it was. He handed it back to Main who accepted it gratefully. [In Keens opinion of course, it was after all just a computer] "Are you sure its mercury interference?" asked Keen suspiciously. <Yes, although I'm not sure how long it will last after we leave the mercury saturated atmosphere.> Keen watched as the computer hung back again, trying to stay out of sight, but he caught it typing at the apparently now fuctional wristwatch out of the corner of his eye.

Meanwhile...

The figure lounged in darkness watching the four figures advance toward Entry passage Zelta and certain death. He frowned as his flying droid zoomed in on the group. "Now who do we have here?" He mumbled focusing further, two of the figures looked almost identical, dressed in almost childish- they were children! They couldn't even be 10! And one looked very familiar.. but it couldn't be could it?

An armoured fit smashed into the control panel, shattering it into a million fragments and leaving a foot deep indentation in the metal. "MacMayer!" growled a voice so distorted with anger it was barely human. Duke was unimportant, these vermin would suffer!

*
Chapter 19
*

They noticed the figure just before reaching the tunnel entrance, it was walking directly towards them, straight out from the tunnel. Despite their initial doubts, it was human, or at least humanoid. As it approached the group discerned that it was a young boy, about Morts age and height. He was wearing a light blue T-shirt and jeans and his hair was slicked back in an unusualy drab fashion. He walked oddly, more of a tired shuffle and his eyes were detached, like he wasn't focusing on anything. 'Is, is he drooling?" said Keen slightly offput by the figures zombie like behaviour.

The figure approached within 10 feet of the group, then stopped dead. Looking at them with his vacant stare he announced in a tired tone "Are you Mortimer MacMayer?" Mort stepped angrily to the front of the group. "McMire, its McMire, and yes I am, and who the hell are you?" The figure continued to stare ahead unblinkingly. "I am... Harvey. Harvey v1.06. Mortimer MacMayer, I have a message for you from The Doctor." Mortimer snorted. "The guy running this place? Well what is it?" The figure raised an arm. "I will enjoy doing to you what you did to me. Let the fun begin."

"Look out!"

Keen tackled Mort to the ground just as a powerful blast of energy whizzed through the space where Morts head had just been. Xky rapidly blew a hole through the creatures body which crumpled and fizzled. As the torso collapsed in a smouldering heap, both arms detached and made for him. Another shot destroyed one, and Keen quickly reached over and crushed the other in his LD50 He had to admit that for a device that covered most of his arm and could shoot through a stainless steel wall, it wasn't obtrusive, he'd almost forgot he was wearing it.

A dull buzz distracted them from looking at the smouldering remains of the android. On the opposite side of the caverns what looked like a grainy grey cloud was emerging from several of the tunnels. Is glittered ominously in the redish light. Mort picked himself up. "I think I know what that is, I'll bet it has thousands of independently mobile, shot capable and semi-inteligent components that are all heading straight towards us. Don't bother running, they'll get us wether or not we're in the tunnel. There's no way we can shoot them, so, any ideas?"

title: Re: ^_^
content:
*
Chapter 20: w00t! 20 <_>
*

Keen looked at the approaching cloud with alarm, there was absolutely nothing nearby he could use, and shooting the approaching swarm was out of the question. Already he could hear the ominous buzzing of a thousand rotors, see the sparkle of a thousand robotic eyes all focused on him. Facing the impossible odds, Keens true nature emerged. He was a kid, a hyper-inteligent, space travelling, planet saving genius, but still a kid, just 8 years old, and at the moment scared stiff. Whenever he'd faced life threatening situations before, there had always been a way out, someplace to dodge to, some means of attack. But not this time. All he could do was run. But to where? It was like Mort had said, there was nothing they could do.

"To heck wit this!" yelled Keen over the increasing drone. "Lets just run for the tunnel and hope we think of something!" The drones were less than a mile away and closing fast. If they hurried they might make it to the tunnel entrance just before the drones caught them, but that wouldn't dealay their imminent death. Suddenly Mort whirld around and grabbed Keen. "Infared! They use infared!" he yelled excitedly. "Keen, use your LD50, shoot at something!"

Keen couldn't see the point, but shot at the cloud anyway. The LD50 gave a deafening blast, knocking Keen on his rear. The bolt of plasma streaked away, penetrating some distance into the cloud, but with no effect. "No!" yelled Mort "Shoot a rock or something, and use a long blast, melt the damn stuff!" Doing as he was told Keen let off a five second blast as a nearby lump of rock, which hissed and bubbled into magma where the blast hit. This time the recoil pushed Keen a good three feet, but it was away from the cloud, so that was okay.

By this time Mort had resumed running. Keen followed suit, but the cloud seemed distracted, no longer heading directly towards them, more like just off to the side... "The heat? They're after the heat?" yelled Keen in astonishment. Then it hit him, of course, they used heat seeking IR to locate human targets! The hot rock should distract them and buy some time!

Keen entered the tunnel panting, the droids now just behind them, but still distracted by the hot rock. He caught up with Mort, but noticed both Main and Xky were missing. Mort had paused in front of a large ventilation duct set into the tunnel side. A large rapidly spinning fan was blowing air into the tunnel with an alomost deafening whoosh. "Where did the others go?" yelled Keen over both the approaching drones and the buzz of the fan.

Mort didn't reply, he simply stepped behind Keen and pushed him into the fan.

content:
*
Chapter 21 [3*7 = 21! Me is t3h m47h r0xxx0rzoen111]
*

The push was unusually sudden and unusually violent, Keen was teetering forward before he knew what was happening. He felt the strong breze of the fan as hell fell toward it, felt a thud as the blade reflected off his helmet and heard a click as a piece was nipped out of the bottom of his shoe, then he was falling, headfirst down a long dark tube.

He fell for maybe 15 seconds, trying desperately to gain some grasp on the smooth tubular walls, but to no avail. And then he reached the bottom, or more accurately, Xky's head. Fortuneately Keen had been wearing a helmet and had colided with a soft object, otherwise the fall may well have been lethal. There was a dull grey light at the tubes bottom by which Keen saw Xky neatly crumple up and collapse as he hit him.

A few seconds later and a faint cry was heard from the tube that now lay above them. This grew louder and eventually produced Mort, travelling at some speed. Fortunately he also landed on the now prone Xky. As Mort righted himself Keen examined the room he was now occupying. It was made out of a dull grey featureless metal, with several ducts branching out of every wall, most large enough to walk down. There was a constant distant hum of machinery, and a definite wind blowing from somewhere to somewhere else."I don't believe this" groaned Keen "We're in the air vents, just like those spy films... Wait... MORT WHAT THE HELL WERE YOU DOING??? TRYING TO GET US KILLED???!!"

Mort, somewhat dazed picked himself up and looked around. "The blade caught on an inperfection on the tunnel wall and stopped for about .8 seconds every 5.3 seconds or so. You were probbably safe." he said a little unsteadily. "I wonder if those droids will follow our heat signature here?" As if in reply the sounds of metal hitting metal, and losing emenated from the shaft abone. "Quick, move Xky!" yelled Mort as the rattling got closer. They had no sooner dragged him off to a side shaft when the rattling became almost deafening and a hail of wrecked droid parts started to rain down into the middle of the room, where they sat smouldering and sparking in the breeze. "Okay, they're hot, the rest of the droids will follow, then clog up the vent, we should move quick, a block air vent will eventually become noticeable." said Mort sternly. "Main, you carry Xky, we can shoot our way out once we find the end of a big vent."

As the rattling from the bots destruction faded into the distance Keen glared at Mort "So you pushed me into a moving fan without telling me anything and with no idea what would happen? Why thank you Mort." Mort stared back "Well, I knew you'd get past the fan, I didn't have time to tell you or anyone else for that matter, what would happen, and I figured that possible death was better than certain death, so you're welcome 314." he said looking offput. Keen looked away somewhat guiltily, although he didn't know why. A short while later they reached another fan which Keen removed with his LD50. Apon emerging they found themselves in a larger, but still almost featureless corridor. Flickering lights ran down the sides of it casting an odd strobe effect on the group as they discussed their situation.

<I suggest we remain where we are until Xky regains consiousness, then if we can locate a terminal I can find more accurate information on our whereabouts. However I currently believe that we are about a kilometer below our starting point at the shaft start.> suggested Main. This was taken up by the two remaining consious members who were both still a little frazzled from the recent chase. Just five minutes later Xky came to. Mort explained that he'd hit his head on the way down, and explaination accepted [somewhat reservedly] by Xky. They then proceeded down the corridor after tossing a coin to pick a direction. They only encountered the occasional impediment.

Xky executed a perfect flip, shooting the droid in midair before landing on and crushing the small scuttling robot heading toward him. Another shot finnished the second droid. He was much more cheerful now, almost bordering on happy. "Heh, too easy, the droid make one hell of a racket and they take ages to fire, I could Keen this up all day." he laughed contemptiously. Then he turned the corner and seemed to droop a bit "Awww nuts" was all he said as the battle droid opened fire.

title: Re: hehe
content:
*
Chapter 22: Stuff 'splosion!
*

Xky dodged just in time as the plasma bullet grazed his ear and scorched the opposite wall. The entire group could see the droids now, there were three of them, about the height of a grown man. They stood on one foot and had a large plasma rifle pointing out the from the front. Without warning all three jumped toward the group, one narrowly missing landing on Keen. Jumping forward and rolling coming up to a standing start, then falling over as the LD50 on his arm unbalanced him, Keen quickly assessed the situation. Xky had rolled under and jumped up behind a droid, shot it and whirled around and promptly dodged as a blast from Keens LD50 tore the second droid in half. The dodge turned into a spinning kick knocking the third droid over. Constructed as it was there was no way it could right itself.

Xky stepped slowly up to the stricken droid, pointed his rifle at its control canpoy and smiled. "This program has preformed an ilegal operation and will be shut down." he said dryly before emptying two shots into it. The droid shuddered, then died. Xky looked around. "there's bound to be more somewhere, I suggest we find some uneven ground, that'll make it hard for them to follow us." Keen took the time to look around, the hallway had ended and now branched out into a large poorly lit room. It was almost impossible to see further than 10 feet and strange mechanical noises emanated from the darkness beyond. It was going to be difficult to plan ahead, especially since no one had any idea where they were or what they were going to do.

Suddenly a small figure emerged from the darkness, almost spherical in shape and light red, resembling a small beach ball with legs. Mort stared at it as it approached. "Isn't that a-"

*scrunch*

"Small pile of smouldering circuitry?" finnished Xky lifting his foot and examining the remains of the small droid he had crushed. Keen pulled a small square box from his pants pocket, attached it to his helmet and pushed a button. Instantly the small torch lit up [or at least shifted the darkness a bit.] the large room they were in. The room was large enough for the walls to be only dimly visible. What Keen had mistaken for a large machine was revealed to be something more purposeful, a large but evidently damaged spaceship.

It was a creamy white color, and almost a perfect egg shape. One end was dominated by a large blue viewing port through which a few simple controls could be made out. Three legs protruded from the bottom of the craft, obviously intended for landing. There was a large hole torn out of the side of the ship through which twisted pieces of metal and wire protruded. Crawling all over the ship were small spider like robots who were busy fiddling with and removing small pieces of the ship and carrying them away. Patrolling the ground beneath the ship were wheeled droids which were evidently little more than a plasma rifle on wheels, though of odd construction. They had four 'legs' connected into two pairs each of which terminated in an axel and two wheels. The droids moved by scissoring these legs. Although evidently armed, all they did was shoot anything in their patch. They could be easu=ily steeped over, or, for Xkys preference, crushed.

Behind the ship there were row apon row of benches, many of which had complicated machinery mounted on them. There were literally hundreds of droids swarming over the equipment in fufiling some complicated but meaningful purpose. "Is...is this some sort of lab?" asked Keen "Are, are they trying to build some sort of spaceship?" Mort critically observed the craft. "Not unless you've had more contact with the vorticons then even I knew about." he commented "This looks more like a deconstruction, someone evidently wants to know how this works." Keen looked at the craft again. So thats what a Vorticon ship looked like. He made a mental note to aquire one, but it would be difficult, hiring was an option, but his Galac credit card wouldn't be any use this time. [Valid ANYWHERE in the galaxy (Excepting class 'M' planets starting with 'E')]

The group navigated their way further into the 'lab' deftly sidestepping the rapidly moving bots, Keen [with the torch, although Mort had found his] in the lead. Suddenly Keen screamed and fell back in shock. As he fell back Mort saw what was wrong. "Oh God." he stammered "I think I'm going to be sick!"

title: Re: buh buh bummm!
content:
*
Chapter 23
*

Mort had never really seen a body before, most of his dirty work had been done by minions, and it wasn't as if he regularly slaughtered thousands. [Sure destroying the galaxy would wipe out a billion souls, but that was pushing a button not stabbing someone in the back.] So it was with a mixture of horror and fascination that he stared at the disected Vorticon lying on the labratory table. It was slit nose to tail, its skin pinned back exposing all of the internal organs. Wires and tubes projected from various organs and nerves and a variety of sharp looking robots moved over it constantly cutting and probing. Then Mort noticed what had repulsed Keen, some of the twitching wasn't due to the droids, it was still alive.

Xky stepped forward, grabbed a droid in a gloved hand and squezed. The droid exploded in a shower of sparks. He picked up a scalpel and needle and thread and began working rapidly and methodically at the body stopping occasionally to remove a wire or tube, or destroy another droid. Mort staggered back and tripped over the still prone Keen, he had seen something that would wake him on stormy nights for a long time to come.

Keen shakily got to his feet and shot a worried glance at Xky. "Is... does he know what he's doing?" he asked worriedly. Mort gave Keen a wan smile "Well, he was raised by dogs, and has a great knowledge of human anatomy, at least the parts that involve causing pain, so I think its in the best hands possible." Keen digested the statement warily. "Really? Raised by dogs? Like those mental kids on that documentary?" "Yeah, he was abandonded by his mother when he was four, the authorities found him, well, adopted him from the local dog pound." Keen was interested, he had to be, anything to move the topic of conversation off the living dissection being preformed just meters away. "Wow, raised on the streets by a pack of mongrels, thats gotta mess a guy up." "Mongrels? Nah, it was a small pack of daschunds, he never eats hotdogs, but don't say anything will ya? He gets sensitive about it."

Mort and Keen spent the next ten minutes looking at the dissected Vorticon ship Mort destroyed a lot of the dissecting droids with a strange purposefullness. Finally Xky looked up from his gruesome work. "You, pink guy, you're carrying this thing. Any complaints and you're losing an arm, which will only make it harder. Okay everyone, I don't know where we're going, but lets damn well get there!" The Vorticon looked worse for wear, Xky had neatly stiched it up and the Vorticons fur hid it, but it still looked like something from a zombie movie. It was breathing though and didn't look in immediate danger of dying. And so the slightly enlarged group once again set off this time more gravely and with more purpose.

*Meanwhile...*

Duke steadied himself against the wall as the humming noise grew louder Trying to somehow push himself into the stonework he cautiously looked around the corner. The floating shape was slightly smaller then him and moving slowly, a good sign. He jumped out in front of it. "Alright you ####ing piece of mehanical crap! Preper to be nuk-"

Suddenly he was a dozen feet away, smacked against a wall. The seated figure continued it progress down the corridor still looking intently at the figures on its screen. The last thing Duke heard before losing consiousness was a fading voice saying "####ing vermin! How the hell did theyt escape?"

title: Re: well...well...well, what do we have here then?
content:
*
Chapter 24: Ideas, crossovers... and p0rn!
*

Keen and the others had managed to find sompleace to rest for awhile. This wasn't particularly hard as for the last hour they had wandered through various interconnected rooms. This area of the complex seemed to consist of nothing more than hundreds of empty rooms. Sometimes of course there were banks of computers or miscelaneous machinery, but apart from that everything was quiet, empty, and dead. What was worse was the fact that the vorticon had taken to occasionally whimpering like an injured puppy.They sat in the derelict room looking at the featureless grey walls and generally trying to figure a way out of this entire mess.

"What I don't get" quipped Keen "Is how the hell you knew anything about Vorticon anatomy, I mean they didn't even evolve on our planet." Xky smiled wryly "If you take something living apart, you quickly realize that everything fits together like a puzzle; your lung has a dent in it to fit your heart, the intestines naturally curl up, in fact, I think the only problem it'll have when it wakes up is a crooked tail, I just couldn't seem to set it right." Keen shot a glance at the Vorticon, it was twitching slightly now. He was worried, Vorticons had sharp fangs and claws, and while this one looked male, and thus less violent, it would still be something to contend with if it woke up in pain and attacked the first thing it saw. Slowly Keen edged away from it until he was standing just behind Mort.

Xky smacked a fist into the table. "Well, if no one has any ideas about what to do, I say we just keep on going and nuke whatever we find. We're bound to get out of this mad maze sometime." Reluctantly the others agreed. As the group filed back out into the hallway Keen shot a glance at Main. It was sitting om the corner tapping at Keens computerwrist. "Hey, are you comming or not? We need someone to carry the Vorticon." he said sternly. Main looked up as if startled. <Yes, of course. Forgive me, your computer is still nonfunctional and I was attempting to isolate the problem." it said picking up the Vorticon bodily and walking out of the room.

After traversing a few more hallways the came across a number of much larger rooms. These had a lot more and a lot louder equipment in them. Lights blinked expensively over banks and banks of computers attached to odd looking devices. It reminded Keen of Morts lab. Fortunately there were still no robots of any kind about. This equipment appeared to run itself. Interestingly there were various signs and readouts on the computer screens, all in english. "So at least we know we're dealing with humans." Mort sneered. "Now its only a matter of time before our, well, my, superior intelligence leads to their defeat." Keen looked at the readouts. They were in plain english, and simple to decipher. These computers were evidently meant to be used by someone of moderate intelligence as easily as possible. Obviously, no one else was meant to ever get here. Keen smiled, somehow that made him feel better.

The various rooms held interesting projects, experimental fusion reactors, new robot versions, advanced computers, all of which Xky was in favour of destroying. Keen was tempted, but it would take to long and accomplish too little. They entered yet another room, this one labelled 'Interdimensional and probbability manipulation' Inside was yet another computer wired up to some kind of portal and...

"Y'know, whoever this guy is, he's real big on collecting and analysing stuff isn't he?" commented Mort drily. There were... tanks, dozens and dozens of tanks, all cylindral, like cloning pods seen in bad sci-fi movies. Each contained something, a chunk of dirt, a tree, a piece of machinery, all sorts of random stuff. As they passed a container holding what at first looked like a badly dented wheeled dustbin it sprang to life and shouted in a voice like a cracked speaker <You must be ex, ex, excommunicated? Exfoliated? Error Error!> It attempted to do... something, but the limited space in the tube meant it couldn't do much except bump into the glass. "Hey Keen!" shouted Mort from across the room "Look at this!" As Keen walked over the dustbin managed to croak weakly <Wait! I have it now exterminate! Exterminte! Where are you going??> Mort was standing in front of a small floating red sphere. It was, Keen realized, a miniature sun. While they were admiring its beauty [And Xky was lighting a cigarette on it.] a large screen next to them lit up.

It displayed a large polygonal green face. It leered evily at them before speaking in a digital voice <Foolish mammals! When I find out my location and escape from this containment program I will destroy you all!> Mort sighed irritably and walked up to the computers hard drive. "Look, this has been a long day. Either you tell us all you know about this place, or..." he moved his hand over to the keyboard "I remove your spam filter and add you to Shocks' emailing list." The computer blanched. <Okay okay! Geez just like the other guy. All I know is this mysterious ugly looking vermin runs this place, always floating around in a chair. He's building some sort of army and this is just an experimental area, its close to the power supply though.> "Well what are we waiting for?" asked Xky miserably "We've wasted too much time here already!"

Just as they were leaving Keen turned round. "Uh, what other guy was that exactly?" The computer continued to glare <The other pest that was here, he was a complete fool. He left something of his there.> The computer tried to indicate direction, and did rather well considering it was nothing more than a face. Keen picked up the magazine left in the corner and looked at it. "Hmm, weird what are they...? Oh EWWWW! What?? Gah!! ....!" Xky walked over and snatched the mag from Keens twitching hands. "Huh, Playboy eh? Well, we certainly aren't dealing with a professional here then." Mort ran over. "Wow, what was in that? It really did Keen in! I must know!"

"No, its bad for you."

"I'm bad! Let me see"

"Nothing doing, you're too young."

"I command you to show me Xky!"

"Oops" said Xky 'inadvertently' tossing the magazine into the micro star [And causing it to very prettily go nova.] He pulled something from out of his shirt pocket. "Y'know, I never thought this'd come in useful. I guess that goverment stint really did pay off." One brief memory erase later and the group set off [yet again] but this time at least they were no longer stuck in a myriad hallways.


A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: w00t! 1'000 views!
content:
*
Chapter 25: Feel the power
*

Graduly the featureless wall gave way to a more rundown, dusty scape. In places water trickled down the walls and puddled on the floor. There were no longer very many computer panels and flashing lights, and those that were there were dusty and unused. What there were in abundance were huge snakelike cables, winding across the floor, up walls and hanging from the ceiling. Slime grew in places and the group even found the corroded body of an abandonded droid, left to rust solid where it fell. But what was most unerving was the hum. It penetrated the walls, just on the verge of hearing, and yet it seemed to get louder the longer you listened to it. If you put you ear to the wall you could almost believe that the hum was emanating from the very stonework, they very building vibrated under your fingers.

Keen paused, he was right, the hum was getting louder. Things were vibrating here. It had an oppressive tone to it, the hum wasn't exactly loud, it just made everything else... dull, like it was a wave of warm humid air pressing itself over your ears. The building was warmer here, and there was a draft coming from someplace. Cautiously the group edegd onward, noting that the cables had become very thick indeed and there was no longer any water about. There was also-

*crik*

*Smash!*

"Gah!" yelped Keen as the heavy block smashed down where he had just been walking. Mort stood stunned just behind him gingerly touching his nose where the block had grazed it. A thick cloud of purple odd smelling 'smoke' wafted up from the floor. The group examined the shattered fragments of the block. It had large letters written on it... "Acme?" asked Keen incredulously. "What is this? Some kind of sick joke?" Xky pointed at the fragments. "Hmmm, filled with lead crystal glass and nitrogen triiodide, explosive, heavy and dangerous. If its a joke, you won't hear the punchline. I think I saw another passage back there lets-"

*Foom!*

It was a lucky break, Mort had acted quickly enough by grabbing Xky's hand, but only Keens grabbing his hand stopped the both of them plummeting over the newly created pit. After a bit of struggling Xky was pulled back up to level ground. The group examined the unexpected obstacle; the entire floor had just exploded when Xky had attempted to cross it a second time. There was more iodine smoke, and the hallway behind them was now a pit filled with very sharp looking floor fragments. "Hmmm," said Xky calmly "I guess we're going forward then."

"Yeah, but we'd better be careful." cautioned Mort. "You think there's morre boobytrapped floors? I think we'll be fine if we don't try to turn back." finnished Keen "Nope, look at the ceiling ahead." Keen stared, there were a lot more blocks perched dangerously above their heads. "Okay, like Xky said, we all go forward. Fast. Yelling, I hear that helps." The group dashed forward and could hear just behind them the sounds of shattering blocks... getting closer. Finally, out of breath and sure that they were about to get crushed at any moment, they turned a corner and the sounds stopped. In front of the group stood a very large door, decked with warning signs and a combination lock. The background hum was also a lot louder here now that the immediate threat of death was over. Keen smiled. "Well, someone doesn't want us to see whats behind door number one. I'm afraid we'll have to insist." with that he cocked his LD50 stepped back and fired, just as Mort realizing something attempted to pull him back.

*Bwuummmm....*

The door didn't even make a sound as it shattered inwards under the force of the blast. All that filled the world was the hum, a throbbing pulsing almost living sound that crushed any attempt to interupt it. It seemed to penetrate their very bodies, even their pulses seemed to try and sychronize with it. A vacum sucked the head first into the room beyond.

The first thing Keen noticed was the opressive heat, it was at least fourty degrees, the other was the powerful wind, it whipped around the room like a miniature tornado. Which it was, for as Keen shakily got to his feet he realized that he was in a large sphereical room, about the size of a socer stadium. In the center stood a huge... thing. It was evidently the thing making the hum, the heat nad the wind. It reached from the floor to the ceiling, a massive twenty foot wide cylinder pulsing with a strange blue light, also spinning clockwise. At its base and apex were thousands of cables as thick as a grown mans arm, along with banks and banks of heavy complicated equipment. "This computer motif is getting old" mumbled Xky to no avail as his words were swallowed up by the overpowering sound.

Graduly, fighting agaist the wind, the group made their way to the cylinders' base. After much searching Mort found a single computer screen, complete with keyboard. On the glowing green screen was a number of complex readouts. Mort started typing.

[function/]

<Power control>

[define/]

<You do not have acess, command denied>

[access]

<access denied>

[Forbid access]

<You do not have access. command denied. Access granted. Command?>

A few more miniutes of typing and Mort gave the signal that they had better leave. For Keen this was none too soon, the entire atmosphere of the place was really getting to him. Finding a door on the opposite side of the room the group quietly made their leave. Once the noise had died down Mort took no time in informing them that they had better get a long way away very quickly. They followed the passage onward, dodging more blocks and false floors. Finally they came to a hangar. It was filled with row apon row of attack droids, robots of all descriptions, thousands apon thousands of them, row after row gleaming duly in the half light projected from the distant ceiling above.

While the group looked apon this sight in awe and shock, Keen was otherwise occupied. He was just in front of Main, and the Vorticon had woken up and bit him on the arm.
