content:
Well, never say I don't give the public what they want...

*
Chapter 26: We meet again...
*

Keen yelped in both shock and surprise and jerked his arm away from the dazed alien. Fortunatly not only was the Vorticon not focused on holding onto Keens arm, but it had overbit so the four large fangs hadn't connected with anything. Keens shirt was torn though, and a row of toothmarks spattered with little specks of blood formed two paralell lines on both sides of his arm. The Vorticon fell back at Keens yell, dazed confused and scared, not a good state for something with five pointy ends and a tail. It scuttled under a droid with some difficulty, where it sat growling threateningly and staring at the group with frantic, half dazed eyes. It growled something in garbled Vorticon Keen couldn't quite make out.

"Are you okay? You had quite a few injuries." The voice came from behind Keen and spoke the sentence fluently in Vorticon, not a human approximation, or even with Keens unavoidable inability to vocalize deeper tonal growl, this was perfect Vorticon. He turned, Xky had knelt down as was calmly talking to the injured alien in an even slow voice. Soon the two of them were engaged in a cautious conversation. Keen backed off and sided up to Mort. "He knows Vorticon?" Mort looked at Keen perplexedly "Its new to me, I never heard him speak a word of it to anyone." After a few miniutes of careful explaination the Vorticon slowly moved out from its hiding place, evidently sore from its recent dissection. It walked somewhat unsteadily towards Keen, looked at the ground and shuffled its feet a bit before mumbling in perfectly good english just loud enough to be heard, "Errm, Sorry for biting you 'n' stff." The voice was hoarse, understandibly considering what the creature had gone through, but it was evident to Keen the Vorticon was extremely embarassed. "No problem." replied Keen "I'm sure it'll heal up in a few days, besides, you hardly broke the skin, although I think I'll need a new shirt." At the sight of Keens arm the Vorticon was first terrified, then relieved. "Oh thank heavens. It would be terrible to have bitten off the arm of the saviour of our planet!" Mort leaned over and whispered to Keen "Another fan of yours 314? I swear your butt gets kissed so often you don't have to wash it."

Ignoring this comment Keen turned to Xky "Just how do you know Vorticon? You speak it like a native." Xky smiled "I heard Mortimer use it occasionally when we were taking overrr... he used it a bit, it wasn't hard to learn. Besides, I have a natural talent with canid languages." "Ah yeah, your upbringing." Keen replied before he realized what he'd just said. Xky shot him a look of surprise, shock and hatred, something very difficult to do. The Vorticon piped up "And I learnt english after you saved our world, there's an entire summer school course for learning the language of our saviour! By the way, a classmate of mine said something to me once, but I was never taught the meaning of some of the words. I was wondering if you could tell me what is meant by-" Keen looked at Mort who was blushing slightly, and at Xky who kept a stony impression. "Well, uh, thats certainly an... interesting phrase. I'm, er, not quite sure how to translate it, but lets just say their mother would be shocked to hear them say that."

There was a very loud silence, made by the entire group not saying anything at the tops of their voices. The Vorticon broke it after looking around at the assembled machinery. "Excuse me, but where is my ship? And where am I?" Xky answered "I explained about the general location and purpose of this place, your ship is Grrr haahhhk, and I'm not sure exactly where we are. Going by first impressions, I'd say that this is some kind of hangar where this robotic army is being stored. I don't think we should stay here very long, it could be very problematic for us if we are discovered." At this Mort jumped up as if bitten "OMG!" he shouted, pronouncing every letter perfectly "The reactor! We've got to get out of here before it blows!" Keen whirled round "Its going to explode? How long?" Mort, still alarmed managed to look a little more technical "Well, I'm not sure about explode actually, or how long we have, but it could be very big, so we'd better be safe." "Could? You mean you don't know?" yelled Keen. "Just what the hell did you do to it??"

"Gentlemen, there's no need to fight... at least not yet."

The voice was calm and measured, coming from the shadows between two helicopters amongst the thousands stored there. At first the group couldn't make out who'd spoken, they looked in confusion at the masses of deadly machinery. "I must admit, I've looked forward to this..." the voice had an edge to it, slightly menacing, but also snide, like a cat that had not only got the cream, but had just taken over the entire dairy products industry. A small group of oddly shaped figures moved out from the shadows into the light.

"KeenRush!" chorused Xky, Mort and Keen

"Wait, you know him?" they chorused again.

KeenRush smiled, he was in his late twenties and wore a smart looking suit, much like Xky had worn when Keen had first met him. He had bright green hair combed back neatly and when he spoke you could see he'd had all his teeth filled into square shapes. At his side were three large gargs who glared at the group with barely supressed hatred, growling threateningly. KeenRush looked at the group in a mocking manner. "Ah yes, the memories. How wonderful to see all of you here, and all in one place too. Xky, I remember growing up with you, I see you still make a living beating up those weaker than you, like that time you stole all my playgargs and spread them around the school, oh yes, I'll never forget that. Mortimer McMire too I see, the one who betrayed the Monarchist movement by selling us guard robots that didn't shoot on sight as promised, allowing both the Yorps and Keen to devestate us. And Commander Keen, oh yes, the one who killed so many of my brethren. I believe it was you who described my as a 'despot' and 'it was a good thing NASA could hit him from that height' Well, those scientists aren't laughing anymore, they didn't find life on Mars, it found them. And now gentlemen, I'm going to kill you. Goodbye."

A proud member of the signature stealing society

-Levellord

title: Now you see it, now you don't!
content:
*
Chapter 27: Another familiar face...
*

Mortimer meet KeenRush's sneer with one of his own. "So what are you going to do? sic your pet Gargs on us?" The confrontive atmosphere was broken by a crash as a droid fell over. Stepping out somewhat uncertainly from it was a young man, of maybe 12 or 13 somewhat poorly dressed in a suit simalar to KeenRush's. However, unlike KeenRush this guy looked as though he had had the suit draped around him, then poorly padded. He was also wearing a pair of specs that looked as though they were going to fall off the end of his nose, red sneakers with both laces untied, and a pink shirt. He gave KeenRush an embarassed look and muttered in an unsteady voice, "Sorry Mr Rush, err, the droids are all lined up behind them and ready to atta-"

At that moment several things happened at once. KeenRush gave the newcomer a look of hatred mixed with exasperation, before falling to the floor and rolling out of the way of the Vorticon, who had taken advantage of the long monolouge to sneak up behind him; The entire gruop turned around and dodged the hail of bullets being fired by the droids behind them; the two Gargs charged with one being promptly shot by Xky.

"Kimberly! Nooo!"

KeenRush screamed in rage and tackled the Vorticon so hard they both flew into the ranks of battledroids. Keen took out two droids with his LD50 annd Xky two more with his rifle. Another Garg charged Keen only to be blown away, unfortunately that had given a droid enough time to get close to him, fortunately Mort exploded it in a hail of sparks with a surprisingly accurate shot considering he was busy seeing off half a dozen droids of his own. After that things got a lot less clear, nevertheless a few seconds later all that remained of the attack force was a small heap of scrap metal, two bloodstains, and a rather fearful looking sidekick. He stared in shock and confusion at the scene around him. "Mr Rush? Are you...?" A clatter answered his question as the Vorticon stood up from the collapsed droids. Both its hands were bloody, and KeenRush had attempted to bite its head off, admittedly with some success, the wond was bleeding copiously. "He is dead. Close quarters with a Vorticon is not a good thing to be in." it replied somewhat shakily as Xky rushed over and bandaged the wound with a pocket hankercheif.

Mort stared at the dazed individual. "Okay, here's the deal, either you help us or-" "Or what?" challenged the former sidekick. "Or Xky here will replace the blood our Vorticon friend has lost using you as the source. Now then, just who the hell are you and what were you doing with Mr Gargiphile over there?" The newcomer looked at Xky terrified, who gave him an evil grin. "I... my name is Najawa, Najawa Kinkoshai, I was learning to be an evil mastermind, its for my B.O.E [Bachelor of Evil] at Canturbry University." Mort appeared to reach a decision. "Okay then, you can continue your work experience under me, just notify your supervisor of the switch, call it, death by unfortunate circumstances. Oh, by the way, if you so much as set a toe out of line I'll have Xky cut out your kidneys and serve them to you with steak sauce."

Keen was nonplussed. BOE's it figured. "Okay then, well, since we beat the badguy, I suggest we make our exit don't you?" Mort was about to reply, but was cut off as a nearby, heavily damaged TV screen crackled into life, the image on it distorted beyond all recognition. The voice however, was undoubtedly male, mid 30's perhaps, and pi$$ed. "Well well Mr MacMayer, it seems you just can't get a good assistant anyhere these days. Nevermind, this time you really will die. You see, I've been tracking you with my security cameras." The group looked up, there, hanging from a beam, was a small inconspicious camera pointed directly at them. "so I always know where you are, and you really are in the wrong place at the wrong time." The two rows of droids nearest them turned on with a dull thunk. There were over twenty of them, and they would be followed by hundreds more. The voice continued cheerfully. "I may not be able to get my revenge on you personally, but I will enjoy watching my army crush you pitiful form." And the screen went blank.

"we're screwed." said Keen summing up the groups feelings. However, the droids didn't move. After about thirty seconds Mort suddenly yelled "The reactor! Run!" As the group dashed past the comatose droids, they could already feel the ground shaking. They were too close, too slow,

And too late.

title: W00t! I know all your names. All your names are belong to us
content:
*Some of this chapter credited to Sarah [with an H] Thanxorz!*

*
Chapter 28: Memories
*

*BFOOOM* *BFOOOM* BFOOM*

The ground behind the erupted in a series of explosions that tore the ground asthunder, tossing shattered droids, rock and concrete slabs into the air. The walls themselves buckeld and collapsed. The explosions gathered momentum, occurring more often and rapidly approaching the fleeing group. Keen was tossed aside like a rag dool as the ground underneath him tilted and shattered. Sharp stone fragments whizzed past him, several nicking his face and arms. Managing to pull himself up from the writhing rock Keen was just in time to see Mort transfixed by a falling block of ceiling the size of a large car. Without thinking his superhero instincts set in and Keen dove forward, knocking Mort out of the way. Both slid forward as the block collapsed on top of them. There was pitch darkness as the sounds of destruction continued around them. Keen felt something grab him, almost crushing the breath from him. Dimly he realized it was Mort, a little later he realized he was doing the same thing. When there's a pretty good chance you're soon going to become two dimensional, an arch rival is as good as anyone to hold onto and whimper. Over the sounds of the dying reactor Keen could hear Mort screaming "AAAAH W're all gonna die! Actually die this time Flick! AIIEEEEE!!!" Keen resisted the urge to scream, mostly because his teeth wouldn't come unstuck.

Graduly the sounds of utter destruction ebbed and the two enemies we're left alone, in the dark, in the cramped little space between the blocks of rubble. After a few miniutes of shocked silence Keen flicked on his torch. He was in a small triangular 'room' formed by a tiled floor and two ceiling blocks that had fallen together for support. Mort was close by, a shocked look on his face. Keen realized that the both of them were bleeding, mostly from minor cuts and scratches. There were numerous holes, but none big enoug to escape from. He looked bleakly at Mort "Well that went well. What the hell did you do to that reactor?" Mort sighed "I replaced the operating system with Windows XP." he blushed "Professional. *ahem* thats why I couldn't tell what'd go wrong and when. I guess ol Bill lived up to his reputation this time eh?" They both laughed at this, the relieved crazy laughter of those who know that if they don't the shock will get to them and they'll break down and cry. As they sat there in the meagre torchlight something from the past few miniutes nagged at the back of Keens mind, one of those little details that stands out when you know you're going to die. 'Flick?' thought Keen 'That was my nickname when...' he remembered back, back to the times when he didn't have to worry about the safety of the galaxy or alien races or being killed before lunch. 'Man, I'm 8 years old! I shouldn't have to deal with this!' he thought reflectively.

"Mort?"

"Yeah?"

"This kind of thing isn't exactly what I expected to face two years out of kindergarten."

Mort turned to him and smiled weakly. "Yeah, well me neither. But who the hell would expect this?" They both sat in silence for another miniute or two, thinking their own private thoughts. It was Keen who spoke first. "Where did we go wrong Grey?" Mort recognized the use of his old nickname and smiled. "Probbably that damn IQ test. Neither of us wanted to sit it, but I had be such a big headed twit about it." he sighed. "It was just, you were Mr Popular, Billy Blaze, son of a TV star, with all the friends and everything I wanted." Keen was surprised at this revelation. "Friends? Hah! With them it was all 'what 56 x 734?' or Hey Mr Dictionary, how do you speel ambivalent? You were the one with the mechanical skill, I mean, sure, I built a spaceship, you built a spacestation. Remember when you reversed Mr Perkins gravity feild? He was off 'sick' for a week!" Both boys sat there in silence, remembering the 'good old days'; their first meeting at kindergarten, the quick friendship that had ensured when both had found out they weren't the only ones who viewed Einstein as someone whod' got pretty far for an amateur, the many pleasant days, and the arguments and disruption that had followed." Mort broke the silence this time.

"Flick?"

"Yeah?"

"If we keep this up, I'm going to have no choice but to be visibly sick. I say we work together and sort out this stuff later. We're gonna die right?"

"That is a distinct possibility, yes."

"Then whats to stop us using that gun of yours to blast our way the heck outta here?"

"The roof collapsing."

"Meh. I can handle that, remember, I taught you physics, this will be a sinch."

After a few miniutes Mort pointed to a spot, and Keen destroyed it. This lead to a new room, which Mort quickly had a hole in, and so on. It was maybe half an hour later when they came across Najawa. He looked up in surprise at the sudden appearance of a hole in the wall. Apart from a few minor cuts and scratches he seemed to be his typical self, whatever that was. "Mr McMire and um, other guy! Boy am I glad to see you! Can I do anything to help? Perhaps I could lick the dust off your shoe sir?" Mort snorted. "In this mess? Nah, save it for when we get out of this." Suddenly Najawa stiffened. "Oh mna! Mr Teach is gonna kill me! I blew up the lab of the guy the guy I was working for was working for! I'll never get that degree now!" Keen decided to interrupt at this point, if only to stop Najawa bursting into tears. "Mr Teach? As in Captain Teach? He's doing evil courses now? I though I destroyed him in the cyberspider wars of Rigel 7?" Najawa brightened "You know him? Can I tell him I tried to kill you? Only he lost his arm in that war and it'd really help my grades if I could say that, it might even make up for my D minu minus in Namology!" Keen paused. "Namology?" Mort answered "'The discipline of proper and inventive labeling of evil devices, locations and persons.' I got an 'A' thats why 'The Grand Intellect' sounds so impressive. I'll bet his real name isn't Najawa, they usually make you change it, but whatever he changed it from must've been pretty pathetic." Najawa blushed. "Err, its Nathan, actually. Nathan James Watterson-Kinoshi. I just used some... letters from..my name..yeah."

"But this point was missed by both Mort and Keen who were paying more attention to the scrabling noise coming from the wall opposite, even as they watched it began to crack and fall away. Suddenly a large hole appeared in it and the three humans jumped back as razor sharp claws scrabbled at the air where they had just been.

content:
Yes V.Z, I do know your last name. However, I either forgot or you never told me your first.


*
Chapter 29: [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] , [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] , wherefore art thou [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] ?
*

A blue furred head appeared through the hole, followed by the rest of the Vorticon and Xky. Both were a little roughed up but otherwise unharmed, although Xky was clutching his left shoulder. "I see you survived Mr McMire. I was lucky Laurael is so good at tunneling or I'd be flattened by now." Laurael blushed, which is quite something to see a Vorticon do. [it has to go through the fur.] "I... I was just returning a favour." Keen made a quick mental calculation "Okay, so should we risk our lives trying to get out, or should we risk them trying to find Morts AWOL computer?" "Bugger it Flick, it hasn't helped us so far, if it gets out it can find us." As the group retreated up the tunnel Mort and Keen had blasted Najawa turned to Mort, "By the way, who's Flick?" Mort looked a little uneasy but recovered his composure so quickly that only Keen noticed the twitch of annoyance. "An old friend, he always used to carry a pen he was always flicking-" "And I do believe," cut in Keen "everyone called you Grey, because of your habit of working with stuff made out of metal and wearing a grey shirt. However, I do believe this is frivolus and if you mention it again we'll feed you to the Vorticon, they're carnivourus you know." Najawa visibly turned white and looked at Laurael in terror, almost tripping over as he backed away. Laurael and Xky were oblivious to this as Laurael was busy scratching at the wall making an escapee tunnel.

A few meters of frantic digging later and the group was free of the collapsed room, or rather the collapsed portion of the room. The space they found themselves in was what remained of the hangar they had been in, behind them lay a twisted pile of metal, concrete and rock; in front of them lay further ruin; the ceiling had mostly stayed where it was, but large chunks had fallen on the collected droids. The floor was tilted at crazy angles, fragmented like a broken pane of glass. What had previously been row apon row of elite killing machines had been reduced to a smouldering pile of wreckage. The lights were barely functional, bathing the scene in an eery flickering glow, occasionally lit by the sparks of dying circuitry. And amidst it all standing quite calmly by a shattered battledroid was Main, observing the group with an innocent gaze. "Just how the hell did you get out of there you pink bucket of misfired cuircuitry?" demanded Mort crossly. <I can move exceptionally fast.> "So we risk our lives getting out and looking for you and you do squat to help us?" yelled Mort incensed at the robots cold reply. <Of course, I was not commanded to do otherwise.> Main replied. Keen prevented Mort from destroying what he'd origionally spent months building by suggesting the y find an escape from the potentially unstable building. After some searching they found a passage that was only partially obscured by rubble. No sooner had they cleared a way and gone down it when a huge chunk of ceiling crashed down in the hangar. It was obvious that the building was now unstable, ominous creaks, groan and cracks issued from every wall.

After several miniutes of aimless walking through the broken and flickering corridors [A task made a great deal easier by the fact that most of the walls had collapsed. It was now merely a matter of wandering in some general direction.] In the haunting atmosphere the group talked amongst themselves to pass the time. Xky and Laurael were busy engaged in a conversation in vorticon at such a spped even Mort couldn't decipher it, Main was balantly unresponsive and Najawa was an idiot, so the conversation was mainly two way. "So then," mused Keen "We've beat whoevers running this joint without setting an eye on them. I hope we manage to find a way out of here soon, I'm hungry and my parents will worry if I'm not home by 4pm." Mort smirked "Yeah? Well you've 'beaten' me enough times to know that just because it goes bang, doesn't mean its not dangerous. We should be careful, that may have been the main power supply, but anyone capable of building all this is bound to have a backup plan." Keen remembered something. "Hey Mort, that screen referred to you as Mr MacMayer, that sounds like a name you'd use, can you think of anyone in your short career as an evil genius that'd be capable of this?" Mort stopped, deep in thought.

"Nope." he said after a while "No one at all."

Oh, well

(BTW - It's been a little quiet a K:M the last 5 days)

I love the story... but, I really want to be keen's sidekick.

Maybe, keen and Mort get in a fight, and Najawa takes keen's side, vs. Xky, and Mort.

"The vortican was torn; he wanted to be with Xky... but he couldn't abandon the savior of his planet."

That is... if Mort and Keen become enemys again; but I am really liking this growing friendship, and how they're making up after the IQ test in 2nd grade "Second year after kindergarten" (My brother in 2nd grade is 7 turing [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] .

Oh well; I fear I am becomeing too influential on this fan-fic... but it is sooo awsome, and I can't help but think about it, and write alternate endings, when I should be studying math.

I think these aspirations for greatness are certainly going to reflect on your character in the story. Keep in mind that you have little control over your namesake, apart from the way he will behave in certain situations - and none at all over the other characters.

title: Re: I know;
content:
Don't relax just now Xky, I'm not finnished with you yet.


*
Chapter 30: Najawa's turn to shine
*

After a while the group began to increasingly stumble across the fragments of some sort of supercomputer. There was an overpowering smell of burnt plastic and a thin mist of smoke hung in the air, stinging eyes and lungs alike. Here the walls had not crumbled so much as fused, droplets of molten metal, glass and charred plastic littered the floor and walls. All that remained of the vast amount of cables that had powered the device were inticrate webs of melted copper splattered across the walls. Every now and then a cleaning droid could be found, either futilely trying to clear the mess, aimlessley wandering under the direction of corrupted circuits or simply fused into the scenery. It was obvious that the group was heading somewhere, it just wasn't obvious wether or not it was somewhere they wanted to be. Finally the came to the hub of the machine, a large room piled with flickering and fractured screens, most of them showing static, but a few holding images of the complex. Mort pointed at a flickering screen "Hey look, there's the mercury mine we entered in!? sure enough the screen showed to now ruined rocky visa of the mine, complete with a river of mercury with nowhere to go slowly flooding the cavern like a living mirror. Other screens showed different views, some familiar, some not. Bizzare readout spluttered from the gutted machine most of them involving large red digits.

Obviously the computer had some sort of backup power supply as it was still functioning, but none of the views on its security system looked particularly energetic. Mort joined Keen in staring at the smoking PC. "Well, I know this does something, but it'd be a great help if I knew what." he muttered. "Keen, any ideas?" Keen shook his head, "It could take months to make sense out of this, and I'm not sure that this system will last this long. We may have let the villian escape, but this place is toast for sure." <I believe I have a solution.> quipped Main approaching a databank and placing a paw of it. <This physical form is capable of interfacing with this system... ... ... yes, the encryption will take a few minutes to decrypt, please wait." With that it stood completely still, making a low humming sound. While Keen and Mort looked at each other as if to say 'well that was interesting' Laurael popped up with a small scrap of paper. "Commander Keen? Can I have your sig-,name, whats the word... um Hggrraah? My friends will never believe that I met you when you were saving your own homeworld!" Keen obligingly put down his autograph and a brief message in vorticon on the paper. He blushed as he did so. "Yeah, well, I couldn't have done it without you Mort and Xky, you guys were a real big help." Laurael looked a little taken aback "You guys?" "Yeah" replied Keen "You Xky and Mort were a real help." Laurael looked like bursting into tears now. "But,.. but my name..." she said exasperatedly. Keen clicked. "Wait, you're female? Wow, I... I just didn't expect you know? I mean, vorticons have real odd names and..." Laurael was crying now, suddenly she burst forth in a rush of semi-coherent speech interspersed with sobs, "Waaaa! Its not my fault! I eat and eat but I never gain weight! I'm naturally diminuitive! *sob!* I've tried fire spitting, but I just can't do it! *sniff!* Its not my fault!!" and with that she dissappeared, still sobbing, down a side passage.

Xky turned on Keen "You couldn't tell? She practicaly stank of female!" Keen snapped back, "Yeah, well not all of us have your upbringing Mr Superscent! What is she on heat too?" Xky gave Keen a glare of anger mixed with scorn. This wasn't a cold hate, it was something personal. "Not for at least three weeks." he muttered contemptiously before storming off after the fleeing Vorticon. Keen looked at Mort with a mixture of surprise, shock and disbelief. "What did I do wrong?" he asked weakly. Mort smiled. "You really don't know anything about Vorticon culture, do you Flick. I must admit I didn't suspect anything either, but at least I didn't say anything." This just confused Keen more. "But all I said was she looked kinda boyish." Mort sat down and said in a lecturing tone. "Yes, but on vorticon it is the role of females to defend... whatever; they're larger and stronger and can spit fire. So if a vorticon looks boyish but isn't they end up getting teased and stuff, and some take that very hard. I guess she was a little sensitive." Keen made a note to apologize and to be more careful when talking to vorticons in future. The somewhat sombre moment was broken however when a large muscular figure burst into the room firing several shots at Mort. "Haaah! Eat lead scum!" yelled the figure as it launched itself toward Keen.

Keen had to admit, Najawa was fast. He hardly even saw him, all of a sudden the figure was hunced over, winded, Najawa's foot connecting with his stomach. Najawa then brought his arm around, smacking the intruder on the back of the neck and sending them sprawling forwad, their gun clattering uselessly away. As they tried pitifully to recover Najawa simply stepped over, kicked them in the crotch and placed one foot expertly on their neck, not hard enough to choke, but hard enough toindicate that this was an option. Getting over his surprise Keen took a good look at the figure; he was wearing a tattered purple shirt and jeans. Even before Najawa's attack it was evident that they were in pretty bad shape, if not bleeding. He looked up at Najawa with an expression of pure terror. "Please don't kill me!" he begged. Najawa kept the figure pinned. "Yeah? Well you just tell us who you are first buddy." The figure pulled a small piece of paper from its pocket and scrutinized it carefully.

"-k-e-m; em, not um. Yeah. Duke, Duke Nukem."

I think I may slow down my output now, the story is taking a new direction...

*
Chapter 31: Tough guys waer pink.
*

Najawa stared at his cowering captive. "He sounds good, I say we slaughter him right now!" At this Duke paled "No!" he begged "Please, I'll do anything! I know goveronment stuff, I'll tell you everything!" Mort looked disdainfully at the unexpected intruder. "Pathetic." he mumbled, voicing the entire groups thoughts. "Don't do anything, yet. We can grill him for info, maybe use him as a human sheild, and we can always kill him later." Suddenly Main made a shrill beeping noise <Decryption complete, system accessed. Please enter command.> As it spoke all the working screens in the room flickered and went blank, the blue screen of death glowered from every one of them. Mort steeped forward, "I want to know what this place was built for, who by and what happened." he commanded. Main beeped and the screens began to flicker into frentic action. A sudden noise behind them heralded the return of Xky, complete with Laurael hanging off his shoulder looking slightly upset, but not sobbing anymore. Xky looked at Keen, dislike apparent on his face, but not the rage that he had left with. He calmly approached Keen. "Me and Laur have talked things over; I won't kill you, she understands the misunderstanding and we're all going to get on nicely. However I think its time you apologized." Keen did so embarassedly, then noticed their prisioner staring at the newcomers. "Hey, nice suit!" he said. "I guess you're in charge huh? Look, I'm willing to do anything right? I'm with you buddy." Xky ignored this. "Whats that on the computer?" he asked.

The screens now showed various files and pictures, plans and diagrams. Main spoke up <It appears this facility was constructed by a force of advanced robots in order to construct more of said robots to be used as an army to be used to conquer Earth.> "Thats right!" interjected Duke "He attacked Shrapnel city just today! I was sent to dest- uh, explore the facility. I thought you were robots, thats why I shot you, honest!" Najawa picked up Dukes gun, pointed it at the wall, and fired. A pitiful blast of green plasma emerged, moving at barely doubble walking pace and splattered against the wall, not leaving even a scratch. Najawa smirked condescendingly and pocketed the small raygun. Main continued <This facility covers several dozen square kilometers and formerly contained enough technology to make the take over of earth a plausible course of action. We appear to have destroyed nearly the entire complex which is collapseing as we speak. Structural integrity will hold for approximately five hours before total collapse and destruction of facility. I have located our position and loaded a map, we may make an exit in less than half an hour.>

Keen was barely listening, suddenly something he'd almost forgotten suddenly came to the forefront of his mind. "Shrapnel city?!! I live just north of there! What happened?!!" Main continued in a calm voice as the monitors sprung to life. <There was severe damage reported in 93% of the city, techbots were released for a thirty mile radius centered on Park avenue. Totalestimated deaths are 5560 Total...> Both Mort and Keen were staring at the screens in horror now, images of smoking wreckage and body lined streets filling their vision. The entire city had been invaded, there was an army prescence, and they were winning, most of the techbots working in an uncordinated manner, but it was evident that this situation hadn't been the norm for very long. "Main, quick, send a self destruct message to all bots now!" yelled Keen Main responded in an infuriatingly even tone. <Self distruct impossible, standby signal being sent.> Immediately all the robots on the screen stood sill, the army moved in. Mort wasn't interested inthis, typing furiously at a screen that moved over the city...now closing in on a neibhourhood... now a street... and there was Keens house, with Morts just a street over. The neighbourhood itself was a mess, cars broken windows shattered, but at least there was no smoke and no bodies, maybe everyone was safe... maybe.

Keen slumped, almost falling over, feelings of helplessness, terror, worry and relief competing for his attention. "Well, whatevers happened, we've won, at least it's over now." <Incorrect,> continued Main <There is another facility, it is operative, and ptentially more destructive.>

title: Re: Tough Guys Wear Pink:
content:
*
Chapter 32: A birthday tribute
*

Keen stared at the pink supercomputer "What do you mean another base? Don't tell me there's more??" <Another facility; it is located near Mare Tranquilitis a simalar depth underground to this one. It is equipped with a spacefaring capability rather than direct offensive and was to be used in the second phase of invasion, after this facilities armanda had eliminated ground based human resistance> Keen gawped "The moon? This base is on the moon? And this guy will know we're coming! Just great! Things can't get any worse." As if to disprove this last point, a dull rumbling started up accompanied by ominous creaks from the surrounding walls. Mort acted quickly: "Main, download any and everything of use and show us the way outta here!"

A few miniutes later the group was running at top speed through crumbling corridors, slowly going grey as the dust ever falling from cracks in the stonework covered them like a gritty blanket. Keen had to admit they made a comical sight, Duke being prodded along by Najawa, complaining bitterly that running wasn't his strong point, Laurael was being carried by Xky like a big blue soft toy, they were following a pink bunny, and everyone was covered by so much powder they looked like a troupe of poorly dressed ghosts. Finaly they came to a rather ordinary looking elevator which beeped cheerfully when they pushed the open door button, inside was rather roomy with a huge panel on one side littered with floor numbers, going from floor 47 to 'basement' Selecting this, the doors closed with another cheerful beep and the elevator began to move. Keen noticed that almost three quarters of the floors weren't lit up, and several winked out as he watched. They made it to floor twelve before their luck ran out.

Suddenly the elevator lurched, stopped suddenly and the lights went out. The terrible elevator muzak stopped too, but the now familiar creaking that replaced it was no more welcome. Wasting no time Keen blasted a hole in the elevator ceiling, causing most of the occupants to fall to the floor in surprise, and Duke to huddle into a corner from which he could only be moved by a quick kick from Najawa. The elevator roof was no more inviting, almost pitch black save for the flickering light from Mort Keen and Xky's flashlights. Fortunately just off the shaft was a set of handholds leading up. "Okay, Duke first, I don't trust him, it'll be easier to shoot him if he screws us over, and if anything goes wrong he'll be the first to know." said Najawa curtly. No one could see Dukes face, but his tone said it all. "What?? I can't do that? What if I get killed?" Najawa scowled and said in a commanding tone "Then you'll bloody well have lived longer than you woud if you don'!" And so the group started their 12 floor climb. After a few miniutes there was a twang, and the cable beside them whirred away. A few miniutes later there was a horrendus crash that made everyone grit their teeth. "Well" said Najawa with unecessary cheerfulness "There goes the floor, if we let go we die, and there's no way to go but up.... Duke? Are you crying?" Duke whimpered "No."

After what seemed like an eternity the reached the basement and they managed to lever the doors open. They were now in a very well furnished room, a corporate basement perhaps, where Bill Gates would hide his child porn. There was hardly any sign of damage here, but there was still no power. several flights of stairs led to yet more well furnished rooms, obviously where 'the big boss' had hung out. These were on the national grid, and well lit. "Hey, lunch!" exclaimed Keen eyeing a large table covered with food. "To heck with this, we've saved Earth, the least we can do is have a snack." The rest of the group agreed and were soon tucking in to the buffet, especially Laurael and Duke who somehow, without saying a word, managed to challenge each other to a vigourus eating competition that only ended when both tried to simultaneously consume a chicken, apon which Duke learnt that Vorticons were a lot like blue dogs, it was never wise to take awy thier bowl before they were done.

As they ate the building shook, and sank. By the time they were finnished they had descended two floors and were at ground level. A brisk stroll led them out of the decimated building, past several dozen body bags, and straight into an army patroll. Most of the soldiers were busy storming the building or examining the bodies Xky had created several hours earlier. However, they were paying enough attention to escort the group to their commander, a rather fat looking man wearing a neatly pressed uniform and a very serious expression. He had short neatly cut hair, and a natty little mustache, and would have looked perfectly suited to his role if it weren't for the small fact that the uniform was a WWII Kaisiers uniform, complete with the funny looking hat with a spike on it. He growled as the group approached "My name is Commander Milt Spleen, Commander to you; now I don't know what the hell is going on here, but today has been a living hell, I have reports of entire platoons being wiped out, robot attacks, a city destroyed. Now I do know I am pi$$ed off, and whatever the hell is going on here you are going to give me a good explaination and right now because you are all decent Americian citizens and because you don't want to see what will hapen to you if you don't!"

Keen sighed. "Okay, this is going to take some time to explain..."

title: Okay, Gal, X, this is for you.
content:
*
Chapter 33: Explainments and cameos
*

Before Keen could even begin to explain Duke cut in "Special agent Duke Nukum sir! I have just completed by mission to infiltrate and destroy the enemy base; these people are prisoners and two children I rescued." At this remark nearly the entire group attempted protest, but Commander Spleen silenced them with one stern look. He eyed the group critically. "Prisoners and enemy troops eh? Lets see" he pointed a stubby finger at each of the group in turn "Two not particularly dangerous looking men, I'll accept that; two children, very well, they may indeed be more victims of this horrid happenstance, but what else do we have here? A pink bunny? Someone dressed up as a blue dog? And the lot of you nicely coated in flour. I look forward to your report 'special agent'" Laurael growled and insinuated loudly in perfect Vorticon that the Commander had regular carnal knowledge of Meeps, that his venomus spit would poison the baby Meeps he regularly consumed and that it was evident from his gait that he was suffering from an unusual and hard to catch sexually transmitted disease whose approximate english translation was 'licky end' The Commander listened to the alien monolouge smiling oddly. "Very well, a forgeiner too huh? You, kid, whats your story?" Keen was going to speak, but Mort took the initiative. Keen was impressed, it was a work of almost pure fiction, but it still reflected what had happened. There were tales about his 'uncle' Xky, a trip to the country, the mine, fights, the reactor and its 'accidental' destruction and numerous other fantasies that nonetheless painted Mort in a very heroic light. By the end of it he had drawn quite a large crowd of appreciative listeners and Duke a stopped trying to interrupt and was now observing a small grainy television showng Oprah with a look of mixed worship and love on his face.

The Commander, now sitting on and almost crushing a small chair, mulled the conflicting stories over for several miniutes. "Okay then, anyone else want to add anything?" Keen couldn't resist a quick jibe "Oh yes, we're just going off to destroy the ather remaining base of the moon." The commander considered things a while longer. Finally he stood up and barked some commands. "Allright you slackers! We don't have time to lie around listening to some kid spouting crap! I'll handle this bunch of nutters personally! If they're going to the bloody moon I'll bloody well inspect their spaceships first! Now pi$$ off! Not you private Travers, you're coming with me!" The onlookers quickly sped off in different directions, pretending to find something to do, all that was except a lanky pimpled youth who trailed along behind them. He wore large thick rimmed glasses, had a mop of messy red hair and a uniform that looked like it was hanging off him. He had a pendulous but rapid gait that suggested a puppet without strings. Not quite sure why, the group half followed, half led the commander to Morts' concealed ship hidden amongst the rocks near the remains of the facility.

The commander looked at the definitely military looking ship, tut-tutted at the dents Keen had made that morning. Finally he turned to Mort "This your ship?" "Yes" he replied somewhat uncertainly. Teh commander prodded Mort with a fat finger so herd he almost fell over. "Then I hope you're lucky in your attempt to blow up the other base. Frankly you have my full support, but that ship of yours looks a little too small for my liking." Duke gaped "You... you can't be serious! How can you believe this group of...of... huh?" The commander smiled malevolently "Because Mr Nukem, they are telling the truth. Of course you will accompany them since you've already done so much. And of course the Americian army will lend its support in the form of private Ax Travers here." he said pointing at the lanky youth. Relieved and confused the group stuffed themselves into Morts ship, with a large amount of complaining and begging by Duke and much confused optimisim from private Travers. Just before they blasted off Commander Spleen gestured to the group "Y'know, this reminds me of the time I worked at Roswell, picked up a nice pet dog there, sod went missing after a week though." and then in somewhat fractured vorticon insinuated that Lauraels family tree contained many Meeps and wondered what on Vorticon it was that the devil was using as a crotch while that most deformed diabolic area was serving as her face. Then, smiling evilly he walked off back toward the ruined building.

As Laurael stared open mouthed at the receding figure Keen scratched his chin thoughtfully. "Can we stop by my house? I want to pick a few things up."

title: Re: Fine!!!
content:
Patience Xky and KR, a death will be occurring shortly, heck maybe I'll make it a two for one deal...

Plot summary e.t.e Harvey:

Keen wakes up and is attacked by robots; thinking this is Morts doing his vistis him, only to find out his whole neighbourhood is under attack. Keen and Mort team up to find out whats going on and Keen is introduced to Xky, Morts right hand man. They are led to a mining institute, where Xky kills ths staff, they then discover a massive underground complex and through many twists and turns where they encounter a vorticon, an evil student called Najawa, and Duke nukem. They manage to destroy the complex by blowing up the reactor and return to the surface in order to fly to the moon to destroy the remaining base.

[And this story is less than a third finnished, ow.]



*
Chapter 34: The pause before bloodshed
*

The BWB was crowded and Keen was relieved to be able to return to and pilot his own ship, although using its acronym had caused a bit of confusion [But aren't we in the BWB already?] Unfortunately Laurael Main and Najawa had insisted on coming. [And you just can't turn down a Vorticon who can do puppydog eyes.] The stopover at Keens place was quick, he merely needed to check that his sister was still locked up and had an adequate supply of candy, to change his now quite dirty clothing and to pick up a little device he was working on. Sadly his parents were still 'out' Keen felt nagging worry gnawing at the pit of his stomach, but tried to turn it into motivation to stop the unknown menace that had cost so many so much. And so it was that less than 10 miniutes later two small ships, barely a blip against the sky headed off toward the moon.

Keen always liked leaving Earth's atmosphere, no matter how many launches he'd been through, no matter how many planets he'd landed on, it always gave him a special thrill to see his house, then his state, then America, then the world slowly shrink away like some incredible interactive map. From space Earth looked like a little blue jewel, a small sparkling oasis of life in the harsh black void. There were many misconceptions about space travel Keen had noticed, one of them being that advanced spaceships would be able to deftly nip in and out of space in seconds. Keen had to admit he was somewhat relived to see that Morts ship, like his, had to obey the laws of physics and ascend slowly through the air, gravity pressing its passengers back into their seats as if a rhino were sitting on them. The artificial gravity helped ease things a bit, but it was still always a chore escaping a planets gravity well. And so it was that the group slowly made their way to Earths moon. The usual hyperspace transit being unsuited to such small distances, both sips had to manually maneuver to their destination, something that took quite some time, but gave Main time to pinpoint the bases exact location. It was not however without its difficulties.

"Laurael! Stop trying to stick your head out the window! Its a vacum out there!"

"Sorry, force of habit."

"Are we there yet?"

"We'll get there when we get there!"

"Man I'm bored! This trip, whens it done?"

"You can talk Mr DNF."

Finally after what seemed a lifetime [And actually was if you were a volcano dwelling snowmeep] the approached the large grey sphere that was Earth's moon. Looking far crisper than any Earth based pictures, it loomed in front of them all dry dusty terrain and jagged craters. Keen regretted not bringing his camera, he'd never visited the moon before, and as the two ships blazed across the stunning terrain heading toward the abandonded bay where they could dock, he wished he'd brought his camera, or a printscreen button. Keen looked at the approaching crater wall, it loomed like a thick black slab, shrouded in shadow darker than a cloudy night. "Okay, I'll lead, I have our information source. Main, just where are we headded?" Main reached a small pink paw over and typed a few instructions on Keens tracking system, suddenly the crater was lit by bright green contour lines, a virtual map projected onto the ships viewing glass. In the center was a large red X clearly marking their intended landing sight. Laurael gasped as Keens ship suddenly passed into the crater walls shadow. All external light was instantly cut off, leaving the front of their ship completely dark and featureless. Only the dim glow of the internal lighting iluminated the passangers as they sped toward their goal. Keen hoped that Mort had been smart enough to attach a tracking signal to his ship, there was no way he'd be able to track them visually, and Keens ship was anti-radar protection.

His silent question was answered when, as he carefully landed in the docking bay, guided only by Mains contuour projections, he saw the dim glow from Morts ship as it touched down nearby. Relieved Keen turned sternly to his passangers. "Okay, now I'm going to depressureize the cabin, has everyone got their SEP feild generators set? Good." The SEP generator, one of Keens greatest inventions, worked on the cliff principle, whereapon a cartoon character can walk off a cliff on thin air, so long as they don't notice. With the SEP [Someone Elses Problem] feild switched on, the problems of zero pressure and no oxygen simply became somebody elses worry. There was a hiss as the air left the cabin, a click as the viewing glass opened and Keen found himself in pitch darkness, rapidly cut by several flashlights the group had bought. Unlike on Earth, these beams were sharp and only lit what was in front of them, a consequence of the lack of air. Mort and his passengers approached Keen. "Very nice Flick, heck I can even communicate without a radio. So this is what you used to explore Mars eh? You're smarter than you look."

In the dark Keen smiled. They knew where they were, they had a full map of the base, they knew what they were up against. "Gentlemen," he said sternly. "I think its time we gave this place a little overhaul."

title: *Resusitataes*
content:
*
Chapter 35: Sickening
*

There was almost complete silence as the group trudged down the dark hallway, sound not carrying in the vacum that surrounded them. This time Keen had made sure to attach a tracker to his and Morts ship, and to set their defense systems on automatic, in case someone decided to put them out of commission while they were out. Although the station was meant to support only a few air breathing life forms, Main assured the group that there were copious reserves of oxygen stored in several places on the base. Aware of oxygen's more negative effects Keen decided that it would be best if they continued to use the SEP feilds rather than risk anything. With Mains digital map of the base they made rapid progress, heading directly for the bases reactor and encountering little resistance, the corridors here didn't need cleaning for dust, or to maintained very often. The entire base was draped in pitch black darkness, dead and dry and drab. Keen suddenly noticed that his arm itched where Laurael had bit him. He rolled up his sleeve and looked at the bite, it was still slightly red, but nothing more than expected, however there was a strange whitish discoloration in little spots around the wound. Odd.

Several miniutes later Main informed them that their presence had been detected, as it inevidably would be. Unfortunately that meant that literally hundreds of droid units would be mobilized toward them. Keen had forseen this however and had made sure that everyone [Except Duke of course] was armed, with high powered rapidfire plasma pulse cannons from Morts personal stash. They'd be able to cut down the droids like a hot knife slicing butter. They'd still have to be careful though, they'd recieve no warning, and little chance to retaliate. As such Najawa and Xky scouted ahead, sneaking around corners can ducking down like some cheesy spy movie. They were efficient though, you had to give them that, Najawa almost matched Xky's speed, seeming to flow from corner to corner, rapidly scanning the darkness smoothly and effectively. Evidently wherever he'd been trained had taught him a few things.

Suddenly they both dodged aside, rolled and came up shooting, the plasma bullets almost invisible flashed of light blue in the airless atmosphere, the simalarly insubstantial ghostly green shots of the battle droids whizzing past at almost unobservable speed. The rest of the group caught up and opened fire. It was almost alien fighting the droids here, the shot ghost bullets without sound and exploded noiselessly without sparks, the tiny metal fragments bouncing oddly off the walls and floor like small pieces of elastic. Keen spoke up calmly, no need to shout against the resounding silence "We'd better watch out, these guns will need recharging, they're not in an atmosphere so we'll need to repack the chambers after about 500 shots." Everyone made a mental note of this; it would be all to easy to run out of ammunition with this many targets.

Xky and Najawa were shooting expertly, every bullet striking home, destroying a droid, and sometimes two. Private Ax was clumsily trying to shoot the cannon like a rifle, with little more success than Lauraels attempts. Keen wondered just whose idea it was to take those two along, and Duke was starting to become annoying too. And his arm was itching like crazy. They slowly pushed forward, ducking into side passages and hiding behind obstacles. Suddenly they came to a fork "Half left, half right" commanded Xky authoritively. In the rush Keen, Mort Laurael and Najawa took the left passage. It soon became clear why Xky had ordered this particular action; the passages were narrow enough so that only one good shooter was needed to protect the group and only a small number of droids could attack at one time. Najawa easily handled the now reduced attack and the group made spectacular progress toward the reactor, especially when the droids simply stopped attacking, leaving them to walk easily toward their destination unimpeded. They had been walking for maybe five miniutes when they heard the explosion.

Xky rested against the computer bank and eftly shoved a few small keyboard fragments into his plasma canon, enough to last it another 500 rounds. He was alert now, aware that although the direct attack had stopped, this only meant that the enemy was planning a more subtle approach. He turned to Private Ax who was clumsily trying to copy Xkys deft movements with his own gun. "So, you're whats protecting America huh? Well I don't kow about the enemy, but you sure scare me." Ax seemed not to notice the sarcasam. "Yeah, I've always wanted to do something for my country. Besides, the foods good and you get paid to be told to do stuff!" Xky smiled inwardly. It was obvious that the kid had never really fought before, and with any luck he'd never have to. He thought back over his own life, all the fighting, the deception, everything that he was and did. Maybe it was time to quit. Did he really want to be doing this in a decde? 20 years? 50? Suddenly he realized something was wrong. He'd lost focus for too long. Whirling around he was just in time to see Duke hurl something small and white at him. He dodged out of the way, yelling a warning at Ax to do the same. There was an explosion, then nothing.

Duke stood over the two prone figures smiling evily. "Sorry guys, but I really don't want to end up dead or something. I guess this explode-o-molar really was useful. Nevermind, I'll be sure to tell the authorities about my daring escape after your massacre by Proton...and I'll make sure they know exactly where to target the nuclear missiles." Ans with that he dashed down the corridor.

title: Re: Ahhh...
content:
*
Chapter 36: Casulties
*

Keens group walked swiftly toward the sound, curious and nervous about what they'd find. Laurael strode ahead, turned a corner and yelped in shock before dissapearing from view. The rest of the group rushed forward and were shocked by the sight that met their eyes. Laurael was kneeling by Xky morosely licking a wound on his shoulder in what would've been a comically doggish fashion were it a different situation. Xky was injured, a concussion, a gsh on his shoulder, but he'd live. The same couldn't be said of Private Travers who had been closer to the blast. Najawa was the first to react "Duke! That bastard screwed us!" He dashed back down the corridor before anyone could stop him. Xky moaned and tried unsteadily to get up. Keen had never seen him look quite so vulnerable, it was hard to act cool after just being blown up. Mort helped Xky to his feet, Laurael still hanging onto his arm, the blood on her muzzle making her look rather more menacing then usual.

Najawa rushed back "Wherever he went, we'll never catch him now. Lets do the respectful thing and keep going." with that he walked over to Ax's remains and attempted to lay them out respectfully. When he was finnished his hands were red enough for him to have done the deed himself. Harbouring more than a little repressed anger the group once again set off to accomplish their goal. Mort scowled "If I ever see that pink shirted rat again I'll make sure there's no third time!" his sentence was ended with a hiss. The group looked around anxiously, there couldn't be any gas leak, there was no atmosphere. "Main, whats happeneing? Is it gas?" queried Keen worriedly. <Correct. Sensors indicate the buildup of an oxygen atmosphere in this sector.> Keen and Mort blanched at the same time. "Flick, we're really screwed now. Any chance you have something to help?" "Nope, no chance. Nuts, we'll have to be careful!" Najawa looked at the pair oddly "Oxygen? Isn't that like, good?" Keen explained "Doubble the oxygen concentration, quadruple the combustion speed, anything, even a hot pipe could set your clothes, and you on fire. Anything will burn now, we can't use our guns, too risky... and if we don't get out of here soon we'll get oxygen poisoning, go crazy and then blind."

Already the group could feel a gentle breze as pressure was restored, and normal sounds started to pass through the thickening air. The hallways however remained as pitch black as ever, but better lit now by the flashlights the group carried. The air of menace was gone, replaced by a strange lighthearted feeling. Xky straightened his clothing and adopted his traditional aloof appearance. Only Keen and Mort were aware that this was the first symptom of oxygen poisoning. Tehy could run much faster now, it was as if they simply couldn't grow tired. But that was another risk, too much exercise would accelerate the poisoning, and could dangerously raise their body temperature. Keen also concentrated more on his arm, it really was itching like crazy now. An examination showed why. "Uh, Laurael? Vorticons don't carry any saliva borne infectious diseases do they? Because um, I'm worried about this." Keen showed the group his arm; small blue spots had appeared around the area where Laurael had bit him. Mort spoke up before the Vorticon could reply. "Shouldn't worry about it Flick, its just vortipox, most vorticons get it sometime during their lives, I guess she'd just recovered. You'll be covered in an itching rash, nose'll run and general unpleasantness, but you'll be fine in a day or two." Keen looked at Laurael, who nodded. Noticing something, Keen paused "Has anyone looked at themselves in a mirror lately? Because we're starting to look more and more like the doom squad each miniute." Confused the group members stared at themselves. Najawa had bloody hands, Xky bloody everything and torn clothing, and Laurael looked like she'd just disemboweled a small furry animal.

The realization of this caused several miniutes of uncontrolled laughter, accentuated by the high oxgen content, right up until the doors closed in front of them.

-Levellord

title: Re: SEP:
content:
*
Chapter 37: What the fudge?
*

Keen looked at the very solid and very impassable doors with concern, now they had only one possible way to go, they were being herded, like sheep and their condition could only get worse. They proceeded along their new course, Main predictably informing them that they were getting further away from their target, There was a sense of worry permeating the group now, everyone knew that the future wasn't going to be pleasant, but they kept going anyway. Keen looked at the small SEP generator on his wrist, it looked like a small black metal bracelet. "Okay everyone, power down your SEP generators, see the dial? Set it so that the blue light is on." The group did as they were told, one nagging question in their minds. (Simultaneously a young Americian boy in the intensive care unit of Brookland Hospital suddenly stopped believing he was being asphyxiated several times at once and that he had a full bladder.)

"I know what you're all going to ask, go ahead." sighed Keen. Najawa was the first to voice their concern "I though this field was a free ticket to immortality? Why are we so ****ing screwed?" Keen took a deep breath, this would take a lot of inventive metaphors to explain "Basically this feild is ignorance based." Deafening silence. "What that means is its very good at shielding against things that you can easily ignore." Still silence. "Like in poorly written sci-fi's? Where the hero can easily accelerate to light speed without being crushed, but the deadly gas being pumped into the room can kill them? Same here, being shot at is hard to ignore, as is oxygen poisoning. They're all set on standby, so if we encounter anything ignorable they'll activate and shield us." He paused, this time the silence was one of anticipation "Erm, Najawa, is it just me or did your attempt at swearing actually involve bleeping?" Najawa looked solem "Mother always said never to swear." Mort surpressed a snigger "You're an evil henchman and you don't swear? No wonder you were failing your classes." Najawa looked hurt "I don't see why I need to swear, you never hear henchmen in movies swear." "But actual bleeping? How the frell did you manage that?" said Keen in awe.

"Oh that ****ing easy, people think its ***ing hard to do the ****ers" Najawa replied, each word a perfect bleep as if his speech had been overwritten by a TV censor. "Besides, I know plenty of swearwords; fudge, frell, damn, drat, arsloch, and Vorticon too! Verrgriss! Wrrgrawwny! Rrrggh H'grraagh 'K'rrrggh!" There was a muffled 'Meep' from Laurael at this point and everyone noticed she'd turned pale (Difficult for a vorticon to do through all that fur.) Xky chortled under his breath, his serious demeanour increasingly succumbing under the pressures of oxygen poisoning. "Heh, that was quite an... interesting description of what I suppose might just be physically possible if you were to dislocate someone's leg, but I suspect only Vorticons would have a snout long enough to try that with."

Keen decided to cut the rather interesting train of thought off before Xky decided on a demonstration. The corridor was changing here; the darkness made it hard to see how, but there was definitely something up ahead. Keen boldly strode forward egar to meet fate. "Okay lets see what we have h- woo-woo-woooahaaaa! Frelling fudge!"

title: Mmmm, fudge :drool
content:
*
Chapter 38: Slipping descent
*

Keen tripped and landed on his rear, continuing to slide one the almost frictionless ice that had suddenly replaced the floor. He stopped only when he colided with a wall of solid ice a few dozen meters further along. The cold hit him like a fog, suddenly his breath steamed in the air. Behind him he could hear the whispered conversation of his peers, then a whoop and the sound of someone rushing forward. He managed to shakily get up onto his knees before Laurael barking excitedly and dragging Xky behind her, hit him at full speed. A while later he was helped out of the heap of tangled bodies by Mort who was holding onto Najawa, both leaning away from each other in order to afford them both some means of stability. After several comical slip-ups, and more insane laughing from the group, everyonne had aquired a partner and were attempting to imitate Mort and Najawa's somewhat shaky positions. With Laurael and Xky this was made almost impossible, as both had a severe case of the giggles, an effect of the oxygen poisoning Keen reasoned. He himself had developed an increasingly severe headache, and the itching on his arm now covered the whole limb and his nose was running. He looked at the pink robotic rabbit he was partnered with 'Man, if I weren't here, I'd never believe I was holding hands with a supercomputer rabbit in an underground lunar ice chamber while saving the world. I'm gonna need years of therapy for this.' With an almost deafening whoop Laurael pushed herself off a wall, spinning herself and Xky wildly round before they both colapsed. Again. 'Decades.' Keen corrected himself.

A while later the group had sumarised their position. There was no way they could go back, and Main had found an alternate route to the lunar reactor. On enquiry of their location Main had informed them that they were in an overhang of the crater they had entered through, a place where no sunlight fell and comet ice had built up and was being mined for its oxygen content. Keen and Mort had both realized why they had been herded here; not only were they close to space, and thus could be ejected, but the low temperatures would quickly cause their oxygen fueled bodies to waste all their energy, potential death in less than half an hour. It seemed the entire group was suffering, both Mort and Keen had headaches and dizzy spells, Xky and Laurael were becoming increasingly incoherent and even Main seemed worried. The only person (seemingly) unaffected was Najawa, but given the length of time they'd known him, it was entirely possible his current behaviour was exceedingly unusual for him.

Thier best bet was to split up and try and find an exit, all three pairs staying in contact via their SEP generators. Keen had his doubts with this course of action though, while he and Mort were certainly capable, Xky was almost totally unable to hold a line of thought. (He was currently in hysterics because Laurael was demonstrating her ability to wag her tail both up and own and in circles. [Something very few Vorticons can actually manage, and an enviable skill by the way.]) As Keen watched them both slide off with a mixture of surprisingly good ice skating and uncontrolled fits of laughter he had a bad feeling that in their current state they'd fall down a precipice, or do something worse. And the moonscape certainly looked dangerous, the hallway had given way to an icy cave filled with jagged fragments of ice, sharp as glass. Several large black machines worked at the frosty rock faces, pumping subzero liquid oxygen and hydrogen out of one prt, and a burning flame from the other. At least the ice was less slippery here, but the air was colder, and any pause resulted in their feet sticking to the ground. Keen sighed and proceeded, with his somewhat unusual partner, to search for a way out.

*Meanwhile...*

"Hehehe! Told ya you shouldn't"

"Ith not funny!"

"Heh heh, old inuit sayong, never put your tounge on a glacier! Bwahahahaha!"

"Oh thuth, jutht tell me how I get it looth!"

"Hot water I think, unless Vorticon drool binds especialy hard. I don't exactly have anything that'd suffice. I suppose we could spit on it."

"Like hell you are! Ith my tounge!"

*
Chapter 39: Meanwhile...
*

*In a nearby docking bay...*

Duke ran throught the bay doors, skidding on the smooth floor. Here was what he wanted; a spaceship. A way to get off this acused rock, and away from that insane group of... of... things. It was sleek and so jet black it could only be seen by the way it cut off the beam of Dukes' flashlight. It took some climbing, but Duke eventually made it into the cockpit, large enough to play a game of tennis and very well furnished. Duke smiled and sat down on a padded velvet chair in the center of the room. He analyzed the complex controls for a miniute before pushing the large red button marked 'On' The large viewing screen in front of Duke lit up with letters a foot high. Duke studied the complex multi-sylablic words for a few miniutes, trying to glean some meaning from them. "Sys-tem in-con-plete." he muttered. "N Pre-dic-ted launch time..."

"When its done?"

*Meanwhile...*

Keen twisted, missing the sharp shrad of ice by a few inches. The entire cavern was covered with broken glassy fragments, and the mining machines occasionally froze, sending dozens of deadly splinters into the air. With main as his guide they were scanning the local area for escape routes, they low temperature no longer a problem, but Keen was feeling worse by the second. This was not good, he could barely concentrate. And they were taking exceedingly long pauses which Main assured him were due to oxidative stress on his system. Keen doubted this as Main seemed to be in full possession of his processing facilities, and wouldn't let him see what he did during such 'breaks' He'd had his suspicions before and had been watching Main like a hawk. Now they needed all the help they could get, if that computer was trying anything, it'd have to be dealt with now.

At the next break Keen kneeled down and snuck after Main, he didn't go far before sitting down and fiddling with Keens wristwatch. "So, do you mind telling me just what you've been doing with my wristwatch computer all this time Mr Supercomputer? I'd be very interested in your explaination." Keen said, pronouncing each word with ice cold seriousness. The robot practically jumped. It wore what Keen swore was a worried expression. <The high oxygen levels are damaging her system. If they continue she will shut down.> Keen paused, trying to figure out just what the heck that statement meant. Then it dawned on him "Wait... my wristwatch is female now? Just what the heck did you do?" Main gave Keen an almost surprised look. <I didn't do anything, she was constructed female as a result of your programming formats. Please, you must no of some solution. I love her, we cannot be seperated.>

Keen sat down. "Okay... what the hell? You've gotta be kidding me. This is the most-" Keens wristwatch cut him off with a brief series of beeps declaring her mutual love for Main, the fact that she was severly injured and a request for help. Even as Keen desperately tried to comprehend the situation he couldn't help but be impressed that he'd built a device that could communicate so much emotion in a 15 second series of beeps. He sighed. "Look, I just can't deal with this right now. I don't care whatever it is you...two are doing, I'll sort that out later, but right now I-" A loud crackle from his SEP transmitter cut him off. "Uh, Commander Keen?" It was Laurael "Yeah" Keen replied casually .

"Uh, somethings wrong with Xky."

"Yeah? Like what?"

"Uh, he can't walk and he's giggling a lot and um, I'm feeling real dizzy too."

Keen swore under his breath. Great, just great! Now they were in real troubble, people could die any miniute! He wracked his brains for an idea. Get him to hold his breath? No. Breathe into a bag, nope. Damn it! Suddenly he had an idea. "Main, can you locate for me the point closest to the vacum of space in this room? After a few second Main indicated an area of wall a few hundred meters away. Keen steeled himself, then, hoping he wouldn't set himself on fire removed the sonic grenade from his pocket. "Okay, everyone listen up; I want everyone to grab onto something solid and think happy thoughts, don't ask questions, just do it. And don't clench your teeth!" Before he'd spoken the last words he'd set and thrown the small spheroid at his imagined target. The last thing he heard as he hurled himself to the gound and grabbed onto an ice boulder was a crackly conversation through his transmitter. "Something solid! Something solid! Laurael get off of me!"

And the the world turned inside out.

*Studies writing*

ZOMG! She's right! What should I do? If I continue this it could become... an erotic fanfic! *Meanwhile in a temple in the North Island...*

LL: Oh great mistress, I have inadvertently placed a flirting in my fanfic and require your help in finishing it.

The Great Sarah: Very well, I will aid thee. Send me the complete fanfic, the meaning of all this 'Keen stuff' and some typical posts from the guy you're parodying. It will take half an hour.

LL: Yes oh great one, I will do as you command.


[Anyone not interested, just skip past the *'d section.]


*
Chapter 40: Flirtation
*

Out of the corner of his eye Keen saw the grenade impact the wall. There was a silent pause, as if the whole world were holding its breath, then it shattered. An almost visible shockwave punched through the wall and the air surrounding it. The wall shattered like so much glass as the shockwave tore through it. On the other side was nothing but the crisp vacuum of space. Keen shut his eyes as the shockwave neared, praying that the vacuum of space would keep the millions of fragments of ice from touching him. There was an odd sensation as the shock hit, an almost audible 'smoosh' above the deafening racket. Instantly the SEP field saved his hearing, and the fact that he had his jaw slack stopped his teeth shattering like sugar glass. Keen struggled to keep a grip on the rock he was holding, but after the wavefront had crushed him forwards, the vacuum of space pulled him back.

The almost inaudible crushing pressure of the soundwave gave way to the whistling roaring suction of a hungry vacuum. Almost instantly Keen was sucked horizontal, buffeted by the winds suctioning out of various entry passages and pummeled by ice, machinery and anything that wasn't securely fastened down. Suddenly the boulder Keen was hanging onto shifted, then flew into the air, shaking Keen off like a rag doll. As he tumbled in the air currents, smacked on all sides by carried debris he saw a pink blur as Main was similarly affected. In his ears he could just hear Mort and Najawa yelling, further away from the impact and safer. The walls whirled past in seconds and Keen was sucked into the endless vacuum of space.

Xky looked at his legs and willed them to move. He focused all his mental energy of the precise sequence of movements needed to bring him to a crawling position. His body rewarded him with a few clumsy shakes and an uncontrollable burst of laughter. Mentally Xky cursed. He was in complete control of his mind! Why couldn't he talk or move the way he wanted? It was like his brain was padded in pink cotton wool, nothing was working, even the meditation and mind focusing techniques he'd spent years perfecting. He gave up. So this was it was it? This was how it would end, killed by an invisible enemy by a process he barely understood, dying alone in some abandoned base on the moon. And worse, dying an unknown hero for chrissake! What would the De Ville academy think of its most successful graduate now? Things were getting foggier now, he could think, but it was hard to keep the train of thought on the rails.

He didn't remember what his mother had looked like, or when he'd been abandoned. All there ever was were the faces of the pack looking up at him. He'd always been the runt, despite being larger than any of his siblings. And then the man from the academy had come, and been severely mauled, and he hadn't looked back since. What were they up to now? he wondered, especially Spike, for a daschund he'd been unexpectedly tough. Apparently he was working in the security division of an automobile wrecking site. Too late now he thought numbly.

*

He became dimly aware of a figure nuzzling him, focusing he became aware that it was a vorticon, called Laurael. He tried to rouse himself enough to tell her to let him die, but all he could get out was a mumble. Laurael knelt over him looking extremely worried. "Xky? Xky? There's a hissing noise coming from somewhere and its getting all windy in here." Xky managed to pull himself sluggishly into a sitting position. "Great, if we don't do anything its possible that we'll die sooner." Laurael appeared not to listen and tried to drag him to the far end of the cavern they were in. "I'm not going to let you die Xky, not after you didn't let me die." Xky frowned "Believe me, I've let plenty of others perish, and saving your life is no need to feel sorry for me."

Laurael leant over and gave Xky a lick. A rather clumsy, hesitant lick, but Xky didn't need to be Vorticon to figure out the intention. He sat back, lost for words. He had to admit she'd been acting quite friendly recently, but he'd put that down to the oxygen. Thinking back, there had been some attraction, flirting even, on his part, but he'd ignored it, it just didn't seem right. After all, she was not only another species, but from another planet. On the other hand... Xky leant forward and tried his best to return the lick. They were both blushing now, unsure of what to say, or do, next. Laurael made the first attempt at resolution by sitting down and nuzzling next to Xky. "Are you sure this is alright?" Xky looked the blue furred alien in the eyes. He'd never noticed she had purple irises before. "Sure, after all, we'll be dead in ten minutes." They embraced, there was a crackle from Xky's SEP transmitter. "Ah screw them." he mumbled. After that neither said anything for quite a lot longer than ten minutes.

*

Keen looked morosely at the moonscape spinning below him, gradually growing more distant, the force from his expulsion exceeding the moons escape velocity. A few hundred meters away Main tumbled along on a similar orbit. He tried to contact the others through his SEP transmitter, but all he got was static. He was alone, and rapidly losing any chance of making it back alive. And the SEP field wouldn't last forever. "Just great." he mumbled looking at the abyss that confronted him. "Why do these things always happen to me?"
