Wll, whats done is done. And would you people stop giving me ideas! Sarah has written more, but that won't appear for a while...

*
Chapter 41: Recovery
*

Mort slowly pulled himself up of the ground. Something subtle hinted at what had just happened. The wind had almost died down completely, and the sharp shadows and silence was back. Najawa was nearby, flat on his back and kicking wildly. For a moment Mort thought he'd been concussed until he realized that the loss of pressure had caused the thin layer of moisture on the ice to freze instantly and the Najawa was now glued to the floor very securely. "Help! I've fallen and I can't get up!" Najawa moaned. Mort sighed. "Just take off your coat. Now c'mon, we've got to find the others quick sharp, especially Keen, he's the only one with the way out."

Keen wondered just what the others were doing, and how long he had to survive. He'd managed to grasp a small rock on the way out, but the moon was now a dizzying distance below him, and his momentum was not decreasing at any measurable rate. 'I wonder if I'll become an earth crossing asteroid?' he wondered 'It'd be ironic if some kid were inspired to take to the stars because of my incandescent remains.' he remembered back, back to when he first looked up at the sky and- <Inumerable thanks Mr Blaze! She is now functioning perfectly!> interjected Main, ruining a perfectly good bout of flashbacking and character development. "Yes, well I'm glad you're happy, now about the small problem of us spinning off into space hmmm?" Main floated into view, lazily reaching out and connecting with Keens boulder. "Hang on, just how did you get all the way over here?"

Mort pattered slowly down the corridor following the tracker in the SEP generator. "Man, if Flick ever invented anything worthwhile, these are it. I may just have to steal the design. Pity about the poor bastard whose getting my asphyixiation." He noticed Najawa had fallen behind. "Wait, you mean someone else gets killed instead of us?" he asked uncertainly. Mort tried to remember Keens rather complex explaination "Nah, it kinda spreads out, usually over several hubdred receptive minds, they only feel a little uncomfortable, and even if it were only one person they wouldn't die, just think they were. Remember, its someone elses' problem. Of course, you do get resconance effects, someone could pick up several signals at once, poor sucker. Or you could focus the feild." Najawa was intriuged. "Focus the field? How so?" "Ah, just think of someone and wish they had your problems, easy."

Keen pushed off another boulder, this one studded with machine parts. The Moon was a lot closer, and he was falling fast. Why hadn't he thought of it? Simply pushing off whatever he was touching! Consevation of momentum would do the rest! Of course, now he was rapidly accelerating toward certain doom, but that was a problem he'd deal with at a later date... a rapidly approaching later date...

*Meanwhile on Earth, De Ville Academy...*

Harvey Beta stood before the crowded lecture hall. In front of him was an intimidating array of computers and projectors, and in front of them his teachers and peers. This was a big day, a big day indeed. He cracked his knuckles, a sound that echoed through the entire hall, silencing those present. Harvey had a lot of knuckle to crack. He had a lot of anything to do anything, as could be attested by the fact that he was majoring in thuggery and henchmanship. His final presentation would assure him his degree and kickstart his career as an international lackey. Clearing his throat, he began. "Ladies and Gentlemen... and Daschunds. I stand before you to give my final presentation on 'humiliation and persecution of an individual resulting in mental harm.' The subject is one Nathan Watterson-Kinoshi, whom I have persecuted and humiliated until they suffered a total nervous breakdown resultin in him thinking he was a hummingbird." The first movie appeared on the projector, accompanied by laughter and applause. This was just the start, there were better pictures to come. "Now, I'll begin with an explaination of my use of pink fluffy soft toys and mash notes as a means of peer reject... reject..." suddenly Harvey collapsed, clutching his throat. The auidience acted quickly, poisonings not being unusual, especially those involving such successful students as Mr Beta.

Amidst the choas two faces watched the scene calmly. One was doctor Kaos [Professor of Random Destruction, BRDest] the other was considerably lower down and furrier.

"Hmmm, Mr Rauh, certainly not one of my students, although the performance is admirable. Rather reminiscent of your brothers elimination of competitors no?"

"Bark!"

"Yes, I thought so too."


*Back to the lunar station...*

Xky stared up at the ceiling, listening to the almost inaudible hiss of the SEP field competing with the sound of the blood rushing through his ears. He was feeling rather numb, his mind slowly getting back in line and the events of the last hour slowly settling into his memory. "Well, I don't think we're going to die anytime soon." he said lamely in Vorticon. Laurael sat in the corner trying to avoid eye contact. "Ummm, does this change anything?" she mumbled. Xky sighed. "I... I just don't know, I'll need to do some... thinking." The embarassed silence was broken by the prompt entrnce of Mort and Najawa. "Alright you two, we've got to find Keen pronto, so no lazing about, you end up sticking to the floor." commanded Mort authoritively. The two prone figures fell into line as Mort consulted the tracker. "Okay, he's about a mile from here, and moving... Xky, when did you put your shirt on backwards? And what happened to your trenchcoat? I've never seen it look so ragged since that stint in Vietnam. Was there some kind of attack?" Before anyone could answer Mort gasped "Oh crap! Keens outside the base... and heading toward it at over 6 meters a second!"

title: Re: SEP:
content:
*
Chapter 42: Impact
*

Keen watched the approaching lunar surface, becoming more and more panicked as he realized that he had no way of slowing down even marginally. The moons gravity had him now and if this was earth he'd be able to feel the wind rushing past. You had to admit, it was picturesqe though, better than any of the lunar maps sold in stores or on the next, his very own Google Moon, graduly focusing on his imminent destruction. It was just like the movies, the ground rushing up ever faster until it blurred by so fast you couldn't think-

*smack*

Najawa hit the panel squarely, sending it flying across the room soundlessly. "Uh, Naj, just why did you do that? Did the panel insult your mother?" asked Mort drily. Najawa shrugged "I dunno, I just thought that this story could use a nice literary reslove, y'know, considering Keens just hit the moons suracfe, it'd be neat to link two paragraphs..." There was an akward silence as the fourth wall rebuilt itself. "Ooookay, just what the hell are you talking about? And... dear lord! You're right! Keens hit the surface, and he isn't moving anymore! Keen, Keen can you hear me? Flick? Hello?" There was no response, the distant fuzz of static filling everyones' transmitters. Mort tried again a few times, ever more desperately to contact Keen, but to no avail. They did however get a transmission from Main, who had survived it explained, due to the rather low density, his relative tolerance to damage and a fortuitous pile of dust. "Well, I guess we go pick up Main, and find a way toward the reactor." mumbled Mort somberly.

They reenterd the cavern they had left just miniutes ago. Many of the machines were broken, most of the derbis cleared away by the explosion that had left the painful gash in one of the wall that let the harsh blackness of space into the wounded base. The ice wasn't slippery anymore and there was no longer the sound of heavy machinery. That which remained working in silence, their lights the only thing iluminating the dark expanse. In the corner a damaged machine shot a jet of oxygen pointlessly into space. Just over the fractured wall appeared Main, climbing oddly over a slab of ice the size of a tennis court. <Despite recent events I have located a new pathway to the reactor. It is advised we hurry as I suspect that our opponents will now attempt physical elimination since the damaging atmosphere has been drained.> he advised. The group was already halfway across the cavern when Najawa noticed someone was missing. "Hey," he asked quietly "Where's Mort?"

They found him climbing over the shrapnel that remained of the wall, heading out across the lunar landscape, the walls of ice and rock that formed the crater looming above him, seemingly oblivious to all else, as if he planned to walk off and let the darkness swallow him. Xky held the others back. "I know him best, you lot regroup inside, as it were and wait for our return." he advised. Najawa, eager to do more brown nosing objected. "What? Leave you to alone? You're crazy! What if you're plotting my death?" he complained. Xky turned to face him and gave him one of his famous stern looks. "In that case you'll live a little longer then you will if you keep up this behaviour." he said icily. Suddenly the crater seemed just a little darker, a little more cold. The group backed off.

By the time Xky had caught up, Mort had mounted one of the radial ridges crossing the crater and stood looking over a dusty grey expanse, the location Xky noticed by checking his transmitter, of Keens remains. Fortunately the impact seemed to have left little sign of the event, the ground even on the ridge being coated with almost an inch of powdered rock, the result of millions of years of micrometeorite impacts. Xky looked over at his boss who now seemed a lot smaller, more like the 8-year old he was than the mastermind of a criminal empire. To his surprise, Mort appeared on the edge of tears. "Boss?Are you alright?" asked Xky carefully, being more formal then he had in years. "I... I thought he was your archnemesis... I know he helped but..." he trailed off. Mort sighed despondently. "Yes, I know, I should be ecstatic, the whole mad cackle and everything, after all, how many evil geniuses get to outlive the hero? But... but I just never actually thought this day'd happen, and if it did, I thought I'd be the one to do the job, the whole big finale final boss showdown. Its hard to explain."

Both were quiet for some time before Xky spoke. "Yes, I see... you were partially defined by your opposite. Everyone has to push against something, and now you don't have any idea what to do next, who to fight or what to do. At times like this I think you should remember the Kenedy Constant." Mort tunred "And whats that Xky, whats that?" Xky smiled evily as he replied "Don't get mad, get even."

Silence swallowed the pair again, locking them into a noiseless lightless world. When Mort next spoke it was a voice of command, one Xky had heard often over the years. "Very well then, lets."

*
Chapter 43: I can't be bothered naming it
*

The rest of the group watched Mort and Xky return in silence. "Does this mean that the great Commander Keen, the saviour of our planet and recipient of the Big V is dead?" Laurael asked quietly. Najawa tried to figure out the proper emotion for the occassion, technically Laurael was now the only non-villian in the group, but everyone else seemed pretty upset by Keens death. He decided to stick with a sombre tone. "Yeah, I'm afraid so." Laurael bared her teeth and tapped on them thoughtfully with an extended claw. "This is the tooth I bit him with, I shall never brush it again in his honour." she said patriotically. Despite the obvious consequences of this action nobody said anything. A symbolic gesture was a symbolic gesture, no matter how unhygenic.

The group walked in silence for a short whie until Najawa noticed something that had been nagging at his mind for some time. "Uh, Mr Rauh, you're sholders turned blue." And indeed it had. The skin surrounding the blast wound he had recieved earlier had aquired the bluish tint of Vortipox. As had other areas. "Is that a scratch on your neck?" asked Mort curiously "And it seems to have spread to your arms as well, roll up your trouser leg.... thought so. Huh, you must be susecptible to it or something." Xky observed his new tinting. "Yeah, well, if someone hadn't tried to clean my wound I'd be fine." he mumbled. Laurael twirled round with lightning speed at this comment. "Oh? And I suppose getting a small ilness is worse then having it get infected with gangrene and your arm falling off? Look at it! Have you even done anything since I helped? How is it supposed to heal if you don't lick it?" she advanced on Xky "Oh look, you'll never reach it with that tounge of yours. And stop struggling, its for your own good." The group watched in amusement as Xky was backed against the wall futiley protesting his cleanliness, about which Laurael had quite a lot to say. "And look, *lick* yes I thought so, I can tell what you had for breakfast this morning, eggs. What would your mother say? Hold still, egg is very hard to remove. Now try and keep cleaner will you? Its disgraceful!" And with that the group moved on, one member quite a bit cleaner and deciding not to mention the fact that he'd had eggs for lunch the previous day.

*Meanwhile in the real middle of nowhere...*

Keen felt the cold on his face, or rather he thought the cold, feeling being something associated with bodies. He got up onto his knees and looked curiously at the fine black sand he was standing on, each grain twinking like a miniature prisim of obsidian. The sand formed dunes, and the dunes a desert. The horizion was flat, Keen noticed, the desert went on forever. He looked up, the sky above was pitch black cold colorless stars twinkling joylessly like grains of salt sprinkled on the blackest tablecloth ever. Yet he could see clearly, even though there was no obvious source of ilumination. A strange purple rainbow glinted off all edges and objects though. It was perfectly still, perfectly silent, perfectly... "DEAD?" It was a voice, yet not one. It seemed to enter his mind directly, bypassing his ears. It also sounded like its speaker had a lead throat. Keen turned, trying to pinpoint the source of the voice.

"Ah, um... so I'm going to die then?" he said weakly. "MOST ASSUREDLY." replied Death in tones of corpses being piled onto a plauge wagon. He was about seven feet in height, yellowed bone in a night black robe, a lesson in skeletal anatomy. He did however, Keen noticed, have two very bright blue points of light, like miniature supernovae in his eye sockets, staring out at the world like holes into another universe. "Uh, given my imminent death, why am I not terrified, or upset... or anything?" asked Keen, his curiosity growing by the second. "SUCH EMOTIONS USUALLY REQUIRE A BODY AND GLANDS TO FELL. THIS IS A PLACE OF THOUGHT AND REFLECTION" replied Death cooly. "So my whole life flashes before my eyes, complete with commentary and judgement?" "OH YES, JUST BEFORE YOU ARRIVED."

Keen sighed, or maybe he though about sighing, it was hard to tell. "Well then, we may as well get this over and done with." he said resolvedly. "YES," replied Death, removing a piece of curling yelloed parchment from the recesses of his robe. "LETS."

title: Death
content:
Death used to shun quotatin marks until he realised that people couldn't tell the difference between his talking and the narrative. He doesn't like using them, but as he himself says "OH WELL, TAHTS LIFE."

*
Chapter 44: Trinity
*

As the group moved toward their destination under Mains instructions they became aware of the familiar indications of the approaching power plant; the arm thick cables, the dull hum, the fact that the very walls seemed to be vibrating with a pulsed engery. They were, according to Main, less than 2 miles from the reactor core, and closing. Although they were so close, as yet there had been no further attacks. They advanced cautiously, Xky scouting ahead and Najawa protecting the rear. SLowly they progressed through the ominously empty corridors, until finally they came to the expected large, reinforced door. Worryingly it wasn't locked, on the control panel a single message blinked in plain english; *come on in!*

*Meanwhile...*

Duke cursed as the ship took another random veer, throwing him against the back of his chair. Damnit! He'd managed to find another ship, one that worked, but is a far cry from anything he was used to flying. It was a mutated oval shape, like an unbent boomerang. Its controls were alien, as were the three red freckled green beings tied up in the back compartment. For aliens they'd spoken very good english, something Duke didn't worry about as he fought to keep the ship under control. Given that often he had troubble with devices more complicated then buttons, [Zips on all my clothing? yeah baby!] this was proving unsuccessful. It did however create a convincing atmosphere for the message he was desperately trying to send. It only took a few miniutes desperately pounding buttons to open a radio channel with earth. Almost immediately the face of Duke's military commander appeared on the screen. "Just what the hell is going on?" he roared, yelling usually being the only way information could be made to bypass Duke's thick skull.

Even years afterward, when fame and fortune were his, Duke always felt a stab of pride when ffootage from his world saving mission was broadcast in any medium. The scene was perfect, the flickering lights, cramped space and explosions, his hair slicked back with sweat and a headwound [Blasted doorframe was so damn low!] bleeding copiously as he struggled valiantly to save earth from destruction, utter perfection. Total fiction too, but it was looks that were important. He tried to look heroic [and managed 'constipated'] and boldly delivered his spoel "Sir! It was an ambush! Thousands of droids! We fought bravely, but only I managed to survive! They've cloaked thousands of attack ships so they're completely invivble, I'm trying to *oof!* fight them off, but I don't know how long I can keep this up!" The commanders eyes widend as the message sank in. Duke continued, playing the situation like a grand piano. "Sir! I managed to locate the command center! All we have to do is nuke the contol computer and we're safe! The crater my ship blasted off from, sir, you've got to hit it with everything you can sir I- aaaaggghh!" Duke let the scream die as he turned off the monitor. The impression of his sudden defeat under fire would only be strengthened by the fact that while talking he'd managed somehow to fry the ships circuits, and it was plunging, smoking and sparking, into the north atlantic ocean.

*Meanwhile again...*

"Um, hi." Keen shook hands with the anthropomorpic personification known as War. He'd already met Pestilence and Fammine, most of the muses and the fates. Silently Keen cursed Mot Hahal again. Stupid Vorticon! He was in a rather sombre looking house, all done up in black and white, skulls and bones, overlaid with lots and lots of frilly pink lace. Of all the things he had expected, this had totally thrown him. Death walked over, accompanied by a rather bouncy looking girl in a frilly pink dress. If she had lain against one of the decorated walls she would have been invisible. She would have looked completely normal too if it wasn't for the fact that her skin was pale white excepting her pitch black lips and hair... and eyes. "Ah, you must be Misery." Keen remarked politely "You look so much like your father." Misery for her part was overjoyed, reminding Keen of his hyperactive neighbour, Jess Rocket. It only took Misery two miniutes however to halt her monolouge of praise and admiration befroe dashing off to boast to her friends.

Inwardly Keen cursed again. Here he was, the special guest of Deaths' daughter's birthday party and all because that bastard Vorticon had made six lousy computer games! All he'd done was help the guy fill out a green card, the next thing you know he starts up a software company 'retelling the adventures of Commander Keen so that all humans will know of his deeds' and running around calling himself Tom Hall! Geez, he could at least have picked a less derivitive name. Keen sighed, well, it could be worse, most dead people were just ushered into the next world, here he got cake first.

Cake as black as a starless night, but chocolate cake all the same.

Chapter 45: The revelation
*

The group stared at the roomm beyond. It was empty, totally empty, or nearly so. It was about the size of a large stadium, almsot barren save the odd bank of computer equipment, however, this was a prepared barreness, it had an air about it of being a whole lot of action just hidden away somewhere, rather than the neglected feeling of normal barreness. There were a number of large shapeless structures in the room, outlined in solid steel. Domminating the room, just off in one corner was a large column that Mort knew was the shielded reactor. Even as he stared he could feel the energy pulsing from it. What worried him was what the other structures were, despite its innocent appearance the room was probbably a lot more complicated than the previous reactor room.Then he noticed the man.

He was standing roughly in the middle of the room, on a low platform, facing away from them. It is well known that the senses possessed by heroes are exactly akin to those possessed by villians, and currently Mort was experienceing the strange sensation that the man was looking right at him without having to turn around. For a moment the participants were frozen in space and time, silent except for the dulled pulsing of the reactor. Then the mysterious man spoke. "Well, well, well. You have caused a lot of troubble for me young man, quite a lot indeed." It was a calm collected voice, stating a statement rather than voicing an opinion. "My earth base destroyed, my techbot army defeated, and me forced to flee to the moon. You really have it in for me don't you Mr MacMayer? At this Mort paused [not that anyone noticed, he was standing still anyways.] He'd heard that name used before, had he used that name before?, it was beginning to sound familiar. "I'm sorry," he said plainitively "Do I now you? You seem familiar."

Mort sensed the figures fury, he could almost see him shake with repressed anger. When he next spoke it was with a voice icy enough to keep milk fresh for a month. "You...don't...remember...me? Do you perhaps remember the Berkely High Energy Fission Building?" Mort considered this. He did, thats when he'd used the name MacMayer, Mark MacMayer. He'd faked an Id and beard and joined as a midget nuclear technician. He'd learnt a lot about nuclear technology, but his experiment in fusion had... "Ah, you seem to remember something. Very good Mr McMire I must admit it took me a while to track you down, but with you on my monitors for so long, I managed to find your house eventually." On a nearby computer screen an areial view of Morts house appeared. It had a target on it. Mort gasped in shock, he knew what it meant. "No! You can't!" he yelped in horror. The figure smiled an turned around. Laurael gasped.

He was human, his age hard to tellbecause he had no hair, but he was at least thirty. He wore a grey T-shirt and blue pants they were both of unusual design, more like a uniform than casual clothing There was a metal plate bolted to his right shoulder. The most notable feature though was a large metal plate bolted to the left side of his face and head, like some bizzare metal cancer. He smiled a cold, evil smile. "Can't I? I have the laser aimed and ready. I'm going to kill you Mr McMire, but first I'm going to make you suffer for what you did to me." Xky moved fast, almost inperceptibly so. The figure, anticipating some reaction simply threw a punch that occupied the place where Xky's head was going to be. Xky was hurled back twenty feet before coliding with a wall. Najawa looked in horror at his fallen comrade and was surprised to find himself already heading toward the arch villian. Furious at the attack on his fellow henchman, he decided on a spinning kick instead of a straight punch, twisting his body in midair to switch maneuvers. Strong and fast though he was, the figure hadn't counted on Najawa's only slightly slower attack. The spinning kick knocked his feet out from under him and Laurael quickly attatched herself to his arm. The figure roared in pain before flinging the vorticon across the room to join the prone Xky in a heap. "Enough of this! To hell with it! I'll kill you all vermin!" yelled the figure as the room began to change.

Mort looked at the shifting walls in horror. "Awww nuts!" he mumbled quietly.

Chapter 46: Attack and defense
*

'Suffering is really Keen!' Keen finnished filling out the last autograph. It had been a long, interesting and tiring 'day' According to Death he'd be sent back as soon as his body regained consiousness, which would only be a few miniutes after his out of body experience began. He watched detachedly as his soul began to reconnect with his physical form. Deaths world grew nebulous and he began to float in that warm pink haze that fills your mind just after you've woken up but before you realize that last night you so drunk you told your boss exactly where he could shove his performance evaluation.

He woke up blind and deaf, coughing dust. Struggling to stand Keen found that he was immersed at the bottom of a lake of dust almost twenty feet deep. Only by swimming slowly upwards was he able to reach the suface, and only by more swimming to extract himself from the dusty mass. Standing on the lakes 'shore', stille knee deep in dust and desperately trying to remove the fine powder from his eyes ears and clothing, Keen looked at his entry point in the middle of the lake. By his reckoning he had hit the lake at full speed and simply shot straight to the bottom, slowed to a stop by a giant dusty cushion. Currently Keen focused on locating the rest of the group. They couldn't be far away, he'd supposedly only been out for a few miniutes, but he couldn't get anything except static on his SEP transmitter. He was also now a uniform shade of grey, and shed a fine cloud of dust as he walked. Nevermind, he knew where he was, now all he had to do was find out where he should be...

*Meanwhile*

The walls slipped away, doors opened and the floor slid back. The group skittered and ran in random directions as the floor tilted beneath them. The reactor was unshielded, bathing the room in bright light and deafening sound. Spikes appeared out of the walls and floor, forcing the group to concentrate into the center of the room. Then there was the hissing.

They appeared from the open doorways, thousands of them, moving rapidly across the jagged floor with ease. Flames, hubdreds and hundreds of flames. The sound they made was like a billion rashers of bacon frying on the biggest frypan in the world [and Texas] They were all about two feet tall, bright orange and had the suggestion of a face in them. Whatever they were, firing at them did noting, and something would be needed to be done soon, the group was surrounded and the flames were closing in. The evil figure laughed sinisterly. "Of course Mr McMire, while your friends will perish in the flames of my Splatterbangs, I shall deal with you myself!" As he spoke the platform he stood on rose on a tripod of legs. Underneath it was a very large and fully loaded machine gun pointed directly at Mort.

Xky backed up until he was back to back with Najawa. Laurael and Main were simalary positioned in a corner between two jutting pieces of floor. Xky spoke calmly above the reactors pulsing. "Najawa, you may be an idiot, you may have no common sense and be butt ugly to boot, and quite frankly there are moments when I fantasize about your painful death. However, I no longer hate you as much as I used to, and it looks like we're the only people here who are even remotely good at fighting. We'll have to stay alive, keep the rest of the group safe and somehow defeat this guy. I haven't the faintest idea how, but lets just pretend we're lifelong buddies who have dozens of plans for doing this." Najawa scowled "I'm ugly? Says you Mr never shaves. You've got yourself a deal."

And then everything happened at once.

[Strictly speaking this isn't true, the smallest peroid of time the everything can happen in is a thousand billion years, so what really happened was a number of fast paced events all simultaneously occurred, but I was trying to be dramatic, well its ruined now isn' it? Thanyou so much.]

*
Chapter 47: Run
*

Both Xky and Najawa jumped at the same time, straight up before pushing off each other in mid air. Landing several feet away, right amongst the flames, stepping quickly to avoid the moving tounges of fire in what looked comically like an crazed attempt at tapdancing. Performing this odd dance Xky and Najawa managed to place Laurael and Main ontop of a bankof computers, safe for the moment as the flames seemed to be concentrating on the two dancers with worrying inteligence, anticipating thier moves and swarming around them. Xky knew that unless they found some way of damaging these things they were going to be in deep troubble. Already he could feel the hot burning of tired muscle and the dulling effect of metabolic poisons, two things the flames would not worry about. Next to him Najawa was faring worse, having to occasionally bat a flame from his trouser leg. The air was begginning to smell like charred fabric. Suddenly a metal claw smacked down next to him, just barely missing his leg. The flame that had occupied that area of groung splattered... and died. "Interesting..." mumbled Xky.

The machine gun barrel whirred. Just in time Mort dodged the hail of bullets which chipped a zagged line into the floor. A steel leg swung up, taking a layer of paint off the top of Morts helmet as hu ducked the decapitating blow. Rolling along the ground he dodged the pointed tips of two more legs as they tried to puncture neat little holes in his chest. More bullets punctured into the wall behind him as he ran desperately, zigzagging in an attempt to buy time as he searched for somewhere, anywhere to hide. Another leg, this one slashing a deep gouge into the computer bank next to him. Sparks and smoke billowed from the stricken computers, for a moment obscuring Mort, a momentary advantage that Mort used to duck under and behind the platform. Quickly aiming and firing his plasma rifle he let loose with a burst of fire. Each bullet seemed to hit an invisible wall about an inch away from the machine, exploding in a bright flash of light. The contraption turned around, its controller staring right at him. "Ha! Do you honestly think you can defeat the great Doctor Proton?" he smirked. More bullets, another swipe with a leg. Mort knew he couldn't keep this up forever.

Xky kicked furiously at the flames, knocking them left and right, it was of little use, there were too many, and it needed a powerful kick to extinguish just on of the firey beings. Najawa hadn't got the idea yet, he was still aimless ly shooting at something on the wall, struggling to keep the flames off his legs. Suddenly he grabbed a cable off the wall and pulled. Ten feet of arm thickness cable came off in his hands. For a moment Xky was puzzeled, until Najawa started to whirl the cable at high speed, low to the ground. At such speeds the cable cut the flames in half, clearing a wide circle around him as the firey sea collapsed. Xky started firing at the wall too, detaching a much larger length of cable, some twenty feet in length and as thick as his neck, something that would be hard to start moving, but very hard to stop. He spun with all his strength, ignoring the burning of the flames at his feet as slowly, slowly the cable began to move.

The leg cut a neat nick in Morts arm, causing him to scream in pain. He was tired and running out of options. Then he noticed Xky, calmly walking forward[ish] while spinning a large length of cable, unsteadily cutting his way through the sea of flames. Najawa seemed to have had the same idea. Suddenly Mort was inspired. He dashed toward Xky hoping his opponent wouldn't have the insight to spot his plan. Predictably Dr Proton followed, shotting ever more accurately at Morts fleeing figure, fortunately avoiding the now very close Xky.

Xky had removed twenty feet of copper cable. Copper has a density five times that of water. The volume of copper now whirling around Xky was just over a third of a cubic meter, with a weight of just under a third of a ton, moving at a speed of one revolution per second. Thats a lot of inertia to hit three small legs designed more for support then strength. Jumping quickly over the cable as if it were a jumprope, Mort watched the cable cut cleanly through the platforms legs without stopping. For a second the entire contraption remained stable, seeming to suppost itself of the stubby stumps of its supports, but then it tilted and fell, only to be hit by the cable again. This time the two masses were more equal. The cable stopped cold, flinging Xky and the platform across opposite sides of the room, both cutting a swathe in the now much dimminished army of flames. Dr Proton struggled to escape from the platform as it sparked and smoked. He jumped up, a small pistol in both hands.

And then, quite simply, the room exploded.

Chapter 48: Boom!
*

Keen pogoed, soaring meters into the air, long enough for him to take a good look around. He could see, just a few hundred meters away, the hole in the ice cavern created by his grenade before this whole fiasco began. He fell swiftly, bounding upwards again an instant later. Pitch blackness gave way to the odd brightness of space as he left the craters shadow. It was peaceful in the vacum, almost enjoyable pogoing from rock to rock, and to think, soon he'd be back in the hallways, fighting for his life again. Sometimes life could be so unfair!

It was about then, twenty meters above the moons surface, [Come on Americia, succumb to metric!] where he could just peek over the lunar crater he was in that he noticed the approaching points of light. Points. Plural. There were maybe two dozzen of them, moving swiftly and with purpose toward some point on the lunar surface. With growing interest Keen realized they were going to land, if not directly on top of him, pretty close. They were moving across the sky faster now, homing in on something. Keen could see that now they were closer, they were actually cylinders, with the sun gleaming off their polished metal sides. On them were a number of designs. Now they were very close indeed, too close for comfort. Now Keen realized with a cold feeling in the pit of his stomach just what those designs were. They were flags, mostly Americian and Russian, but there were some othe countries too. All in all, not a good omen, Keen thought. As time seemed to slow down, as it always does near death, Keen tried to work out just how much Uranium and Plutonim were headed his way and their kenetic energies. As he watched the flag on the fully equipped Americian Patriot series nucler missile fill his field of vision, only one thought had time to pass through his brain. 'Huh, I see why Rorie doesn't like these guys very much...'

"OH? YOU AGAIN?"

*Meanwhile...*

It was like an earthquake; the entire room seemed to jump up ten feet in the air, then fall twenty [Okay, so I'm using imperial, Bush said I had to.] There was an explosion of sound that immediately deafened everyone present. The reactor stopped turning, and started to spark. Huge chunks of ceiing began to fall. "Just great," though Mort. 'This is what? The second time today? Or the third? Just what the hell is it with these places?' Dr Proton had been thrown across the room in the explosion, now in the flickering light of the overheating reactor he struggled to his feet. Somehow his base had been attacked! But how? Nevermind. He pushed his way through the wreckage toward his escape. Najawa tried to stop him,only to be smacked agaist the wall. His escape machine was ready and charged. He may have been arrogant, but he'd always made sure to plan ahead. It was a small blue... device, just large enough to stand in, a cylinder open at the top and one side. The top was covered with a complicated net of wires and foil.He turned and looked at his opponents, two of which were already running toward him, intent of finnishing him off. He laughed at their imminent doom. "Fools! I will depart this place and return at full strengh... before I left! This machine will self destruct and you will perish in the ruins of my lunar base! "What?" shouted Mort and Xky, both nearly at the machine, and still deaf.

The machine whirred, and exploded, sending lethal metal and plastic shrads in all directions. When Xky and Mort got up, the doctor had dissapeared. Mort looked around frantically, already their only exit had been blocked by a large chunk of ceiling, and the reactor was begginning to emit a shrieking noise. [At least his hearing was coming back, but thats Mort for you, never looks on the bright side.] As it turned out, they didn't have to worry about the reactors imminent explosion, as it was more likely the room would collapse on them first. Slowly, as if everything were immersed in maple syrup [Mmmm, pancakes] a section of ceiling at the far end of the room fell in. Followed by the rest of the room, ceiling falling, walls moving in, the entire room slowly falling in apon itself, a wall of... well wall heading toward the cowering figures like a mutant tidal wave. And then everything moved...sideways, and there was the felling of the entire world falling into its own navel.

Mort stood up, this was very hard to do, as technically he wasn't standing on anything, but the SEP field managed it. He was... standing, maybe floating in some kind of void. Along with him were assorted pieces of wall, floor and ceiling, and the rest of the group. The void itself was a strange purplish blue, as if the colors on the skin of a bubble had been made into a paint and Mort was immersed in it. The others were in various states of surprise, confusion, and in Lauraels case, epileptic joy. Mort had heard of the saying 'tail wagging the dog' but in this strange void, and with nothing holding her down as it were, the laws of inertia meant that this was exactly what was happening. This made her attempts to thank Xky rather more difficult, as she was constantly rotating around her own rear end. Nevertheless, she managed to cover Xky with assorted slobber and praise. Najawa sidled over, his nose bleeding from where he'd been hit. "Huh, looks like you've got a fan eh Xky?" he chuckled. Laurael slowly turned to face him, her tail still doing its best to impersonate a helicopter blade, and performed a tackle-hug that would have brought tears to any fan of anime. Najawa quickly found himself embedded in 170 pounds of hyper Vorticon. "Gaiieee! You saved my life too! Zibble! Eeeek! You've been injured! Lookit the blood! You'll never get that clean, let me help!" Mort tried to ignore Najawa's protests as he tried to figure out just where the heck he was. After some miniutes of this he tried to obtain some measure of order.

"Hey! If everyones stopped thanking, jumping on, and licking everyone else here, I'd like to have some ideas about just whats going on?" He had to duck as Laurael attempted another tackle-hug expressing her joy at not being shot by a lunatic in a robot suit. It was several miniutes before he could calm down her enough to be able to be heard over her profuse thanks. :Right, everyone okay? Good. Ideas. Us. Here. Now. Why?" Najawa wiped some drool off his cheek. "Stupid Vorticon." he mumbled. "Well at least your nose isn't bleeding anymore, besides, its probbably the first bath you've had in weeks." countered Xky. "Now, could this perhaps be due to the SEP field? Our death not being our problem?" Mort considered this. "No, not likely, the room was far to obvious a cause of death. This must be something else, but I still suggest we keep our SEP's on, just in case. I don't know if we can survive here, and besides, any disturbance could cause this void to do something unplesant.

Just before the blinding flash of light, the entire group heard Najawa utter just one word. "Ooops."

Chapter 49: Yes, me again!
*

Keen stared into the grinning face of Death for the second time that day. [Of course Death was grinning, you think he could frown with a face like that?] He was back a Death's house, where the party streamers were just being packed away. War was asleep in the corner, having drunk himself into a stupor guzzling evaporated beer. "I WAS SURE YOU'D LEFT. STAYED BEHIND TO HELP CLEAN UP EH? OH WELL, I SUPPOSE YOU'D BE WANTING TO GET BSCK THEN?" Keen paused, a lightning plan forming in his mind. "Actually, when you send me back, could you perhaps put me next to Mort and the rest of the group? Its just that it'd be a long way to walk otherwise, and I have a planet to save." Death considered this. "OF COURSE. IT WOULD BE A LOT OF WORK OTHERWISE. I REMEMBER THE BLACK DEATH, WORKING ALMOST NONSTOP FOR 3 YEARS. VERY TIRING THAT."

*Meanwhile...*

Mort awoke. Later. How much later he couldn't be sure, but he certainly didn't expect to awake staring at the face of a rather motherly looking middle aged lady. The woman looked in her late twenties, of some undefinable ethnicity, but her dark skin hinted at Africian descent, although there was something... odd about her face, something not quite right. Mort couldn't help but feel that he'd seen it somewhere else. The woman stepped back when she saw he was awake. "Oh good. You're awake Mort. I'm afraid Mr Watterson is still out, but your friend Xky is awake. As soon as you feel strong enough come into the lounge, I made cookies." Mort stared as the woman left the room. Mort looked around. He was in a comfy looking small bedroom, decorated mostly is slick shades of black. Next to his bed were four others, only one occupied, by Najawa who was snoring loudly. The sheets were black and red, satin and cotton, and there were some brilliant posters of the entire galaxy posted on the walls. A telescope sat in one corner. Mort realized that he was staring at what could possibly be his dream room, if it had a few more additions. Lasers perhaps...

He sat up and noticed for the first time that he was clean. Really clean. Bath clean. His clothing had also been neatly washed and ironed, even though he was still wearing it. Well most of it; the protective jacket and pants Keen had loaned him were sitting in a nice folded heap at the foot of the bed. Hanging from one of the bedposts was a nice black jacket, leather exterior, red silk lining, pockets for holding wepons and candy. Attached to the collar, in Morts own handwriting was a small card reading 'Though you might like this.' This was just getting more and more confusing. While he was out someone had stitched up the tears in his clothing given him a good supply of candy and provided a very stylish jacket for him. He checked it for booby traps, finding a dozzen more cards, all in his handwriting with coy little messages like 'Mind the lining, its expensive.' [And one saying 100% silk, Dry clean only.']

With almost paranoid caution Mort proceeded down the hallway. Someone had removed the firing mechanisim from his gun and replaced it with another mystery note. The hallway was done in the same tasteful black and red combo the room was. Dark and menacing without being gothic, evil without being uncool. There were several doors leading off, all closed, all bearing notes to Mort advising him to keep them that way, and also simalar notes for Najawa... in his handwriting. The door at the end of the hall was open, and from it came the sounds of conversation. Mort approached with more caution, and almost had a heart attack when the strange woman appeared in the doorway, plate of cookies in hand. "Oh hello, you're up? I was just about to bring you some cookies. They're doubble chocolate chip, your favourate." Mort was shocked that she knew his cookie preferences, more so when she handed him a glass of vortacola lite [Another favourate] and bustled him into a comfy black [what else] chair.

Mort quickly glanced around the room he was in, it was much larger than he would have expected, almost a house in itself. An entire wall was taken up by a gian TV screen, chairs arranged around it. The opposite wall was dominated by a huge fireplce, currently occupied by a roaring fire, just in front of which lay Laurael, curled up asleep, occasionally making dreamy attempts to bite her tail. [This is actually the Vorticon equivalent of thumb sucking, usuallly abandonded by vortikids just after they lose the ability to stun. If Laurael had known how many people were viewing her infantile behaviour she probbably would have locked herself in her room for a week out of sheer embarassment.] In the middle of the room was a pool table... and an air hockey table... a table covered with candy, several large and expensive looking computers, more chairs, several vending machines giving out free candy, a trampoline and a death ray. Everything was done out in shades of black. If Mort stared hard enough he could almost see different colors. [Not say, real dark purple, which is normal, but a pitch black that was... well, purple colored black.] Finally, one entire wall was nothing but a giant window, looking out over a marvellous mountain range as the sun set slowly over a distant sea, clouds tinted red by the dying rays. All in all, an impressive sight. A very impressive sight. Indeed it would not be far wrong to sat that the only time Mort had seen anything like this was in his dreams. [And even then the fluffy pink unicorns had a bad habit of dropping by and ruining the effect.]

Xky was lounging in another chair, quietly consuming a large bowl of borsch. He'd shaved. The strange woman continued to fuss and bustle about, seemingly oblivious of the fact that Morts world had just been turned upside down. He picked up a small black box lying on the table next to him. Inscribed on its side was the legend 'Edge of Map' and attached to it, in Xky's handwriting was a note 'Open me!' "Hey Xky! Lookit this willya? Isn' this your handwriting?" asked Mort chucking the box in Xkys direction. After some scrutiny Xky opened it, went pale in fear, screamed and hid behind the couch, where he sat shivering. "Nothing." he moaned "Sheer firmament, raw void! The edge of the universe!" Mort looked at the dropped object, and verified that yes, it did indeed contain absolutely noting, including a total lack of space for there to be nothing in. "Interesting." he mused as his famous infinite chronological loop equation ran through his head. "Just what in all the tarpits of Gnosticus is going on here?" he wondered.

"I'm glad you asked that." said a voice. Mort turned, and stood facing himself.

*
Chapter 50: Whee 50th chapter special!
*

For an instant, before surprise and confusion overtook his fear, Mort shivered. The figure that had appeared, as if from nowhere instantly commanded everyones' full attention. He was the epitome of pure evil, like something taken right out of an anime. He was in his mid twenties, wearing a tasteful black and red suit. Not the corporate kind, but one designed to be comfortable, to be worn around the home as it were. It also had one heck of a lot of pocets. The figure himself seemed to exude an air of menace. He had piercing eyes, so brown they verged on reddish, his hair was medium length, swept back in a rakish style, an so black it looked like a hole cut into the vacum of space. He wore little else of note, a silver watch and an interesting talisman around his neck, it was shaped out of lead, a capital M. Despite all this, Mort knew as soon as he set eyes on him, that he was somehow, staring at himself. Mort composed himself, this was no time for doubt. "Just what's going on here?" he demanded.

The figure smiled, then took a seat between Mort and Xky. [Who had got up from behind the chair and was now trying to hide the jitters his recent shock had given him.] "I think we should wait until Mr Watterson awakes and your frind Mr Blaze getshere. Oh, that reminds me, Naj?" Another figure entered the room, simalarly attired in a neat black suit with a large red M printed on the pocket. He was older than the first figure, with a neat goatee trimmed in the devil style, stylish dark glasses over his eyes and a number of cold metal devies hanging from his belt, many of which were designed to do unpleasant things to sensitive parts of the anatomy. All in all it would have been quite an intimidating image if it weren't for the fact that he was wearing two red sneakers with laces untied, and a pink undershirt with the legend 'Tough!' embossed on it. "Naj, Najawa... right?" mumbled Mort numbly. He was begginning to get some idea of what was happening.

At that moment Najawa entered the room shaken and confused as Mort had been. He had recieved the same general sprucing up treatment [and a bit of oaking up too.] as the others He opened his mouth, as if to ask a question, looked around the room, paused, then headed wordlessly for the candy vending machines where he stayed for quite some time. The second figure watched Najawa with disdain, as if he were a puppy that hadn't got the hint about housetraining. "Huh, boy was I an idiot." he said with a laugh. "Oh well, live an learn." Mort was much calmer now, everything was fitting into place. "Yeah, but just how much living have you done Najawa? I'm going for maybe 20 years? You certainly age well." The first figure grinned at this. "19 years actually, but a good guess. I was always a sharp one wasn't I? Well, I'll explain everything as soon as Keen gets here." There was a long pause. "And whe will that be?" asked Mort. "Oh... about... ... now." replied the figure. There was a dull thunderclap, the kind of sound an 8-year old boy's worth of air would make if it were suddenly displaced.

And there stood Keen. Dusty, tired and twice dead. He looked around. "Any chance of a soda?" he asked, but the drinks tray was already heading his way.

*
Chapter 51: c'mon Xky, what about those eggs???
*

The group seated themselves on various chairs and couches [After Najawa had been pried away from the candy machine and Laurael woken up, much to her embarassment from a dram involving the chasing, catching and mutilation of thousands of pink Hello Kittens, a cute adorable cartoon character loathed by thousands of Vorticon parents forced to buy them for their impressionable pups.] Of the assembled group, only Mort was sure that he was dealing with some form of time travel, the others were in various states of confusion, bemusement, and,in the case of Laurael, a desire to consume large amounts of candyfloss. [The fact that Najawa was both confused and bemused was nothing unusual, this was his normal state of existance.] The elder version of Mort seated himself in a chair facing the group, waited until he had their full attention, and spoke. "I'm sure all of you excepting my younger self and his friend are wondering just whats going on here. Very well, pipe down for a bit, this'll take some explaining. Firstly, this is the year 2025, wintertime. You are currently in my winter palace, which, as ruler of the entire world, I have several of. All of your future selves are alive and doing well, although youmay not like what they're doing, or who you've become. I'm sure you all noticed Mr Watterson-Kinoshi, my left hand man and bodyguard here." he pointed at the older Najawa. Keen had jumped up at the mention of 'ruler of the entire world' and now struggled to voice his shock. "Ruler... of the world? You? How?" he spluttered. The older Mort smiled. "Through a complex and devious plan that I'm not going to tell you, for obvious reasons. However, you can rest assured that the current condition of Earth meets your future selfs standards, if not his acceptance. We will have time to look around later, but please, let me continue." Keen sat down, a thousand thoughts pulsing through his head, barely able to keep listening to the conversation. His trigger finger began to itch. [Given that he now had a full body case of vortipox, and under his coating of moondust was a pleasant blue color, he itched all over anyway, but this was a special kind of itch.]

"Now then, I brought you here with my time machine, which we can examine shortly. I did this because I remembered being taken here when younger, and this not getting killed on the moon. Remembering stuff that happening to you happens a lot, so if you meet yourself, do be aware of this. Now, I suggest we make our way to my labratory, where I will do a lot more explaining and we can get around to why we're here." With that he got up and headed toward a doorway in the far wall that hadn't been there a miniute before. The middle aged woman Mort had met earlier rushed up to Keens now quite dusty chair and gave out a frustrated sigh. "Dear look, I'll never get all this dust out, its so fine!" Mort turned and made a vauge gesture, a small spidery robot appeared through a sort of square mousehole that appeared in the wall. It ambled across to the chair and started cleaning. The dust was too fine however, and probably wouldn't shift. "Don't worry Lindsey," piped Older Mort, "I'm sure I can build something to deal with it." He walked trough the door with the rest of the group following, except for Keen and Mort. Keen was devestated, he'd always had a kind of crush on Lindsey, and even though he knew it would never amount to anything, he was still shocked at what he'd just heard. Mort however had a rather strange grin on his face. His voice hoarse with awe Keen barely managed to ask Lindsey "You married Mort? But, but, you always seemed so... nice!" Lindsey grinned, then performed an acrobatic twirl, her long red dress spinning around her like some demented ameoba. "Ugh, tell me about it. All that innocence and helpfulness gets so dull! Besides, I am a princess, well, a queen now. Anyone with money and power is bound to be attractive. Oh, and there was that wedding at St Pauls cathedral." She made for the door, then walked back and picked up a diamond the size of a pidgeon from a small jewlery box over the fireplace. Attached to its bottom was a small gold ring. "Oh yes, Mort will want this, its vital to his time machine working."

Numbly Keen followed Lindsey down the passage. He turned briefly to Mort. "And you can wipe that grin off your face!"

*
Chapter 52: A little labwork
*

A short walk later Keen emerged into Older Morts' lab, still upset about Lindsey, and exceedingly embarassed about feeling upset. OM's lab made Morts pale in comparision; it was either very big, or open to the sky; the walls stretched up until the feeble light at floor level no longer illuminated them. The colourscheme here was blue; the walls were a deep noonday sky color, most of the benches and equipment picked out in various shades. Although the lab was gigantic beyond belief, OM lead the way with a definite air of purpose, idly walking past structures that dwarfed Keens house, machines so complex Keen couldn't even begin to comprehend them. Out of the corner of his eye Keen spotted Mort pocketing a few small devices, and would have been annoyed if he hadn't already 'borrowed' a few interesting things himself. For a moment he wondered if Mort would only invent those things because he stole them from himself, who only invented them because... then his head hurt, he was thinking toomuch like Xky. To hell with it.

After a while OM came to a stop in front of a rather mundane looking device, notable only in that it was surrounded by a large amount of empty floor. It was rather disapointing, barely taller than an man, it looked somewhat like an undeveloped mushroom; a thick squat blue stem capped with what looked for all the world like a turtle shell. Large wires and tubes ran out of it inot various sockest in a nerby bench. OM tunred to the waiting group "And this is the time machine that brought you here. Kind of; the machine is specific, whereas what I did was kinda rip you out of your time to here by manip-" He was cut off by a crash, a 'wheee' and the appearance of a small girl riding a...a... something. It had an birds head, a striped reptilian neck and two legged body with a short tail, making it look vaguely like a wingless featherless ostrich. OM stepped in front of the creature, bringing it to a halt, before adressing the rider. "Andy, what have I told you about running in my lab?" The girl blushed and examined the floor. "Um, not to do it because I might get mutilated, but-" "But nothing!" replied OM sternly. "I don't ever want to catch you doing this again alright Andrea?" "Yes Uncle Mort." replied the girl pretending to be very interested in one of her fingernails, then slowly urging the weird creature off roward God knew where.


*Meanwhile...*

Xky sat down at his computer, logged on to the internet and went straight to his favourate site. After a few hours of looking at scantily clad russian chicks he decided to take a peep at his second favourate site, the PCKF. There was a new installment of Harvey's fanfic. Just great how many drools would- suddenly he was standing in a dark room, with several other people, a pink rabbit and a some sort of blue dog . There was an odd looking man talking to a young girl who was riding some sort of "Zibble?" he mumbled.

And then it was gone, he was back at his desk, in front of the computer, looking at the dozens of drool smilies Harvey had littered his latest post with. He tried to remember what had just happened, but it seemed to fade from his mind even as he thought. Was he dreaming? Yeah, that was it. There was something about a blue dog who would've looked cute if she were a naked russian chick. Speaking of which...

*And now back to our regular broadcast...*

"Correct Mr Rauh." replied OM "Now-" Keen cut in. "Daughter of yours Mort? I have to say, doesn't look like you." OM smiled evily. Not mine Mr Blaze, yours. Keen stared open mouthed for a while before stammering "So... I'm married?" OM smiled even wider. "Oh yes, to that lovely girl on your street, what was her name? Ah yes, Jessica Maunders." Keen was stunned. "What, Anime Jess? The cartoon freak?" "Oh yes. I do believe her new series The Cibbi Hour grossed over 2.25 billion last year alone in merchandising alone. A pity neither parent could be here, pressing engagements. I like to help out though, and Lindsey just loves the little tyke. Now, back to time travel, unless you have some more gossip to discuss?" Again the groups attention was drawn to the machine, various thoughts and questions buzzing through each one's heads. Mort was the first to break the silence. "Okay me, I know the what and when, I wanna know the how, who, where and why." OM was equally blunt. "Time machine, M theory. Dr Proton. The Alpacalupa Mountains. To save this world and yours from destruction." Keen was next, there was something he'd been dying to ask since he'd arrived.

"Do you have a cure for Vortipox? Because this rash is killing me!"

*
Chapter 54: Will we ever leave?
*

After liberal vaccinations had been dispensed and both afflicted parties were feeling much better, Keen decided to aska few questions that had been troubbling him. "Okay old guy, just a few things I don't understand. Firstly, why bring us here? Why not interfere earlier along, before we were in any danger? Why not kill me at birth? And why are we still here? With a time machine you could do anything! Rule the world! Heck maybe thats how you did it!" he finnished yelling, all the confusion and fear that had been building inside unleashed in that blurt. There was more he wanted to ask, where his elder self was, how his friends were doing, what did OM have planned. OM paused, looked at his watch and replied. "Okay, could you just step back about three steps? Good. Now, I think I can answer all of your questions pretty much at once. A time machine has its limits; I can't do anything that would stop me inventing it and doing what I did. If I killed you at birth Mr Blaze, then I would have no need to go back and Kill you, so I wouldn't, and so on. Thats why I didn't interfere earlier, thats why I didn't and can't use it to rule the world and thats why there are no hordes of time travel tourists queing up at your house. Besides, I didn't invent this, I borrowed it off a friend in exchange for taking over a planet for him. Its how I got Lindsey's wedding ring too, its the power source for the focusing mechanisim.."

As OM ended his spiel Keen could hear a vaugely familiar pattering noise, something he hadn't heard since... since... since he'd last visited V- There was the familiar feeling of being simultaneously trod on and stunned as the vortikid ran off into the distance. His two pursuers however were stopped by Morts outstretched arm, conveniently placed to knock both young children to the ground. "I'm getting sick of this," grumbled OM "Why is it that as soon as I have important business to discuss everyone seem to- Lorinda! Stop trying to blast Andrew with that frapp ray! I will not have this fooling around in my lab!" The one called Lorinda pouted as OM snatched a small raygun from her hand/ "Buut daaad!" she whined "No buts! Didn't me and Mr Blaze declare earth a ceasefire zone? And I don't care if it doesn't apply to you, while you're under my roof you'll obey my rules!" The other child, and older male version of Andrea put his hands in his pockets, concealing a neural stunner looked at the floor in the manner of one caught stealing from the cookie jar and mumbled "My dad lets us fight over at his place." OM adopted an expression that suggested certain people would be spoken to later "That is because your father is an irresponsible lout who doesn't even understand the benefits I can bring to the universe, let alone how to properly raise a child. Honestly, I don't know how you managed an IQ of 3 let alone 312. I've a right mind to ground the both of you, in cement this time. No go play outside and I don't want to hear another word out of either of you." Both children moped off in the manner of those who had just found a greater enemy then each other. Lindsey looked after them. "Daer, are you sure you weren't too hard on-" OM sighed in exasperation. "What is this? An attempt to save the world or a daycare center? For chrissake lets get on with it before a kindy class pops out of my matter converter!"

He gathered his composure. "Right, we're behind schedule. Dr Proton has a timemachine too, and he's not likely to be as consientious as me in using it. I've tried to interfere, but he keeps countering me, there's nothing I can do except attack him manually, and you're going to help me, this will be dangerous." Keen scowled "And if we tag along you can be sure we'll survive because you're still here?" OM shook his head. "No, I just need all the help I can get, the way everything works, you could still die but I'd be here. Mr Blaze is already distracting Protons attack fleet, and he can't buy us more than a few hours. Now we're going to the armoury, then going to attack Proton, and if anyone has a problem with that I'll get my associate to hit you with his thwacky stick!" The older Najawa's thwacky stick was six foot long and made of teak. There was rapid agreement by all present to go along with the plan.

The group slowly filed out of the lab, Xky and Laurael being the last to leave. Laurael whispered excitedly.

"Wasn't he cute?"

"No!"

"Aww c'mon, he had your eyes!"

"No he didn't, I'm not talking about it!"

"Aww cmon,"

"No!"

Now the lab was empty, save to figures hunced almost invisibly in the warm darkness behind an air conditioning unit. Their position was perfectly chosen, a full view of the time machine with minimum chance of being spotted. In it the older version of Xky stroked his chin thoughtfully. "Maybe I shouldn't've started shaving" he membled thoughfully, staring enviously at his younger selfs' prolific facial foliage. Next to him Laurael snickered "Hehe, did you see they look on your face? Hey... do you think my tails going limp? Hers looked so perky."

"Not this again, I keep telling you, there's nothing wrong with your tail!"

"Thats just what you'd say, for your information I've measured it, its drooped 1.3 degrees in the last month!"

"Have you tried starching it? Or botox? C'mon, lets go raid Morts pantry, I'm hungry and those traps that second rate Nakawa set are piss-easy to flip."

And then the lab was empty, the time machine flickering with its own internal light, almost smug amid the whirring machinery around it.



A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

*
Chapter 55: So we're all set then?
*

OM's armoury was fit for... well an army to be honest. Aside from the racks and racks of guns, there were also several tanks, various planes and atttack craft, and other, more indistinct weponry. OM walked straight up to a table loaded with sleek black guns. "Right, to hell with understatement; these lil babe's are MGH 3000's; they're based roughly on the neural stunner in that they can be tuned up from a disorienting zap to a wall busting boom. Trigger. Adjuster. Any questions? No? Good. Now, I hope these'll work; every time I try something Proton uses his time machine to outwit me, adjusting his shield and whatnot." he walked over to several craft, hidden in shadow. "Now these, they're a special nearly invisible stealth craft I call Shockers, after that weirdo hacker who hacked porn into the pentagon. They're the best tech I have, but I suspect we'll be shot down, so pack a parachute. Yes, Mrs... Mrs.. you know, I never did catch your last name."

Laurael was gesturing wildly trying to catch OM's attention. Having it she seemed for a second to have forgotten what she wanted to say. "Uh, innocent injured Vorticons don't have to do this right? I mean, I'm no Vortninja, heck I can't even jup the cracks in the pavement. So um, I'm sitting this out right?" OM thought for a second. "I guess so, its hard to remember anything about the attack, there's more than one time machine involved, and my past may not be your future. You're right, you probbably wouldn't be any use. Okay then, everyone, suits are over there, pick up any other stuff you think looks cool and we'll leave in five miniutes. Najawa will explain anything you need to know, an unusual task given that he barely knows what he's doing now, but I'm sure he'll be up to it." And with that he walked out of one of the rooms many doors.

Najawa rumaged around one of the smaller tables at the back. He grabbed a gunbelt and holstered five stunners, a pistol and sawn off shotgun into it. He followed this with two ammo belts, a sackful of grenades. He hid two very sharp daggers up his sleve, and several more in his pants legs, [tied securely enough to prevent slippage and removal of bits of course.] A garotting wire was wrapped around a wrist and hidden under a watch, some plastic explosive placed in his sneakers, a detonator under his tounge and an anti tank mine strapped to his back along with the backpack full of soinc flares. [As worn by the hedgehog in 1970!] He donned two pairs of brass knuckles, some night vision goggles and a protective kevlar vest. Grinning he confidently strode forward, and toppled over. His older version groaned with embarassment and ran over to pick him up. "Oh for Pete's sake; just try not to get killed, and learn some real fighting n00B."

In the corner Xky hefted a small antitank gun; the newer version was smaller and just didn't seem to have the good solid 'oomph' of the ones he used during the rebel attacks in Islamabad. He'd also managed to find a grey suit and dirty it thouroghly. Sure, black looked cool, but if you really wanted to be invisible, blend into the shadows, you needed a good dirty grey suit. He was snapped out of fond memories of strangling enemy troops in pitch darkness by the pleading tug of a paw on his sleeve. Laurael looked at him with pleading eyes. "You're not honestly going to go through with this are you?" she asked. "Well, duh, Morts right hand man and all, besides, I'm the only one that seems to know how to do anything right here, except maybe older Najawa, and quite frankly I'm not sure just how good he is. I wish I was around to ask." Laurael frowned "But you're not here; doesn't that make you wonder? Everyone's here but you and me, and I'm pretty sure I'm on Vorticon somewhere! You could get killed! Doesn't that worry you?" Xky stared at her, the cold in his reply almost made har gasp. "I've done this before, killed hundreds of times, I've almost lost count. You have no idea, this is just another day for me." Laurael couldn't keep the pleading out of her voice now. "But.. but you can't! I love you!" Xky frowned. "Are you kidding? You've known me what? One day? We were jacked up on oxygen, get a clue! This has gone far enough." Laureal looked at him, taken aback. "But, but..." "But nothing, I've gone along with this, and thought it over, and for chrissake! You're some kind of intelligent furry from another planet! I may not exactly lead a normal life, but even I have my limits. Get a clue, your older self obviously did."

Keen watched Laurael run off crying. "What happened to her?" he asked quizzically. "Stubbed her toe." mumbled Xky. darkly. Just then OM strode in, suited up in yet another, somewhat more armoured, black suit. "Okay everyone, I hope you're ready, because I'm all set. Everyone take a ship and lets go.!"

title: Short chapter today!
content:
*
Chapter 57: Well he did say...
*

The ships soared effortlessly through the atmosphere, totally silent, and, accoridning to OM, totally invisible. All that could be heard was the dull static of the radio links, keeping everyone in constant communication in case something went wrong. They were headed this time for the tropics, just off the west coast of Brazil. There was a tension in the air, a feeling not unlike that felt by the typical student just before an exam, and in a way this was a test, though admittedly you never got to resit the course. Suddenly there was a crackle over the radio. "Mr McMire? You have an appointment." OM cursed. "No I don't, I rule this planet, reschedule and screw them!" The radio responded "I'm afraid he's rather insistent sir, and he is of the Globox empire." OM sighed. "Oh God, anything but him again." There was a pause then, "Uuuh, sir, it appears we've lost radio contact with him... there seems to be something interfering..." Suddenly a nearby cloudbank opened with a boom and a voice like thunder spoke. "Okay Mr McMire, just this once, and only because its you. Now we're even, stay away from my family!"

*Meanwhile...*

The Globox despot stared upwards at a sky that seemed connected to the heart of the sun itself. A wonderful and terrible voice burst forth. "Lord of Globox, I am your God!" The despot sniffed. "Like heck you are! Blasted Earth food, always gives me halucinations!" There was a surprised pause, then a terrible noise. And then silence. If you listened very carefully you could almost hear a faint conversaion coming from the charred pile of ashes that was once the Earthly form of the Globox Despot.

"Hah! Call that proof! Could just be a meteor strike! Hey, what are you doing? Put me down! I'm not going someplace that doesn't exist! Hey!"

*Yet another meanwhile..."

"Stupid Xky, thinks he's so cool... don't need him anyway..." Laurael grumbled as she stalked down the castles corridor. All she could do now was wait to be sent back to her own time, and then she'd have to wait until a vorticon ship entered the area, that could take years! Of course, maybe Keen would give her a ride...? She never managed to consider this possibility however as whilst walking she unthinkingly walked straight into someone heading in the exact opposite direction at roughly the same speed. There was a clatter as pens, paper and books scattered everywhere and both participants found themselves sprawled on the floor. Laurael was first to pick herself up. She helped the young human to their feet. She was Lauraels age at a guess, but it was hard to tell on a species without hackles, with the typical mop of fur only on the upper head, cut rather short and a fetching shade of light brown. She was wearing a neat blue shirt and jeans and seemed surprised but bemused at the encounter. "Sorry about that," she asid. "I just don't look where I'm going when drawing. You're a... Volticon? I'm sure thats right. Should've expected a few offworlders in the emporeres place. Are you here to see him too? Only I've not the faintest idea where I am, and I'm scheduled to meet him in an hour to discuss trade with- oh I'm sorry, you probbably don't speak English. I'll just shut up then."

Laurael decided that a bit of mischeif would brighten her day no end. "Zo," she said, trying to recall that funny accent on her favourate show. "Joo vant my to find a purple candle? How rood! The emporer vill haer of dis!" The human blanched and dropped all her stuff again. "Oh no! You can't! I can't affored to screw this up! This is my first government job! I'll be demoted! I don't want to go back to accounting!" The human sounded even more pitiful than Laurael felt. "Sorry, sorry, I'm kidding. I speak perfect English. We don't all bark you know. I'm not going to see anyone, and the emporers out, possibly forever, so I think your meeting's cancelled. Oh, forgive me; Laurael." she held out a paw, remembering just in time to retract her claws and wag her tail, humans seemed to find that more friendly. The human held out her hand. "Andrew; Andrew Aaron Abel Stolzky, ym mother had a thing for 'a'." Laureal took a step back and examined the human more closely. "Uuh, you're male? Sorry, its just so hard to tell with a species not covered in fur." The human laughed "Especially in my case; I don't know what it is, people mistake me for a girl all the time, apparently I look 'androgynus' or something. People call me Gal for short, you can guess why. Oh well, can you help me with my stuff, guess I won't need it now." In amongst the many charts and binders there was a notebook full of odd looking drawings, including several that resembled vorticons. "Hey, whats this; do you study anatomy too?" she asked. Gak shook his head, "Nah, I'm a furry artist." Laurael paused "You... draw cartoons? I must admit, that looks just like Minnie Meep."

"No, no, you know, furries... well actually, I guess you don't. There are people who are interested in drawing fuzzy catoon character and stuff. I'm not into the whole dressing up convention kinda stuff." Laurael tried to analyse the unfamiliar sentence. "Dressing up? Like other species? I was a Foob once for All Spirits Eve, is it like that? We really must talk, it sounds so interesting..."


A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society
