*
Chapter 58: Three this time!
*

Keen stared out of the shaded canopy at the sky outside, clouds whipping past like the insubstatial steam they were. It was almost relaxing, just sitting back and allowing the autopilot to carry him across the invisible borders of countries below. Brazil looked so beautiful from the air, especially since it had been reforested, the fact that a thousand mile high green 'M' was growing in hundred foot trees on it did little to spoil it. OM crackled over the radio. "Better switch to manual guys, Protons spotted us." Keen made the switch, grabbing the control stick in the familiar grip of a computer game player who had to fly his own ship. He looked around cautiously, trying to find the location of the attacking fleet. His instruments showed nothing. "Uh, I'm not getting anything on rada-" OM snorted "Yeah, Proton knowws we're coming doesn't he? Do you think he wouldn't take precautions? We're going to have to do this by visual contact, split up into pairs and guard each others' flanks!"

Keen veered left, pairing with OM in the hope that he was a better shot than he was. [Think about it, that sentence makes sense.] Keen had never fought in a ship of any kind before, most of his battles being close up, and non lethal. Suddenly he spotted a craft bursting out of a cloudbank and his hopes fell. It was transparent, or nearly so, barely visible as the rippling of clouds in its wake. It moved so fast he could barely keep track of it. Then it moved into open sky.

"Aww nuts" said Keen for the fifth time that day.


*Meanwhile...*

Lindsey McMire watched the robot continuing its attempt to removve the lunar dust Keen had left on it. She wondered vaugely what other wives without 2'240 assorted robotic assistants would do in this situation before returning her concentration to the trade problems between the badlands and the northern provinces. Sometimes being a queen could be so tiring, the sooner Lorinda could take up the role of princess the better. The phone rang. Sighing Lindsey drafted a six point unilateral goods and services agreement and posted copies to both parties before answering the call. As usual it was pointless socializing. Some queens had nothing better to do all day! "No Eva I'm not free saturday. Why? Saturday I'm negotiating the mining contract with Zelta IV. Whats mining? Are you crazy? Thats why your planet was enslaved right there, total incompetence. Of course I'm condescending, I'm queen! If you don't like it stop calling, I'm sure Miss peach is free. What do you mean only a princess? Oh to hell with it, pi$$ off!" Lindsey terminated the call in a huff. It seemed that all royalty did these days was waste money and get in the papers. Heads full of cotton wool the lot. She felt better though, there was something about a good swear that did that. And the trade agreement had been accepted! Lindsey closed the comm link filled with the warm fuzzy feeling that came with a job well done [Or sitting on a kitten.]

She looked up as two figures entered the room. One was the vorticon lass she'd seen earlier, the other was... ah yes, the trade minister from Stanistan. "I'm sorry Mr Stolzky, your meeting has been postponed, if you'll call back to- what is she doing?" Laurael had removed most of her clothing and had glued a zipper on her chest. She had also borrowed a sheet of paper and a pencil and was scribbling furiously. She gave Lindsey a cheerful smile "I'm a furry! I've finally got the perfect disguise! I can study humans unseen and pass my exobiology course with record marks! Yay!" Lindsey managed a sneak peek at the piece of paper Laurael was waving, it had a neat sketch of her on it, complete with rather embarassing estimations of her weight, age and social status. The young man next to her seemed to be quite shaken and appeared to be trying to dissuade the vorticon from her course of action. "I don't think you quite understand, its not that subtle, besides, shouldn't you carry out an areial observation first?"

"Thats what I was doing when I got shot down here! I'll have some choice things to say about violent behaviour! I can't wait to add to my notes on human social interactions and mating behaviour!"

"Well you've got to realize that you probabbly won't experience 'normal social' wait, WHAT??"


*Yet another meanwhile..."

Levellord crept along the balcony toward the open window. Here would be as good a place as any to begin the attack. Nobody would be prepared, and there were children, tasty young children. She tried not to drool.


A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

*
Chapter 59: What goes up...
*

Keen searched desperately for the attacking craft as another round of laser fire bit into his ship, leaving a string of dents across his canopy. He spotted a blur and fired, trying to keep it in his sights. He was rewarded with a bright explosion and the sight of the deshielded ship plummeting toward earth. There were shouts over the radio as Xky and both Najawas tried to relay the position of enemy ships to each other, with mixed results. Both Morts said nothing, not even an expleteive. There was another round of fire and suddenly Keens ship jerked violently; now it was moving in big slow arcs rather than a straight line. There was smoke pouring out from someplace, and smoke entering the cockpit too. Something had gone really wrong, but fortunately Keen had his parachute. "Hey Morty, how tough is the glass in this plane?" he asked over the comm-link. "Pretty tough, they can handle a direct hit by an antitank gun; hey wait, you've been hit! For chrissake bail out!" Keen had every intention of doing so, but first... Several craft exploded as Keens ship cut through them, he didn't have to be accurate, sheer size was enough to assure a hit. Deep down Keen was annoyed that he'd only managed to shoot down
only one craft. As his ship veered uncontrollably he simply tried to maneuver it into as much air as possible, scoring several more hits, and gasps from the radio as he almost colided with those he was protecting.

There was a series of explosions behind him and Keen decided that now was a good time to leave, the thought that he'd just ruined an expensive ship that had been specially prepared for him flitting through his mind, along with the thought that it had been specially designed to fail. As the ground whirled crazily beneath him he popped open the canopy and jumped. Apart from being hit by the ship as it spun Keen executeda perfect escape. He watched it plummet beneath him, explode in midair like a brilliant firework and continue its descent in pieces. Sadly, having almost been hit as it fell below him, he now had to dodge as he fell through the explosion, coughing as smoke blinded and choked him. Small piecees of hot metal bumbped into him lightly as he left the cloud behind, singeing his hair and clothing. "Just great" Keen thought "And I just had this washed too!" However, once free from the possibility of injury, the ride down was quite pleasant; there was a feeling of weightlessness and speed, tempered by the fact that the ground was slowly getting closer... In a few miniutes he'd have to open the chute, land, and somehow infiltrate Protons base, but for now everything was nice and peaceful, like that half awake moment you spend each morning in bed.

Then the craft opened fire.

*Meanwhile*

Gal shuffeled his papers somewhat nervously; the Queen and he had had a nice long talk about trade deficit and accounting systems, which had calmed him a lot and taken his mind off the crazy Vorticon who was bounding around the place. Lindsey had eventually shut her up by allowing her acess to a small [only a few acres] wardrobe, telling her to find something nice. At least everything wasn't lost; the required meeting wouldn't take place, but he could still send back a positive report and avoid demotion. He was strolling down the 23rd side passage in the west wing, heading for his ship when a blue blur pounced at him "Au Naturel!" barked the Vorticon excitedly. "Gaaah!" shrieked Gal in shock, dropping his books and papers for the second time that day. "What in hells name? You can't do that, what?" The Vorticon regarded him with an analytical stare. "Soooo, would you say you were shocked, surprised, or both?" she asked pulling a pad and pencil from nowhere [In thoery it had to be somewhere first for her to grab it, but it was probabbly best not to speculate on the possibilities.] Gal tried to talk to the Vorticon without looking at it. "I'd say put some clothing on! For chrissakes there are children here!" Laurael looked even more interested, and was scribbling furiously. "Interesting... yet my researches into 'furries' indicate such sights are a common component of the lifestyle. You said you were a furry artist and yet this disgusts you?" Gal blanched "Not that kind of artist! Have you gone mad?" Laurael gave him a cold fixed smile, it looked as if it had been painted on with ice. "Possibly! Its been a very stressful day and I may have snapped! Whee Zibble!" And with that she cartwheeled out of the room. The actual cartwheel looked pretty impressive and Gal didn't manage to avert his eyes in time. "Great, just great." he mumbled "I'm gonna need therapy for this, I just know it."

There was a voice by his ear, about the same time as a sharp cold metal blade was pressed to his throat. "Oh I dunno, you might not live that long." it said.



A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

title: Re: blanch
content:
*
Chapter 60: Further developments of things happening,
*

Keen could see nothing but the two points of light that were shooting at him; a hail of bullets whizzed over his head, followed by a quiet whirr and a blast of air as the craft followed. It hit a cloudbank and Keen just had time to see it turn before once again it became invisible against the blue sky. Keen fumbled a bit and pulled out the plasma cannon OM had supplied. His great downward velocity already counted against it, but now he had two things stopping him from being a sitting duck. Keen tried to estimate the crafts position, aimed up and waited for it to fire. At the first sign of attack Keen pulled the trigger; a bright blast of pure energy scythed through the air cutting the craft in two, the seperate halves spiraling downward before exploding in twin fireballs. About midway through his victory sumersault Keen realized he'd have to open his parachute, or beome intimately aquainted with the ground.


*Meanwhile*

Gal swalloed as he felt the pressure of the cold blade against his throat. "Ummm, can I keep holding my stuff? I don't want to have to pick it up again. My wallets in my left trouser pocket, it has only $40 in it." The figure sniggered. "You really should carry more cash. Besides, its not the money, its the killing." Just then the door burst inward and a blue blur whizzed by; it was wearing a fedora. Laurael stopped her mad dash about an inch from Gals nose, actually frothing at the mouth slightly. The figure behind Gal gasped in shock, temporarily lowering the knife slowly and giving him time to escape. The figure behind him made an attempt to stab him in the back, tripped and fell downstairs with an ungodly amount of noise. Gal made a tenative attempt to see if they were alright, only to be knocked downstairs himself by Laurael. After picking himself [and his stuff] up and checking for injuries [sadly Laurael had none] Gal examined the small pile of derbis that contained the would be assassin. What was most noticable was the large pair of feet sticking out. Large and clawed. Blue. "Another Vorticon? Oh great, you're all insane!" mumbled Gal heading off intent on locating an exit. This was made difficult by the fact that at the same time he was furiously drawing dragons on his sketchpad, something that usually calmed him down. [It was better than the medication, and he'd gotten much better since that time Percy Perks had to have that calico brush surgically removed from his nose.]These particular drawings also contained small blue creatures whose lives would be very short were they in fact in existence in the situations portrayed. Things were getting surprisingly weird surprisingly fast.

title: We're cooking with Zibble now!
content:
*
Chapter 61: Oprah
*

Keen drifted slowly groundwards, his huge but almost invisible chute bilowing above him. The landing went perfectly, however Keen had neglected to take into account the fact that he had been shot down over a rainforest. He dangled about 70 feet above the ground, trapped in the branches and tried to use his superior intellect to discern a safe way to descend. After a few miniutes he decided to use his pocketknife instead. This resulted in a very interesting 70 foot, 33 second journey exploring the various forms of rainforest ecology with special attention to dead branches and vines. The forest floor was unusually dark for someplace in the tropics, almost twilightic in intensity, and it was damp; everything glistend and dripped. Not that there was much to see; the entire forest floor was almost barren; only a few spindly saplings and the occasional fern struggled to survive in the near permanent blackness. Keen got up, dusted himself off [and found out that you could only do that with dust] picked a random direction and started walikng. The first law of fanfictioning dictated he'd find a town, or the base sooner or later.

*meanwhile...*

Lindsey sat in the middle of her private bedroom [#3, this one in the west wing] and concentrated. Once her breathing and heart rate had slowed she carefully placed the jeweled crown on her head. It immediately lit up with a faint purple glow. So far so good. A slight breze blew through the room despite the window being closed and it suddenly seemed to get cooler, darker. She held her hands out in front of her and began chanting the ancient runes. Silver sparks danced off her fingertips. "Dammit!" Lindsey rushed over to the curtains and beat out the small fire with her pillow. She kicked the ancient speel book into a corner despondently. She hated doing magic, and had ever since she'd started lessons at age five. She'd never seen the point, but fanfiction rules stated that any princess, queen or empress, especially those mentioned in computer games, had to know an ancient and mysterious form of magic. She was utterly useless at it of course but Mort had built her a wonderful armband that when surreptiously activated would make all sorts of mystic signs float in the air and even better electrocute any fans within visual range. She looked up as the door to her room creaked open. It wasn't the Vorticon, or the weird kid. He stood in the doorway with the light gently gleaming off assorted metal plating.

"Hello princess" he said.

title: Re: We're cooking with Zibble now!
content:
*
Chapter 62: Boring
*

Keen trudged down the street casually observing the ruckus around him. There was no doubt abot what was being celebrated; the giant M's emblazoned acroos every banner and sign were a clue as was the big posters declaring it 'Dependence day' [In brazilian of course, but then, Keen knew seven languages after all.] The colorscheme was the usual red and black, matching Brazils new flag declaring it a state of the mighty McMire empire. Overcome with curiousity Keen pulled a celebrant aside. "Hey; just when did Earth succumb to McMire anyway, and what happened to Commander Keen?" The young man smiled "Oh about a decade ago; just after President Bush ousted President Schwarzenegger to lead an unprecidented 4th term. And who is Commander Keen?" Keen gritted his teeth. No matter what happened, this time around things would be different. If he had to saw his own arm off Bush would not get a 4th term. He mingled with the crowd, and joined the parade down the main street. He made it pretty far before this fanfiction caught up with him and he bumped into Najawa.

*Meanwhile...*

Lorinda pouted. "I don't see why Mom had to confiscate my blaster; its only a small hole after all." Andrew stood by the now somewhat less solid nursery wall and picked a small piece of charcoal out of it. "Well you shouldn't have been shooting inside, besides with your aim, if it weren't for gravity you couldn't hit the ground!" Lorinda gave Andrew a look that, if they could kill, would have nailed him to the floor. "Huh. Its your fault we're stuck here babysitting anyways. You and your big mouth." Both looked around the sickeningly juvenile room they were imprisioned in [literally, Mort had instaled repulsion fields in the doorways.] Being part of the McMire residence it was mostly red and black [with cute dark grey rabid bunnies on the wallpaper.] In the corner Andrea had abandonded her pet zibble to ride something faster and more blue. Andrew had to contantly dodge her attempts to stun him. Obviously she had been around Lorinda too long. Lorinda sighed and looked around. "Dar Lord this is boring; and not the usual kind of boring; this comes with the added enjoyment of sitting around with a bunch of six year olds, one of whom is eight! I swear, I didn't think you could get bored to death, but this is at least managing boring me to sickness. Why doesn't anything happen?"

No sooner did she finnish speaking then there was a loud thud at one of the walls. They stared at the door; there was nobody there. The clock still ticked away on the left wall and the toybox stood near the third; the bang had come from right behind them... Andrew looked at the charcoal in his hand, then at the wall it had come from. He stepped back just in time to avoid a shower of derbis. Lroinda groaned "Thats the fourth time in as many paragraphs the fourth walls been broken! And Mom will blame me for this!" The dust settled revealing a figure standing in the hole that had been stared by Lorinda's blaster and finnished by its chaingun cannon. Harvey Smith sneered. "Blowing up a nursery, now thats what I call a good start to the week!"

Apparently Andrea hadn't been paying attention. She was now navigating right toward him. "Gaiieee! Not more naked dogs! Why are there no cloths?!" Then he collapsed. "Wow, those vorticons sure are stunning." said Andrew, smiling at his own pun. The smile faded when a shadow loomed over him and placed a shotgun to his temple. "Yeah," sneered Duke "And now we're gonna have a blast!"

title: Re: We're cooking with Zibble now!
content:
*
Chapter 63: Harveys day gets worse
*

Keen quietly sipped his cola and stared at the television screen distractedly; it was set on the Mort channel, thinly disguised propoganda and educational viewing. Currently both were showing in the form of a documentary about Morts contributions to unified field physics. Most of the 'gang' were here already [Mort himself was busy scribbling notes from the program, adding another layer to the paradoxes already present.] nearly all of them had been shot down, although OM himself had smashed his craft in a keenish maneuver. Appaently infiltration would be easier from a ground based assault. This made perfect sense once you thought about it, although why they had ho be blown up first eluded him. Around them the city bustled, caught up in the midst of the celebration. At leas the multicoloured costumes would disguise their prescence from whoever might be looking for them. Eventually the entire group arrived [Almost right after Mort had stopped taking notes, Keen noticed.] and they set out for wherever it was they were going. OM hadn't been at all clear about their destination, just that they'd be getting there on foot. ['So secret eve I don't know where it is' thought Keen] Thankfully the monotonus trip was both shortened and enlived by Keens pogoing ability. [And Najawa falling into a mud hole along the way.]

*Meanwhile...*

The years had not been kind to Duke; his constant steroid abuse had eventually caught up with him, reducing his body to a bloated red mass. [And, rumour had it shrinking his reproductive capacity to nothing.] He was overweight and balding, a far cry from his former good looks. A well placed kick reduced Andrew to his knees. Another kick sent Andrea and her mount skidding across the room with a yip and a yell. Keeping the gun trained on Andrew he swaggered boldly across the room, 'accidentally' stepping on Harvey, several times. "Okay listen up," he boomed "You're all screwed, but if you cooperate some of you will be less screwed then others. Now I-"From her sprawled position against the wall Andrea tossed something sphereical and heavy sounding toward Duke. Without flinching he kicked it duly away. It was heavy, even Dukes powerful kicks only pushed it halfway across the floor. It rolled slightly and... opened its eyes. Duke stared at it. "What the hell..."

"Zeeky Boogy Doog"

It wasn't very well constructed, being poorly sealed and the micronuclear device being rather primitive, but a 6-year old genius was a 6-year old genius, and the explosion was still pretty impressive, forcing all free objects in the room against the wall. It would have destroyed the floor if it had been built by anyone but Mort. Andrew picked himself out of the derbis and punched the air "Hah! Thats my sister! In your face!" Duke who had been closer had been pushed almost through the wall groaned and got to his feet, the layers of muscle and fat cushioning the blow. Harvey had actually managed to go straight through, leaving a small oval hole, just like in cartoons. There was now a way out, Andrew eyed it, but his sibling was still trapped.

Harvey groaned and opened his eyes; the first thing he noticed was blue; then the face above him came into focus. "Hello" said Laurael cheerfully.

"Aiiiiiiiiiiieeeeeeeeeee!"

title: Re: We're cooking with Zibble now!
content:
Well, seems I should be continuing this doesn't it?

*
Chapter 64: Pests
*

The screens flickered excitedly in the semi darkness as proton watched them intently. Currently he needed 23 screens just to keep track of what was going on. He tapped his console irritably. 'Blasted pests; just like cockroaches, there's always more of them. Oh well, time to squash a few bugs hmmmm?' He tyoed a few commands and things started to happen.

*Meanwhile...*

Gal tried the door again. Locked. Just like the others. He was starting to get a horrible feeling in the pit of his stomach, but he squashed it with a burst of logical resolve. Why would anybody lockl him in? He tried to gather his thoughts; his sketchpad was almost black with scribles now, he put it down, sat in a nearby chair, put his head in his hands and tried to think. Nothing was making sense, and for a chartered accountant that in itself was disturbing. There was a clatter and a familiar clip-clacking of clawed feet on the floor. "Hey! Guess what? There's another vorticon here!' chirped Laurael At least now she was clothed, in a polkadot shirt and purple pants. Gal wasn't surprised at the color scheme. "Thats like, three! Isn't that great? Isn't it? Huh? Huh?" This was just too much. "Look, lady, will you just shut up, or piss off!" he growled shoving the Vorticon roughly. Laurael staggered, whimpered, then fell down, a small patch of blood appeared on her shirt and grew larger. Gal bent over to take a closer look, there was something on her chest that... 'Je-ee-ee-sus christ! What the hell?" he yelled falling back. "You- what the frick is that? Oh God, you've got stitches from top to tail! How can you be standing here?" Laurael staggered uncertainly to her feet. "You just popped a few stitches, I'm fine." "Like heck you are! What'd you do? Have abdominal surgery?" gasped Gal. "I said I'm fine!" Barked Laurael in a voice that suggested that any debate on the matter would involve the large number of sharp teeth she was now barring. And with that she ran off. "Weirdo" muttered Gal, stepping off the chair he had jumped on.

*Meanwhile...*

Another wave of mechainized death fell apon the group, only to be oblitereated by the blazing plasma cannons as the group pressed slowly forward in a haze of smoke and sparks. Suddenly a large pile of spare parts moved, a showed itself to be a robot; a very, very big robot... with lots of spikes and guns. Before it could even open fire Xky was apon it, blazing furiously at what was possibly the head, or a stubby arm. ON and his younger self were close behind while the others concentrated on finding another way forward. Najawa aimed a spinning kick at the droid- and smashed straight through it. "What the..." gasped ON "This thing is armoured with... paper mache?" There was a barely auidible click. Xky looked down at where he knew the device would be hidden; ON was staring up at him, a lot closer to it than he was. "Xky," he said "I always respected you."

And then the room went white.

Xky groaned and tried to focus, his mouth tasted of blood. Nearby he could see ON who had been much closer to the bomb than him. It wasn't hard, a lot of him was spread out in a lot of places. Xky tried to get up but something pinned him, he'd been close to the explosion and had been thrown against a wall, unfortunately the wall had a number of things sticking out of it now, hard things that didn't care if a soft piece of meat happened to hit him. He stared at the large steel pipe protruding from the left side of his chest and managed to wonder if it had cracked any ribs before his body realized he had no right to be consious and he plummeted into black oblivion.

*
Chapter 65: Schisims
*

Proton stared at the image on the screen. "Drat! Blew it too soon. Nevermind, thats... three down, a dozen to go." he smiled and switched to another screen, it would be more amusing to pick them off one by one anyway.

*Meanwhile..*

OM pulled himself out of a small pile of rubble and brushed the dust from his hair. He stared at the scene for a while before the sound of Najawa coughomg up plaster broke the silence. "Damn. He was the second best righthand man I ever had." mumbled OM. Najawa stared as OM crossed the room to the fallen body of his elder self, grabbed him by the hair; and picked up his head. "Dude, thats, thats my friggin HEAD!" OM calmly took out a ziplock bag and placed ON's head inside. "Well, I owe his family a body don't I? He stared at the impaled body on the wall. "Well, Xky always said to leave him where he fell." He chuckled "Or at least in this case slumped. Skit, I guess we'll have to assume everyone else was caught in the blast. That just leaves us." He stared at Najawa for an uncomfortably long time. "Dear God I'm depressed." The passage had been blocked by the blast but a hole had been blown into another corridor so they had no choice but to follow it.

*On the other side of the pile of rubble...*

Mort groaned and pulled himself out from under the slab of ceiling that had hit him. Nearby Keen was shaking wall fragments out of his shoe. "Aaaah, what the hell happened? Not again! How many times to I have to get blown up today? Skit, I guess we'll have to assume everyone else was caught in the blast. That just leaves us." Keen looked around, the derbis blocking the passageway behind them were pretty solid, and a few miniutes searching didn't reveal any other survivors." Warily they proceeded. As they walked off Keen paused "Wait, do you hear something? I swear I heard... marching?"


*Meanwhile back on the other side of the rubble pile..."

They came from everywhere, converging on the site of the explosion. They all marched in step beating their brums in unision. Slowly they clustered around the mess, sealing the hole in the wall and using the rubble to contruct a strong blockage across the passageway. When they were done the y simply marhed off in single file the way they had come. If anybody was there to watch they'd never have noticed that there was now one more of them.

*Zipping back to OM's castle, we're going everywhere today aren't we?*

Gal found Laurael imbeling a glass of oragne juice a few miniutes later. [Yes! I used an obscure word that means drink!] He approached cautiously, the day had tended toward his injury recently and he didn't want to push it. "Hey blue chick, you dropped this card what with all the nudity and stuff." he said handing over a small square of plastic. Laurael gasped when she saw it. "Gah! My family photo! I can't believe I lost it!" Gal frowned "Family photo? The whole cards just brown!" Laurael gave the card a slurp. "Chocolate sauce." "Chocolate sauce?" "Chocoalte sauce. Helps it stick to anything, plus it hides what it is, plus it tastes good if you're hungry. Want some?" Gal backed off. "No thanks, I don't really like chocolate." Laurael advanced. "Nonsense, everyone likes chocolate! Look, I haven't touched this side!" "No, no thanks, really." "Lick the damn photo!" Defeated Gal obeyed, feeling like an absolute fool while doing so. "Hey, so this is your family? Those are your parents right? And... is that you?" Laurael looked "Nah. Thats my sister, Miss perfect."

"She's... breathing fire?"

"Yeah, all chicks can do that where I come from."

"No kiddin! Geez, she's hot then!"

"Hot? Oh I get it! As in fire! Haha! Nice joke!"

"Umm, joke... yeah. So uh, what exactly are you doing here anyway?"

Lauraels answer was cut off by a crash in the next room. Both hurried to investigate. As Gal turned the corner he stopped cold. "Mmm... mmmm" he gasped.




A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

*
Chapter 66: All leather upholstery!
*

Laurael gasped and took a step back. "OMG, its..its.. Bevan Pevarr! The mass murderer!" Gal just stared at the scene in front of him, it involved a lot of red ink and torn paper. In the middle of the room lay a sketchpad, torn to shreds, with a snapped red pen stabbed through it. Standing over it was an evilly smiling vorticon, splattered with more ink. He looked up and noticed the two figures. "Ah, you know me! Looks like I have two more to add to my score!" He advanced menacingly, claws drawn. Laurael screamed and backed up, Gal simply fell to his knees mumbling. "Mmm...mmmm" His hands scribbled sketches with an invisible pencil, they were starting to itch. Suddenly he paused, then looked at the vorticon with hatred. "Mmmy calico pen! Do you know how hard it is to get red ones?!" He sprang at the grinning vorticon, snarling. Laurael backed into a corner and watched the scene with horror until Gal stopped screaming, it took a long, long time.

*Meanwhile....*

Andrew skidded around the corner, followed closely by Lorinda and Andrea. A thunk marked the loss of a small chunk of wall as Harvey's claws tore a chunk a meter long just above Lorinda's head. Slightly further back a string of swearwords stripped the paint as Duke reloaded his shotgun, just a bit later a rather larger hole appeared in the wall; Duke was gaining.The fleeing children turned another corner- and ran smack into Xky. "Mom!" gasped the vortikid leaping into the arms of the somewhat surprised Vorticon standing nearby. A short while later Duke and Harvey appeared. Duke lowered his gun. "Nowhere to run now." he growled. The vortikid peeped out from behind its mother and growled "They're trying to kill us Mr Xky!" Xky cracked his knuckles and sighed. "Always when I'm eating!" he said, putting down his sandwich. "Almost 25 years of right handing and I can't even finnish a snack in the home of my former employer. Granted, I broke in, but still... *sigh* Klip'd; would you hold this for me?" With that he stepped forward and smiled. "So it begins."

[ZOMG! Xky? How? WTF? Will this story ever make sense?]

*
Chapter 67: T3h fanfic lives!
*

Xky awoke to a burning pain in his chest. Most people when they first awake suffer a momentary bout of panic as they ask themselves the usual questions; where am I? Who am I? Who is that Why am I snuggling a barbie doll? Oh god what did I do last night?! This is because everybody lives with just that small bit of uncertainty; a coiled silver spring in their minds. They spend all day winding it up, so every morning their brain has to do a quick spot check to make sure You didn't wander away in the night and Something Else take its place. This never troubled Xky who always knew who and where he was. Unlike most people he went from dozing to wide awake instantly. He stared at the chunk of metal protruding from his chest, took a deep breath, gasped with pain, and pushed himself away from the wall. There was a 'scloop' as he slid slowly of the impaling object and fell to the floor. He sat there for a while gasping and coughing up blood. Finally he took a deep breath and stood, slightly unsteadily, to his feet. He checked himself over for further injuries and was exceedingly grateful that he had been born with inversia, and thus had all his organs on the wrong side of his body. His left lung was punctured though; he wouldn't be doing any running soon, and he probably wouldn't be able to much at all without a projectile weapon of some kind, but if there was one thing his life had taught him, it was to stand by the family motto: Bark, bark bark bark , woof-yip. [A Rauh doesn't stop biting until their teeth fall out] He stared at the only egress left to him; the others would have assumed death, and there was no sign of them, but chances were, they went this way, either way; someone was going to pay for his injuries with interest

*Meanwhile...*

Duke stared at the figure for only a second before bringing the gun around in a gentle arc that ended in the flicking of a trigger and the appearance of a large hole in the wall. Several smaller holes appeared as Harvey randomly shot anything non-Duke and dangerous looking. Where Xky had been however there was nothing but empty space; he was now a foot to the left of his former position. Once again Duke aimed and fired, and once again Xky somehow shifted. Duke aimed a hefty kick at the annoying figure, only to find it connecting with nothing but air. His steroid addled brain finally snapped, he dropped the gun and let loose with a flurry of punches and kicks. His body was slowed by steroid and drug abuse, his fighting style was unscientific and stood no hope of winning against either martial arts of military discipline. However it had won against both on account of the fact that it is very hard to develop a proper fighting plan when a 300 pound muscled maniac is using your head as a battering ram.

Xky however was not using any technique remotely resembling either military actions or martial arts. He was simply being where the punches and kicks weren't; a superbly executed spinning kick combined with a short sharp burst of punches designed to reduce an opponent to a bruised crumpled heap worked perfectly, only somehow Xky was suddenly two feet out of reach. Duke's anger grew; it wasn't even as if the guy was fast; he just somehow seemed to never be where he should. More bullet holes appeared, some just grazing Xky as Harvey desperately tried to eliminate Xky, or possibly Duke [With him it was hard to tell] suddenly a large blue paw came out of nowhere and connected with his head; there was an odd *crrk* his neck bent, and Harvey crumpled At almost the same time Xky simply reached out and hit Duke, who fell to the floor. Both bodies lay where they had fallen, neither would rise again.

Andrew squeaked "Wow! That was awesome! Not even the Vortninja did that!" Xky turned and looked at the children severely. *Droom;* kindly take these children to their rooms, its too dangerous for them out there. If you meet any... obstacles, I'm sure you know what to do." The vorticon gave a nod and a low growl, a small flame issued from her mouth and danced a cinquepace on the end of her snout. Xky smiled to himself. "Ah, reminds me of old times; I really should've stayed in right hand manning, but I was so eager for new experiences back then, nevermind, at least now things get interesting."

*Meanwhile somewhere else...*

[Not that the last meanwhile wasn't somewhere else too, so, like, there are two Xkys here in different places, and it obvious one is from the future, or maybe not since the story didn't mention it, but anyway, they're in different places, and um, damn, I've screwed things up haven't I?]

None of the other droids paid them any attention, few were intelligent enough to anyway, and besides, they had other things to do. They came from vents and machinery, the congregated in dark hallways and marched toward their destination. If someone could somehow observe them from above and a distance they would see them converge, dozens of units forming into long lines, and each line converging on a moving point...

All except one, this one moved to its own destination. It heard the digital commands being broadcast, but paid them no attention, instead it headed towards their source. Nobody noticed another unit, wherever it was going, it had been told to, it could not be otherwise. Even if it was wearing a wristwatch.

Meanwhile the rabbotoid units moved onwards, listening to the invisible instructions they received moving to hidden commands. They didn't pause, didn't stop, they never would, even if the building collapsed, that is why they had been built, simple, effective and persistent. They headed toward their goal, cold and silent. And they kept coming and coming and coming...

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society
